llm_translation: And Rabbi Levi bar Ḥama said, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, what is the meaning of what is written, "And I will give you the tablets of stone, and the Torah, and the commandment which I have written, to teach them" (Exodus 24:12). "Tablets" - these are the Ten Commandments, "Torah" - this is the Scripture, "and the commandment" - this is the Mishnah, "which I have written" - these are the Prophets and Writings, "to teach them" - this is the Talmud, teaching that all of them were given to Moses at Sinai.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל הַקּוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע עַל מִטָּתוֹ, כְּאִלּוּ אוֹחֵז חֶרֶב שֶׁל שְׁתֵּי פִיּוֹת בְּיָדוֹ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רוֹמְמוֹת אֵל בִּגְרוֹנָם וְחֶרֶב פִּיפִיּוֹת בְּיָדָם״, מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב אָשֵׁי: מֵרֵישָׁא דְעִנְיָנָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״יַעְלְזוּ חֲסִידִים בְּכָבוֹד יְרַנְּנוּ עַל מִשְׁכְּבוֹתָם״. וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״רוֹמְמוֹת אֵל בִּגְרוֹנָם וְחֶרֶב פִּיפִיּוֹת בְּיָדָם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Anyone who recites Shema on his bed, it is as if he holds a double-edged sword, as it is stated: “High praises of God in their mouths, and a double-edged sword in their hands” From where is it inferred Mar Zutra, and some say Rav Ashi, said: from the preceding as it is written: “Let the pious exult in glory; let them joyously sing upon their beds.” And it is written thereafter: “High praises of God in their mouths, and a double-edged sword in their hands.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Anyone who recites the Shema on his bed, it is as if he holds a double-edged sword in his hand. As it is stated: "The exaltations of God are in their throats, and a double-edged sword is in their hands." What is the implication? Mar Zutra and some say Rav Ashi: From the beginning of the matter, as it is written: "Let the pious exult in glory; let them sing for joy upon their beds." And it is written further: "The exaltations of God are in their throats, and a double-edged sword is in their hands."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל הַקּוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע עַל מִטָּתוֹ — מַזִּיקִין בְּדֵילִין הֵימֶנּוּ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְנֵי רֶשֶׁף יַגְבִּיהוּ עוּף״, וְאֵין ״עוּף״ אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲתָעִיף עֵינֶיךָ בּוֹ וְאֵינֶנּוּ״. וְאֵין ״רֶשֶׁף״ אֶלָּא מַזִּיקִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מְזֵי רָעָב וּלְחֻמֵי רֶשֶׁף וְקֶטֶב מְרִירִי״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Anyone who recites Shema upon his bed, demons stay away from him. as it is stated: and the sparks [ reshef ] fly [ uf ] upward” fly [ uf ] nothing other than Torah, as it is stated: “Will you set your eyes upon it? It is gone; “sparks” nothing other than demons, as it is stated: “Wasting of hunger, and the devouring of the sparks [ reshef ] and bitter destruction [ ketev meriri ],
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Anyone who recites the Shema on his bed - harmful and harmful they remove from him. As it is said: "And the sons of Reshef will raise up birds," and "birds" is nothing but Torah, as it is said: "Have you found honey? Eat as much as is sufficient for you, lest you be filled with it and vomit it." And "Reshef" is nothing but harmful spirits, as it is said: "The pangs of hunger, the arrows of Reshef, and bitter destruction."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: כׇּל הָעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה — יִסּוּרִין בְּדֵילִין הֵימֶנּוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְנֵי רֶשֶׁף יַגְבִּיהוּ עוּף״. וְאֵין ״עוּף״ אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״הֲתָעִיף עֵינֶיךָ בּוֹ וְאֵינֶנּוּ״, וְאֵין ״רֶשֶׁף״ אֶלָּא יִסּוּרִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מְזֵי רָעָב וּלְחֻמֵי רֶשֶׁף״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: If one engages in Torah suffering stays away from him, as it is stated: “And the sparks fly upward.” fly nothing other than Torah, as it is stated: “Will you set your eyes upon it? It is gone; nothing other than suffering, as it is stated: “Wasting of hunger, and the devouring of the sparks,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Anyone who engages in Torah study - afflictions are separated from him, as it is stated: "And the sons of Reshef will fly." And "fly" refers only to Torah, as it is stated: "Do you set your eyes on it, and it is gone." And "Reshef" refers only to afflictions, as it is stated: "From the fangs of hunger and the bread of affliction."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָא אֲפִילּוּ תִּינוֹקוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן, יוֹדְעִין אוֹתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיֹּאמֶר אִם שָׁמוֹעַ תִּשְׁמַע לְקוֹל ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ וְהַיָּשָׁר בְּעֵינָיו תַּעֲשֶׂה וְהַאֲזַנְתָּ לְמִצְוֹתָיו וְשָׁמַרְתָּ כׇּל חֻקָּיו כׇּל הַמַּחֲלָה אֲשֶׁר שַׂמְתִּי בְמִצְרַיִם לֹא אָשִׂים עָלֶיךָ כִּי אֲנִי ה׳ רוֹפְאֶךָ״. אֶלָּא: כׇּל שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לַעֲסוֹק בַּתּוֹרָה וְאֵינוֹ עוֹסֵק — הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מֵבִיא עָלָיו יִסּוּרִין מְכוֹעָרִין וְעוֹכְרִין אוֹתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נֶאֱלַמְתִּי דוּמִיָּה הֶחֱשֵׁיתִי מִטּוֹב וּכְאֵבִי נֶעְכָּר״, וְאֵין ״טוֹב״ אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לֶקַח טוֹב נָתַתִּי לָכֶם תּוֹרָתִי אַל תַּעֲזֹבוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: Even schoolchildren, know this as it is stated: “And He said you shall surely hear the voice of the Lord your God, and what is upright in His eyes you shall do and you shall listen to His mitzvot and guard His statutes; any disease that I have placed upon Egypt I will not place upon you for I am the Lord your healer” Rather, Anyone who is able to engage in Torah yet does not engage the Holy One, Blessed be He, brings upon him hideous afflictions, and trouble him, as it is stated: “I was mute with silence; I was silent from good, and my pain was strong” good nothing other than Torah, as it is stated: “For I have given you a good portion, My Torah, do not abandon it”
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yochanan: Behold even the infants of the schoolhouse know him, as it is said, "And He said, 'If you will diligently listen to the voice of the Lord your God, and do what is right in His eyes, and give ear to His commandments, and keep all His statutes, I will put none of the diseases on you that I put on the Egyptians, for I am the Lord, your healer.'" Rather, anyone who has the ability to engage in Torah study but does not do so, the Holy One, blessed be He, brings upon him severe and repugnant sufferings, as it is said, "I was mute; I was silent; I refrained from speaking even of good, and my pain was stirred up." And "good" refers only to Torah, as it is said, "For I give you good instruction; do not forsake my Torah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: בֹּא וּרְאֵה שֶׁלֹּא כְּמִדַּת הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וָדָם. מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וָדָם, אָדָם מוֹכֵר חֵפֶץ לַחֲבֵירוֹ, מוֹכֵר עָצֵב, וְלוֹקֵחַ שָׂמֵחַ, אֲבָל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֵינוֹ כֵּן, נָתַן לָהֶם תּוֹרָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — וְשָׂמַח, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לֶקַח טוֹב נָתַתִּי לָכֶם תּוֹרָתִי אַל תַּעֲזֹבוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira, and some say Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa, said: Come and see how the characteristics of the Holy One, Blessed be He, are unlike the characteristics of flesh and blood. It is characteristic of flesh and blood that when one sells an object to another the seller grieves and the buyer rejoices. With regard to the Holy One, Blessed be He, this is not so. He gave the Torah to Israel and rejoiced, as it is stated: “For I have given you a good portion, My Torah, do not abandon it.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, and some say it was Rabbi Chanina bar Papa: Come and see that the measure of the Holy One, blessed be He, is not like the measure of flesh and blood. The measure of flesh and blood is that a person sells an object to his fellow, the seller is sad, and the buyer is happy. But the Holy One, blessed be He, is not so; He gave them the Torah to Israel — and rejoiced, as it is said: "For I have given you a good teaching; do not forsake My Torah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב חִסְדָּא: אִם רוֹאֶה אָדָם שֶׁיִּסּוּרִין בָּאִין עָלָיו — יְפַשְׁפֵּשׁ בְּמַעֲשָׂיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נַחְפְּשָׂה דְרָכֵינוּ וְנַחְקֹרָה וְנָשׁוּבָה עַד ה׳״. פִּשְׁפֵּשׁ וְלֹא מָצָא — יִתְלֶה בְּבִטּוּל תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַשְׁרֵי הַגֶּבֶר אֲשֶׁר תְּיַסְּרֶנּוּ יָּהּ וּמִתּוֹרָתְךָ תְלַמְּדֶנּוּ״.
human_translation: Rava, and some say Rav Ḥisda, said: If a person sees that suffering has befallen him, he should examine his actions. as it is stated: “We will search and examine our ways, and return to God” If he examined found no he may attribute to dereliction of Torah. as it is stated: “Happy is the man whom You punish, Lord, and teach out of Your law”
llm_translation: Rava said, and some say Rav Ḥisda said: If a person sees that sufferings are coming upon him, he should examine his actions, as it is stated: "Let us search and examine our ways, and return to the Lord." If he examined and did not find any wrongdoing, he should attribute it to neglect of Torah study, as it is stated: "Happy is the man whom You discipline, O Lord, and teach from Your Torah."

hebrew_text: וְאִם תָּלָה וְלֹא מָצָא — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁיִּסּוּרִין שֶׁל אַהֲבָה הֵם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי אֶת אֲשֶׁר יֶאֱהַב ה׳ יוֹכִיחַ״.
human_translation: And if he did attribute and did not find he may be confident that these are afflictions of love, as it is stated: “For whom the Lord loves, He rebukes,
llm_translation: And if he hung and did not find — it is known that they are the chastisements of love, as it is said: "For whom the Lord loves, He rebukes."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, אָמַר רַב סְחוֹרָה, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כׇּל שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא חָפַץ בּוֹ — מְדַכְּאוֹ בְּיִסּוּרִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַה׳ חָפֵץ דַּכְּאוֹ הֶחֱלִי״.
human_translation: Rava said Rav Seḥora said Rav Huna said: Anyone in whom the Holy One, Blessed be He, delights, He oppresses him with suffering, as it is stated: “Yet in whom the Lord delights, He oppresses him with disease;
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Sechora said, Rav Huna said: Anyone whom the Holy One, blessed be He, desires, He afflicts him with suffering, as it is stated: "And the Lord desired to crush him, He made him ill."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ לֹא קִבְּלָם מֵאַהֲבָה? — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִם תָּשִׂים אָשָׁם נַפְשׁוֹ״, מָה אָשָׁם לְדַעַת, אַף יִסּוּרִין — לְדַעַת.
human_translation: might if he does not accept with love. Therefore the verse teaches: “If his soul would offer itself in guilt.” Just as a guilt-offering is brought knowingly, so too suffering knowingly.
llm_translation: I can even if not accepted from love? — Scripture says: "If he shall set an Asham for his soul," just as Asham is for intentional sins, so too afflictions are for sins of intention.

hebrew_text: וְאִם קִבְּלָם מַה שְּׂכָרוֹ: ״יִרְאֶה זֶרַע יַאֲרִיךְ יָמִים״. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁתַּלְמוּדוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים בְּיָדוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְחֵפֶץ ה׳ בְּיָדוֹ יִצְלָח״.
human_translation: And if one accepts what is his reward? “That he might see his children, lengthen his days.” Moreover, his study will endure as it is stated: “The purpose of the Lord,” “might prosper by his hand.”
llm_translation: "And if he accepted them, what is his reward: 'He will see offspring, he will prolong days.' And not only that, but his learning is fulfilled in his hand, as it is said: 'And the desire of the Lord will succeed in his hand.'"

hebrew_text: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי וְרַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא. חַד אָמַר: אֵלּוּ הֵם יִסּוּרִין שֶׁל אַהֲבָה — כׇּל שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן בִּטּוּל תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַשְׁרֵי הַגֶּבֶר אֲשֶׁר תְּיַסְּרֶנּוּ יָּהּ וּמִתּוֹרָתְךָ תְלַמְּדֶנּוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi and Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina disagree. One said: Afflictions of love are any that do not cause dereliction of Torah, as it is stated: “Happy is the man whom You afflict, Lord, and teach from Your Torah.”
llm_translation: They disputed it: Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi and Rabbi Acha bar Chanina. One said: These are the afflictions of love - anything that does not have Torah nullification in it, as it is stated: "Happy is the man whom You, God, correct, and from Your Torah You teach him."

hebrew_text: וְחַד אָמַר: אֵלּוּ הֵן יִסּוּרִין שֶׁל אַהֲבָה — כׇּל שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן בִּטּוּל תְּפִלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּרוּךְ אֱלֹהִים אֲשֶׁר לֹא הֵסִיר תְּפִלָּתִי וְחַסְדּוֹ מֵאִתִּי״.
human_translation: And one said: Afflictions of love are any that do not cause dereliction of prayer, as it is stated: “Blessed is God Who did not turn away my prayer”
llm_translation: And one said: These are the afflictions of love - anything that does not have nullification of prayer in them, as it is stated: "Blessed be God, who has not removed my prayer and His kindness from me."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ יִסּוּרִין שֶׁל אַהֲבָה הֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״כִּי אֶת אֲשֶׁר יֶאֱהַב ה׳ יוֹכִיחַ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, said: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, said Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: Both, are afflictions of love, it is stated: “For whom He loves, He rebukes,”
llm_translation: He said to them, Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Chiya Bar Abba, thus said Rabbi Chiya Bar Abba, Rabbi Yochanan said: These and these are the chastisements of love, as it is said, "For whom the Lord loves, He reproves."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וּמִתּוֹרָתְךָ תְלַמְּדֶנּוּ״ — אַל תִּקְרֵי ״תְלַמְּדֶנּוּ״, אֶלָּא תְלַמְּדֵנוּ. דָּבָר זֶה — מִתּוֹרָתְךָ תְּלַמְּדֵנוּ.
human_translation: What then, the verse states: “And teach him from Your Torah”? Do not read and teach teach him rather, and teach us You teach us this from Your Torah.
llm_translation: Rather, what is the Talmud to say "and from Your Torah teach us" - do not read "teach us," rather, teach us. This matter - from Your Torah teach us.

hebrew_text: קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִשֵּׁן וָעַיִן. מַה שֵּׁן וָעַיִן שֶׁהֵן אֶחָד מֵאֵבָרָיו שֶׁל אָדָם — עֶבֶד יוֹצֵא בָּהֶן לְחֵרוּת, יִסּוּרִין שֶׁמְּמָרְקִין כׇּל גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: an a fortiori inference from the tooth and eye The tooth and eye are a single limb of a person the slave thereby obtains his freedom; suffering that cleanses a person’s entire body all the more so
llm_translation: Light and heavy from tooth and eye. Just as tooth and eye, which are one of the limbs of a person - a slave goes out with them to freedom, afflictions that cleanse his entire body - how much more so.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: נֶאֱמַר ״בְּרִית״ בְּמֶלַח, וְנֶאֱמַר ״בְּרִית״ בְּיִסּוּרִין, נֶאֱמַר ״בְּרִית״ בְּמֶלַח, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא תַשְׁבִּית מֶלַח בְּרִית״ וְנֶאֱמַר ״בְּרִית״ בְּיִסּוּרִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֵלֶּה דִבְרֵי הַבְּרִית״, מַה ״בְּרִית״ הָאָמוּר בְּמֶלַח — מֶלַח מְמַתֶּקֶת אֶת הַבָּשָׂר, אַף ״בְּרִית״ הָאָמוּר בְּיִסּוּרִין — יִסּוּרִין מְמָרְקִין כׇּל עֲוֹנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם.
human_translation: And that is Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, as Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: covenant is used with regard to salt, and covenant is used with regard to afflictions. covenant is used with regard to salt, as it is written: “The salt of the covenant should not be excluded And covenant is used with regard to afflictions, as it is written: “These are the words of the covenant” Just as, the covenant mentioned with regard to salt, the salt sweetens the meat so too the covenant mentioned with regard to suffering, the suffering cleanses a person’s transgressions,
llm_translation: And this is what Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: It is stated "covenant" in salt, and it is stated "covenant" in afflictions. It is stated "covenant" in salt, as it is written: "And you shall not destroy the covenant of salt." And it is stated "covenant" in afflictions, as it is written: "These are the words of the covenant." Just as the "covenant" mentioned in salt sweetens the flesh, so too the "covenant" mentioned in afflictions purges all the sins of a person.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי אוֹמֵר: שָׁלֹשׁ מַתָּנוֹת טוֹבוֹת נָתַן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְכוּלָּן לֹא נְתָנָן אֶלָּא עַל יְדֵי יִסּוּרִין, אֵלּוּ הֵן: תּוֹרָה וְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְהָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: it was taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, gave Israel three precious gifts, all of which were given only by means of suffering, Torah, Eretz Yisrael, and the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: Three good gifts the Holy One, blessed be He, gave to Israel, and all of them He gave only through suffering. These are: Torah, the Land of Israel, and the World to Come.

hebrew_text: תּוֹרָה מִנַּיִן — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַשְׁרֵי הַגֶּבֶר אֲשֶׁר תְּיַסְּרֶנּוּ יָּהּ וּמִתּוֹרָתְךָ תְלַמְּדֶנּוּ״.
human_translation: From where Torah As it is said: “Happy is the man whom You afflict, Lord,” “And teach from Your Torah.”
llm_translation: Torah from where - as it says: "Happy is the man whom You, God, correct, and from Your Torah You teach him."

hebrew_text: אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי כַּאֲשֶׁר יְיַסֵּר אִישׁ אֶת בְּנוֹ ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ מְיַסְּרֶךָּ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״כִּי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ מְבִיאֲךָ אֶל אֶרֶץ טוֹבָה״.
human_translation: Eretz Yisrael, as it is written: “As a man rebukes his son, so the Lord your God rebukes you” and it is written thereafter: “For the Lord your God will bring you to a good land.”
llm_translation: The Land of Israel, as it is written: "For as a man chastens his son, so the Lord your God chastens you," and it is also written thereafter: "For the Lord your God brings you into a good land."

hebrew_text: הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי נֵר מִצְוָה וְתוֹרָה אוֹר וְדֶרֶךְ חַיִּים תּוֹכְחוֹת מוּסָר״.
human_translation: The World-to-Come, as it is written: “For the mitzva is a lamp, the Torah is light, and the reproofs of instruction are the way of life”
llm_translation: The world to come, as it is written: "For a mitzvah is a lamp and the Torah is light, and reproofs of discipline are the way of life."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הָעוֹסֵק בְּתוֹרָה וּבִגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan: If one engages in Torah and acts of charity
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rabbi Yochanan: "Anyone who engages in Torah study and in acts of loving-kindness."

hebrew_text: וְקוֹבֵר אֶת בָּנָיו — מוֹחֲלִין לוֹ עַל כׇּל עֲוֹנוֹתָיו.
human_translation: and buries his sons, all his transgressions are forgiven.
llm_translation: And burying his sons — they forgive him for all his sins.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּשְׁלָמָא תּוֹרָה וּגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּחֶסֶד וֶאֱמֶת יְכֻפַּר עָוֹן״. ״חֶסֶד״ — זוֹ גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רוֹדֵף צְדָקָה וָחָסֶד יִמְצָא חַיִּים צְדָקָה וְכָבוֹד״. ״אֱמֶת״ — זוֹ תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱמֶת קְנֵה וְאַל תִּמְכֹּר״. אֶלָּא ״קוֹבֵר אֶת בָּנָיו״ מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: Granted, Torah and acts of charity, as it is written: “With mercy and truth, iniquity is expiated” mercy refers to acts of charity, as it is stated: “He who pursues charity and mercy finds life, charity and honor” And truth refers to Torah, as it is stated: “Buy truth and do not sell it; However, from where is it derived one who buries his sons
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yochanan: With regard to Torah and acts of loving-kindness, as it is written: "By kindness and truth iniquity is expiated." "Kindness" - this is acts of loving-kindness, as it is stated: "He who pursues righteousness and kindness will find life, righteousness, and honor." "Truth" - this is Torah, as it is stated: "Acquire truth and do not sell it." But where is the source for "burying his sons" considered an act of loving-kindness derived from?

hebrew_text: תְּנָא לֵיהּ הַהוּא סָבָא, מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: אָתְיָא, ״עָוֹן״ ״עָוֹן״. כְּתִיב הָכָא ״בְּחֶסֶד וֶאֱמֶת יְכֻפַּר עָוֹן״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם ״וּמְשַׁלֵּם עֲוֹן אָבוֹת אֶל חֵיק בְּנֵיהֶם״.
human_translation: a certain elder taught him in the name of Rabbi Shimon bar Yoḥai: is derived iniquity iniquity. Here, it is written: “With mercy and truth, iniquity is expiated,” and there it is written: “He repays the iniquity of the fathers onto the bosom of their children”
llm_translation: The elder taught it in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: It comes, "sin, sin." It is written here, "With kindness and truth, iniquity is atoned for," and it is written there, "and He repays the iniquity of fathers into the bosom of their children."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: נְגָעִים וּבָנִים — אֵינָן יִסּוּרִין שֶׁל אַהֲבָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Leprosy and children are not afflictions of love.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Negaim and Banim - they are not afflictions of love.

hebrew_text: וּנְגָעִים לָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: כׇּל מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ אֶחָד מֵאַרְבָּעָה מַרְאוֹת נְגָעִים הַלָּלוּ — אֵינָן אֶלָּא מִזְבַּח כַּפָּרָה!
human_translation: leprosy not Didn’t we learn If one has any of the four signs of leprosy they are nothing other than an altar of atonement?
llm_translation: "And plagues not? And it was taught: Anyone who has one of these four signs of plagues - they are nothing but purification offerings!"

hebrew_text: מִזְבַּח כַּפָּרָה — הָווּ, יִסּוּרִין שֶׁל אַהֲבָה — לָא הָווּ.
human_translation: are an altar of atonement they are not an affliction of love.
llm_translation: Altar of atonement - they were, afflictions of love - they were not.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא — לָן. וְהָא — לְהוּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say This is for us And that is for them
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This — for us. And this — for them.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא — בְּצִנְעָא, הָא — בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say This concealed But that visible
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This — in private, this — in public.

hebrew_text: וּבָנִים לָא?! הֵיכִי דָמֵי, אִילֵּימָא דַּהֲווֹ לְהוּ וּמֵתוּ, וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דֵּין גַּרְמָא דַּעֲשִׂירָאָה בִּיר? אֶלָּא הָא — דְּלָא הֲווֹ לֵיהּ כְּלָל. וְהָא — דַּהֲווֹ לֵיהּ וּמֵתוּ.
human_translation: And children not What are the circumstances? If you say that he had and they died, didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say, This is the bone of my tenth son? Rather, one who has no and when one had who died,
llm_translation: Sons, no?! How so? If they were born and died, but didn't Rabbi Yochanan say, "The decree of a rich man's wife"? Rather, this is because they were not at all. But this is because they were born and died.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא חֲלַשׁ. עָל לְגַבֵּיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲבִיבִין עָלֶיךָ יִסּוּרִין? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֹא הֵן וְלֹא שְׂכָרָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי יְדָךְ. יְהַב לֵיהּ יְדֵיהּ, וְאוֹקְמֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, fell ill. entered to him, and said to him: Is your suffering dear to you? said to him: neither nor its reward, said to him: Give me your hand. gave him his hand, and stood him up
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba fell ill. Rabbi Yochanan came to visit him and said to him: "Are afflictions beloved to you?" He replied: "Neither them nor their reward." Rabbi Yochanan said to him: "Give me your hand." He gave him his hand, and he raised him up.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן חֲלַשׁ. עָל לְגַבֵּיהּ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲבִיבִין עָלֶיךָ יִסּוּרִין? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֹא הֵן וְלֹא שְׂכָרָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי יְדָךְ. יְהַב לֵיהּ יְדֵיהּ, וְאוֹקְמֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan fell ill. Rabbi Ḥanina entered to him, said to him: Is your suffering dear to you? said to him: neither nor its reward. said to him: Give me your hand. He gave him his hand, and stood him up
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan became weak. Rabbi Chanina visited him. He said to him: Are afflictions beloved to you? He said to him: Neither them nor their reward. He said to him: Give me your hand. He gave him his hand, and he raised him up.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי, לוֹקִים רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ?
human_translation: Why let Rabbi Yoḥanan stand himself up.
llm_translation: "Why does Rabbi Yochanan establish the law for himself?"

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: אֵין חָבוּשׁ מַתִּיר עַצְמוֹ מִבֵּית הָאֲסוּרִים.
human_translation: they say: A prisoner cannot free himself from prison,
llm_translation: They said: A prisoner does not release himself from the prison.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר חֲלַשׁ. עַל לְגַבֵּיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. חֲזָא דַּהֲוָה קָא גָּנֵי בְּבֵית אָפֵל. גַּלְיֵיהּ לִדְרָעֵיהּ וּנְפַל נְהוֹרָא. חַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה קָא בָּכֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי קָא בָּכֵית? אִי מִשּׁוּם תּוֹרָה דְּלָא אַפֵּשְׁתְּ — שָׁנִינוּ: אֶחָד הַמַּרְבֶּה וְאֶחָד הַמַּמְעִיט, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיְּכַוֵּין לִבּוֹ לַשָּׁמַיִם. וְאִי מִשּׁוּם מְזוֹנֵי — לֹא כׇּל אָדָם זוֹכֶה לִשְׁתֵּי שֻׁלְחָנוֹת. וְאִי מִשּׁוּם בְּנֵי — דֵּין גַּרְמָא דַּעֲשִׂירָאָה בִּיר.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, fell ill. Rabbi Yoḥanan entered saw that he was lying in a dark room. exposed his arm, and light filling the house. saw that was crying, said to him: Why are you crying? If because you did not study much Torah we learned: One who brings a substantial and one who brings a meager as long as he directs his heart toward Heaven. If because sustenance not every person merits two tables, If over children this is the bone of my tenth son,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar fell ill. Rabbi Yochanan visited him. He saw that he was lying in a dark room. He uncovered his arm and the light fell upon it. He saw that Rabbi Elazar was crying. He said to him: Why are you crying? If it is because of Torah study that you have not succeeded — we learned: whether one increases or decreases, as long as his heart is directed towards Heaven. And if it is because of sustenance — not everyone merits to have two tables. And if it is because of children — the decree of the Creator is in the city.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְהַאי שׁוּפְרָא דְּבָלֵי בְּעַפְרָא קָא בָּכֵינָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַל דָּא וַדַּאי קָא בָּכֵית, וּבְכוֹ תַּרְוַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: said to I am crying over this beauty that will decompose in the earth, Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: Over this, it is certainly to weep. Both cried
llm_translation: He said to him: For this jug of wine, I am crying in the dust. He said to him: Indeed, for this and for that you are crying, and both are true.

hebrew_text: אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲבִיבִין עָלֶיךָ יִסּוּרִין? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֹא הֵן וְלֹא שְׂכָרָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי יְדָךְ, יְהַב לֵיהּ יְדֵיהּ, וְאוֹקְמֵיהּ.
human_translation: Meanwhile, said to him: Is your suffering dear to you? said to him: neither nor its reward. said to him: Give me your hand. gave him his hand, and stood him up
llm_translation: So thus and thus he said to him: "Are afflictions beloved to you?" He said to him: "No, neither them nor their reward." He said to him: "Give me your hand," he gave him his hand, and he raised him up

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא תְּקִיפוּ לֵיהּ אַרְבַּע מְאָה דַּנֵּי דְחַמְרָא. עָל לְגַבֵּיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה אֲחוּהּ דְּרַב סַלָּא חֲסִידָא וְרַבָּנַן, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה וְרַבָּנַן, וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לְעַיֵּין מָר בְּמִילֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: וּמִי חֲשִׁידְנָא בְּעֵינַיְיכוּ? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מִי חֲשִׁיד קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא דְּעָבֵיד דִּינָא בְּלָא דִּינָא?!
human_translation: Four hundred barrels of Rav Huna’s wine fermented Rav Yehuda, the brother of Rav Sala the Pious, along with the Sages, and some say Rav Adda bar Ahava, along with the Sages, entered to visit him, and said: The Master should examine his actions, said to them: Am I suspect in your eyes? They said to him: Is the Holy One, Blessed be He, suspect that He exacts punishment without justice?
llm_translation: Rav Huna was stringent with him four hundred barrels of wine. Rav Yehuda his brother, the son of Rav Sala the pious, and the Rabbis were sitting with him, and they said to him: Rav Adda bar Ahava and the Rabbis. And they said to him: The Master should look into his words. He said to them: Do you suspect me in your eyes? They said to him: Does the Holy One, blessed be He, act without justice?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי אִיכָּא מַאן דִּשְׁמִיעַ עֲלַי מִלְּתָא — לֵימָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הָכִי שְׁמִיעַ לָן, דְּלָא יָהֵיב מָר שְׁבִישָׁא לַאֲרִיסֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to them: If someone has heard something let him say so. They said to him: We have heard that the Master does not give grapevines to his tenant farmers.
llm_translation: He said to them: If there is anyone who heard something about me - let him say. They said to him: Thus we have heard, that the master did not give a field to his tenant.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִי קָא שָׁבֵיק לִי מִידֵּי מִינֵּיהּ? הָא קָא גָנֵיב לֵיהּ כּוּלֵּיהּ!
human_translation: said to Does leave me anything from He steals it all.
llm_translation: He said to them: Who has removed from me my drink? He has stolen it all!

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הַיְינוּ דְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: ״בָּתַר גַּנָּבָא גְּנוֹב, וְטַעְמָא טְעֵים״. אֲמַר לְהוּ: קַבֵּילְנָא עָלַי דְּיָהֵיבְנָא לֵיהּ. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: הֲדַר חַלָּא וַהֲוָה חַמְרָא. וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: אִייַּקַּר חַלָּא, וְאִיזְדְּבַן בִּדְמֵי דְחַמְרָא.
human_translation: They said to him: That is the folk saying: One who steals from a thief has a taste of theft. He said to them: I accept upon myself to give Some say his vinegar turned back into wine, and some say that the price of vinegar rose and it was sold at the price of wine.
llm_translation: They said to him: This is what people say, "After the thief, stolen, and the reason, tasted." He said to them: Accept upon me that I will give it to him. Some say: The vinegar returned and became wine. And some say: If vinegar is precious, it turns into blood of wine.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אַבָּא בִּנְיָמִין אוֹמֵר: עַל שְׁנֵי דְבָרִים הָיִיתִי מִצְטַעֵר כׇּל יָמַי — עַל תְּפִלָּתִי שֶׁתְּהֵא לִפְנֵי מִטָּתִי, וְעַל מִטָּתִי שֶׁתְּהֵא נְתוּנָה בֵּין צָפוֹן לְדָרוֹם. ״עַל תְּפִלָּתִי שֶׁתְּהֵא לִפְנֵי מִטָּתִי״, מַאי ״לִפְנֵי מִטָּתִי״? אִילֵּימָא ״לִפְנֵי מִטָּתִי״ מַמָּשׁ, וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַב, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מִנַּיִן לַמִּתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא דָּבָר חוֹצֵץ בֵּינוֹ לְבֵין הַקִּיר — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּסֵּב חִזְקִיָּהוּ פָּנָיו אֶל הַקִּיר וַיִּתְפַּלֵּל״? לָא תֵּימָא, ״לִפְנֵי מִטָּתִי״, אֶלָּא אֵימָא ״סָמוּךְ לְמִטָּתִי״.
human_translation: It was taught Abba Binyamin say: All of my life I have taken great pains with regard to two things: That my prayer should be before my bed and that my bed should be placed north to south. That my prayer should be before my bed, what does before my bed If you say literally before his bed Rav Yehuda said Rav said, and some say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi From where that one who prays should have nothing separating between him and the wall? As it is stated: “And Hezekiah turned to face the wall and prayed” do not say before my bed rather, say adjacent to bed;
llm_translation: It was taught: Abba Binyamin says: I have been distressed all my days over two things - that my prayer should be before my bed, and that my bed should be placed north-south. "Before my bed," what is meant by "before my bed"? If you say, literally before my bed, but didn't Rav Yehudah say in the name of Rav, and some say it was Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: From where do we learn that one who prays should not have any barrier between himself and the wall? As it is stated: "And Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed." Do not say, "before my bed," rather say, "adjacent to my bed."

hebrew_text: ״וְעַל מִטָּתִי שֶׁתְּהֵא נְתוּנָה בֵּין צָפוֹן לַדָּרוֹם״.
human_translation: And my bed should be placed north to south
llm_translation: "And on my bed, may it be placed between north and south."

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל הַנּוֹתֵן מִטָּתוֹ בֵּין צָפוֹן לְדָרוֹם הָוְיִין לֵיהּ בָּנִים זְכָרִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּצְפוּנְךָ תְּמַלֵּא בִטְנָם יִשְׂבְּעוּ בָנִים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama said Rabbi Ḥanina said Rabbi Yitzḥak said: One who places his bed facing north to south will male children, as it is stated: “And whose belly You fill with Your treasure [ utzfunekha ], who have sons in plenty
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said in the name of Rabbi Yitzḥak: Anyone who places his bed between north and south will have male children, as it is stated: "And your offspring shall possess the gate of their enemies."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: אַף אֵין אִשְׁתּוֹ מַפֶּלֶת נְפָלִים. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וּצְפוּנְךָ תְּמַלֵּא בִּטְנָם״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וַיִּמְלְאוּ יָמֶיהָ לָלֶדֶת וְהִנֵּה תוֹמִים בְּבִטְנָהּ״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Moreover, his wife will not miscarry. It is written here: “And whose belly You fill [ temaleh ] with Your treasure,” and it is written there, “And her time to give birth was fulfilled [ vayimle’u ] and there were twins in her belly”
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Also his wife does not miscarry fetuses. It is written here: "And your offspring shall fill the belly," and it is written there: "And her days to give birth were completed, and behold, there were twins in her womb."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא. אַבָּא בִּנְיָמִין אוֹמֵר: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ לְהִתְפַּלֵּל. וְקָדַם אֶחָד מֵהֶם לְהִתְפַּלֵּל, וְלֹא הִמְתִּין אֶת חֲבֵרוֹ. וְיָצָא. טוֹרְפִין לוֹ תְּפִלָּתוֹ בְּפָנָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״טֹרֵף נַפְשׁוֹ בְּאַפּוֹ הַלְמַעַנְךָ תֵּעָזַב אָרֶץ״.
human_translation: was taught Abba Binyamin says: If two enter in order to pray, and one began praying before and did not wait for the other and left his prayer is thrown back in his face. as it is stated: “You who throw your soul in your face, for your sake will the earth be forsaken?
llm_translation: It was taught: Abba Benjamin says: Two who entered to pray. And one of them preceded to pray, and did not wait for his friend. And he left. His prayer is torn before Him, as it is said: "He who is hasty with his feet sins."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁגּוֹרֵם לַשְּׁכִינָה שֶׁתִּסְתַּלֵּק מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיֶעְתַּק צוּר מִמְקֹמוֹ״. וְאֵין ״צוּר״ אֶלָּא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: צוּר יְלָדְךָ תֶּשִׁי״.
human_translation: Not only that, but it causes the Divine Presence to remove itself from Israel, as it is stated “The Rock will be moved from its place.” And Rock means nothing other than the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “Of the Rock that gave birth to you, you have been unmindful,
llm_translation: And not only that, but it causes the Shechinah to depart from Israel, as it is stated: "And the Rock will be removed from its place." And "Rock" is none other than the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is stated: "The Rock, His work is perfect."

hebrew_text: וְאִם הִמְתִּין לוֹ מַה שְּׂכָרוֹ?
human_translation: And if he waits for him
llm_translation: And if he waited for him, what is his wage?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: זוֹכֶה לַבְּרָכוֹת הַלָּלוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לוּא הִקְשַׁבְתָּ לְמִצְוֹתָי וַיְהִי כַנָּהָר שְׁלוֹמֶךָ וְצִדְקָתְךָ כְּגַלֵּי הַיָּם. וַיְהִי כַחוֹל זַרְעֶךָ וְצֶאֱצָאֵי מֵעֶיךָ״ וְגוֹ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: merits the following blessings, as it is stated: “If only you had listened to My mitzvot then your peace would be as a river, and your righteousness as the waves of the sea. Your seed would be as the sand, and the offspring of your body
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: One merits these blessings, as it is stated: "If you had heeded My commandments, your peace would have been like a river, and your righteousness like the waves of the sea. Your offspring would have been like the sand, and the descendants of your innards" and so forth.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אַבָּא בִּנְיָמִין אוֹמֵר: אִלְמָלֵי נִתְּנָה רְשׁוּת לָעַיִן לִרְאוֹת — אֵין כׇּל בְּרִיָּה יְכוֹלָה לַעֲמוֹד מִפְּנֵי הַמַּזִּיקִין.
human_translation: it was taught Abba Binyamin says: If the eye was given permission to see, no creature would be able to withstand the demons
llm_translation: It was taught: Abba Benjamin says: If permission had not been given to the eye to see, no creature would be able to withstand the harmful spirits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִינְהוּ נְפִישִׁי מִינַּן, וְקָיְימִי עֲלַן כִּי כִּסְלָא לְאוּגְיָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: They are more numerous than we and they stand over us like mounds of earth surrounding a pit.
llm_translation: Abaye said: They are greater than us, and they established for us a decree like the thickness of a beam.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כֹּל חַד וְחַד מִינַּן, אַלְפָא מִשְּׂמָאלֵיהּ וּרְבַבְתָּא מִיַּמִּינֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: Each and every one of us has a thousand to his left and ten thousand to his right.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Each and every one of us, a thousand to his left and ten thousand to his right.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי דּוּחְקָא דְּהָוֵי בְּכַלָּה — מִנַּיְיהוּ הָוֵי. הָנֵי בִּרְכֵי דְּשָׁלְהִי — מִנַּיְיהוּ. הָנֵי מָאנֵי דְרַבָּנַן דְּבָלוּ — מֵחוּפְיָא דִידְהוּ. הָנֵי כַּרְעֵי דְּמִנַּקְפָן — מִנַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rava said: The crowding at the kalla , is from those knees that are fatigued is from those clothes of the Sages that wear out, is from friction those feet that are in pain is from
llm_translation: Rava said: This narrow alley that is in the bride's possession - the rights to use it are from them. These pools that are in the town - the rights to use them. These refuse collectors of the Sages of Balu - from their own domain. These legs that are trampled - the rights to use them.

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאן דְּבָעֵי לְמִידַּע לְהוּ לַיְיתֵי קִיטְמָא נְהִילָא, וְנַהְדַּר אַפּוּרְיֵיהּ, וּבְצַפְרָא חָזֵי כִּי כַּרְעֵי דְתַרְנְגוֹלָא. הַאי מַאן דְּבָעֵי לְמֶחֱזִינְהוּ, לַיְתֵי שִׁלְיְיתָא דְּשׁוּנָּרְתָּא אוּכַּמְתָּא בַּת אוּכַּמְתָּא בּוּכְרְתָא בַּת בּוּכְרְתָא, וְלִיקְלְיֵהּ בְּנוּרָא, וְלִשְׁחֲקֵיהּ, וְלִימְלֵי עֵינֵיהּ מִנֵּיהּ, וְחָזֵי לְהוּ. וְלִשְׁדְּיֵיהּ בְּגוּבְתָּא דְפַרְזְלָא, וְלַחְתְּמֵיהּ בְּגוּשְׁפַּנְקָא דְפַרְזְלָא, דִּילְמָא גָּנְבִי מִנֵּיהּ, וְלַחְתּוֹם פּוּמֵּיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִיתַּזַּק. רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי עֲבַד הָכִי, חֲזָא וְאִתַּזַּק, בְּעוֹ רַבָּנַן רַחֲמֵי עֲלֵיהּ, וְאִתַּסִּי.
human_translation: One who seeks to know should place fine ashes around his bed, and in the morning appear like chickens’ footprints, One who seeks to see them should take the afterbirth of a firstborn female black cat, born to a firstborn female black cat, burn it in the fire, grind it and place it in his eyes, and he will see them. place in an iron tube sealed with an iron seal [ gushpanka ] lest the demons steal it from him, and seal the opening he will not be harmed. Rav Beivai bar Abaye performed this saw and was harmed. The Sages prayed for mercy on his and he was healed.
llm_translation: This one who desires to inform them, let him bring a silver pitcher, and adorn it with precious stones, and in the morning he shall see it like the legs of a rooster. This one who desires to show it to them, let him bring a glass vessel of fine crystal, like the daughter of a fine crystal, or like the daughter of a fine sapphire, and let him light it with fire, and shake it, and cover his eyes from it, and he shall see it. And let him place it in an iron casket, and seal it with a lead seal, lest someone steal it from him, and let him seal his mouth, so that he will not be harmed. Rav Bibi son of Abbaye did so, he saw and was harmed, the sages had mercy on him, and he was healed.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אַבָּא בִּנְיָמִין אוֹמֵר: אֵין תְּפִלָּה שֶׁל אָדָם נִשְׁמַעַת אֶלָּא בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לִשְׁמֹעַ אֶל הָרִנָּה וְאֶל הַתְּפִלָּה״. בִּמְקוֹם רִנָּה — שָׁם תְּהֵא תְּפִלָּה.
human_translation: It was taught Abba Binyamin said: One’s prayer is only heard in a synagogue, as it is stated to listen to the song and the prayer in a place of song, there prayer should be.
llm_translation: It was taught: Abba Benjamin says: A person's prayer is only heard in the synagogue, as it is stated: "To listen to the song and to the prayer." In a place of song - there let the prayer be.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִין בַּר רַב אַדָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִנַּיִן שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מָצוּי בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱלֹהִים נִצָּב בַּעֲדַת אֵל״.
human_translation: Ravin bar Rav Adda said Rabbi Yitzḥak said: From where that the Holy One, Blessed be He, is located in a synagogue? As it is stated: “God stands in the congregation of God;
llm_translation: Rabin son of Rav Adda said, Rabbi Yitzchak said: From where do we know that the Holy One, blessed be He, is present in the synagogue? As it is stated: "Elohim stands in the divine assembly."

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן לַעֲשָׂרָה שֶׁמִּתְפַּלְּלִין שֶׁשְּׁכִינָה עִמָּהֶם — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱלֹהִים נִצָּב בַּעֲדַת אֵל״.
human_translation: And from where ten people who pray, the Divine Presence is with them? As it is stated: “God stands in the congregation of God,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that ten who pray, the Divine Presence is with them? - As it is stated: "Elohim stands in the congregation of El." English translation: And from where do we derive that ten who pray, the Divine Presence is with them? - As it is stated: "Elohim stands in the congregation of El."

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן לִשְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁיּוֹשְׁבִין בַּדִּין שֶׁשְּׁכִינָה עִמָּהֶם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּקֶרֶב אֱלֹהִים יִשְׁפֹּט״.
human_translation: From where that three who sit in judgment, the Divine Presence is with them? as it is stated: “In the midst of the judges He judges,”
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that when three sit in judgment, the Divine Presence is with them, as it is stated: "In the midst of the gods, He will judge" (Psalms 82:1).

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן לִשְׁנַיִם שֶׁיּוֹשְׁבִין וְעוֹסְקִין בַּתּוֹרָה שֶׁשְּׁכִינָה עִמָּהֶם — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָז נִדְבְּרוּ יִרְאֵי ה׳ אִישׁ אֶל רֵעֵהוּ וַיַּקְשֵׁב ה׳״ וְגוֹ׳.
human_translation: From where that two who sit and engage in Torah the Divine Presence is with them? As it is stated: “Then they that feared the Lord spoke one with the other, and the Lord listened,
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that when two individuals sit and engage in Torah study, the Divine Presence is with them? As it is stated: "Then those who feared the Lord spoke with one another, and the Lord listened and heard" etc.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וּלְחֹשְׁבֵי שְׁמוֹ״? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: חָשַׁב אָדָם לַעֲשׂוֹת מִצְוָה, וְנֶאֱנַס, וְלֹא עֲשָׂאָהּ — מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ עֲשָׂאָהּ.
human_translation: What “And that think upon His name”? Rav Ashi said: a person intended to perform a mitzva, but due to beyond control, he did not perform it, the verse ascribes him as if he performed
llm_translation: What is "and for those who intend His name"? Rav Ashe said: If a person intended to perform a mitzvah, and was prevented, and did not do it - the Scripture credits it to him as if he had done it.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ אֶחָד שֶׁיּוֹשֵׁב וְעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה שֶׁשְּׁכִינָה עִמּוֹ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּכָל הַמָּקוֹם אֲשֶׁר אַזְכִּיר אֶת שְׁמִי אָבוֹא אֵלֶיךָ וּבֵרַכְתִּיךָ״.
human_translation: And from where that when even one who sits and engages in Torah the Divine Presence is with him? As it is stated: “In every place where I cause My Name to be mentioned, I will come to you and bless you”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that even one who sits and engages in Torah study, the Divine Presence is with him? As it is stated: "In every place where I cause My name to be mentioned, I will come to you and bless you."

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דַּאֲפִילּוּ חַד, תְּרֵי מִבַּעְיָא?! תְּרֵי — מִכַּתְבָן מִלַּיְיהוּ בְּסֵפֶר הַזִּכְרוֹנוֹת, חַד — לָא מִכַּתְבָן מִלֵּיהּ בְּסֵפֶר הַזִּכְרוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Since even one was it necessary two Two their words are written in the book of remembrance, a single words are not written in a book of remembrance.
llm_translation: And when since one, two require?! Two - from their writing in the Book of Chronicles, one - not from their writing in the Book of Chronicles.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דַּאֲפִילּוּ תְּרֵי, תְּלָתָא מִבַּעְיָא?! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: דִּינָא שְׁלָמָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, וְלָא אָתְיָא שְׁכִינָה, קָמַשְׁמַע לָן דְּדִינָא נָמֵי הַיְינוּ תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Since even two necessary three? lest you say that judgment is merely to peace and the Divine Presence does not come teaches us that judgment is also Torah.
llm_translation: And when after that even two, three are needed?! What will you say: The judgment is indeed in the world, and the Divine Presence does not come, it is evident to us that the judgment itself is also Torah.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דַּאֲפִילּוּ תְּלָתָא, עֲשָׂרָה מִבַּעְיָא?! עֲשָׂרָה — קָדְמָה שְׁכִינָה וְאָתְיָא. תְּלָתָא — עַד דְּיָתְבִי.
human_translation: Since even three, necessary ten? The Divine Presence arrives before a group of ten, three until they sit
llm_translation: And when after it even three, ten are required?! Ten - the Divine Presence preceded and came. Three - until it sits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין בַּר רַב אַדָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִנַּיִן שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נִשְׁבַּע ה׳ בִּימִינוֹ וּבִזְרוֹעַ עֻזּוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Avin bar Rav Adda said Rabbi Yitzḥak said: From where that the Holy One, Blessed be He, wears phylacteries? As it is stated: “The Lord has sworn by His right hand, and by the arm of His strength”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Avin bar Rav Adda, said Rabbi Yitzchak: From where do we derive that the Holy One, blessed be He, puts on tefillin? As it is stated: "The Lord has sworn by His right hand and by the arm of His strength."

hebrew_text: ״בִּימִינוֹ״ — זוֹ תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִימִינוֹ אֵשׁ דָּת לָמוֹ״, ״וּבִזְרוֹעַ עֻזּוֹ״ — אֵלּוּ תְּפִילִּין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״ה׳ עֹז לְעַמּוֹ יִתֵּן״.
human_translation: “His right hand” refers to the Torah, as it is stated “From His right hand, a fiery law for His people” “The arm of His strength,” refers to phylacteries, as it is stated: “The Lord gave strength to His nation”
llm_translation: "In our days" — this is the Torah, as it is stated: "From His right hand, a fiery law for them." "And with His strong arm" — these are the tefillin, as it is stated: "The Lord will give strength to His people."

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁהַתְּפִילִּין עוֹז הֵם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרָאוּ כׇּל עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ כִּי שֵׁם ה׳ נִקְרָא עָלֶיךָ וְיָרְאוּ מִמֶּךָּ״. וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: אֵלּוּ תְּפִילִּין שֶׁבָּרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: And from where that phylacteries provide strength for Israel? As it is written: “And all the nations of the land shall see that the name of the Lord is called upon you, and they will fear you” It was taught Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: This is the phylacteries of the head,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that the tefillin are a strength for Israel? — As it is written: "And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the Lord is called upon you, and they shall fear you." And it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: These are the tefillin of the head.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לְרַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין: הָנֵי תְּפִילִּין דְּמָרֵי עָלְמָא מָה כְּתִיב בְּהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ ״וּמִי כְּעַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל גּוֹי אֶחָד בָּאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin: What is written in the phylacteries of the Master of the world? Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin replied: “Who is like Your people, Israel, one nation in the land?”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said to Rav Chiya bar Avin: "Those phylacteries of the people of the world, what is written in them?" He said to him, "And who is like Your people Israel, one nation on earth."

hebrew_text: וּמִי מִשְׁתַּבַּח קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא בְּשִׁבְחַיְיהוּ דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל? אִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת ה׳ הֶאֱמַרְתָּ הַיּוֹם״. וּכְתִיב: ״וַה׳ הֶאֱמִירְךָ הַיּוֹם״, אָמַר לָהֶם הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: אַתֶּם עֲשִׂיתוּנִי חֲטִיבָה אַחַת בָּעוֹלָם, וַאֲנִי אֶעֱשֶׂה אֶתְכֶם חֲטִיבָה אַחַת בָּעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Is the Holy One, Blessed be He, glorified through the glory of Israel? Yes, as it is stated: “You have affirmed, this day, the Lord And the verse states: “And the Lord has affirmed, this day, you the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Israel: You have made Me a single entity [ ḥativa ] in the world, And I will make you a single entity in the world,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who praises the Holy One, blessed be He, in His praises of Israel? None, as it is written: 'You have declared today that the Lord is your God.' And it is written: 'And the Lord has declared you today to be His people.' The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Israel: You have made Me one portion in the world, and I will make you one portion in the world."

hebrew_text: אַתֶּם עֲשִׂיתוּנִי חֲטִיבָה אַחַת בָּעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ ה׳ אֶחָד״, וַאֲנִי אֶעֱשֶׂה אֶתְכֶם חֲטִיבָה אַחַת בָּעוֹלָם״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וּמִי כְּעַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל גּוֹי אֶחָד בָּאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: You have made Me a single entity in the world, as it is stated “Hear, Israel, the Lord is our God, the Lord is One” And I will make you a single entity in the world, “Who is like Your people, Israel, one nation in the land?”
llm_translation: You have made Me one group in the world, as it is said: "Hear, O Israel: the Lord our God, the Lord is one." And I will make you one group in the world, as it is said: "And who is like Your people Israel, one nation in the earth."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: תִּינַח בְּחַד בֵּיתָא, בִּשְׁאָר בָּתֵּי מַאי?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: It works out well one compartments What the rest of the compartments
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: "It should be placed in one house, what about the other houses?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לֵיהּ: ״כִּי מִי גוֹי גָּדוֹל״, ״וּמִי גּוֹי גָּדוֹל״, ״אַשְׁרֶיךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל״, ״אוֹ הֲנִסָּה אֱלֹהִים״, ״וּלְתִתְּךָ עֶלְיוֹן״.
human_translation: said to him: “For who is a great nation, “And who is a great nation, “Happy are you, Israel, “Or has God attempted “And to elevate you
llm_translation: He said to him: "Who is like the great nation," "And who is like the great nation," "Happy are you, Israel," "Or has a god tried," "And to you, the Most High."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, נְפִישִׁי לְהוּ טוּבֵי בָּתֵּי? אֶלָּא: ״כִּי מִי גוֹי גָּדוֹל״ ״וּמִי גּוֹי גָּדוֹל״ דְּדׇמְיָין לַהֲדָדֵי — בְּחַד בֵּיתָא, ״אַשְׁרֶיךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל״ ״וּמִי כְּעַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל״ — בְּחַד בֵּיתָא, ״אוֹ הֲנִסָּה אֱלֹהִים״ — בְּחַד בֵּיתָא, ״וּלְתִתְּךָ עֶלְיוֹן״ — בְּחַד בֵּיתָא.
human_translation: If there are too many compartments Rather, “For who is a great nation” and “And who is a great nation” in one compartment, “Happy are you, Israel” and "Who is like your people, Israel" are in one compartment. “Or has God attempted” is in one compartment and “And to elevate you” is compartment
llm_translation: So, is it preferable for them to dwell in good houses? Rather: "Who is like Your people, Israel" "And who is like Your people, Israel" resembling Hadadezer — in one house, "How fortunate you are, Israel" "And who is like Your people, Israel" — in one house, "Or has God ventured" — in one house, "And the Most High will give you" — in one house.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלְּהוּ כְּתִיבִי בְּאֶדְרָעֵיהּ.
human_translation: And all are written in arm,
llm_translation: And all of them are written in his arms.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִין בַּר רַב אַדָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל הָרָגִיל לָבֹא לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת וְלֹא בָּא יוֹם אֶחָד, הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְשָׁאֵיל בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִי בָכֶם יְרֵא ה׳ שֹׁמֵעַ בְּקוֹל עַבְדּוֹ אֲשֶׁר הָלַךְ חֲשֵׁכִים וְאֵין נֹגַהּ לוֹ״.
human_translation: Ravin bar Rav Adda said Rabbi Yitzḥak said: One who is accustomed to come to the synagogue and did not come one day, the Holy One, Blessed be He, asks about him, as it is stated: “Who among you fears the Lord? Who hears the voice of His servant? Though he walks in darkness and has no light,
llm_translation: Rabin bar Rav Adda said, Rabbi Yitzchak said: Anyone who is accustomed to come to the synagogue and does not come one day, the Holy One, blessed be He, inquires about him, as it is stated: "Who among you fears the Lord and listens to the voice of His servant, who walks in darkness and has no light."

hebrew_text: אִם לִדְבַר מִצְוָה הָלַךְ — נוֹגַהּ לוֹ, וְאִם לִדְבַר הָרְשׁוּת הָלַךְ — אֵין נוֹגַהּ לוֹ.
human_translation: If it is for a matter a mitzva that he went there is light for him, But if it is for an optional matter, that he went there is no light for him
llm_translation: If for a matter of commandment he went - it is pleasant for him, and if for a matter of permission he went - it is not pleasant for him.

hebrew_text: ״יִבְטַח בְּשֵׁם ה׳״ מַאי טַעְמָא? — מִשּׁוּם דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ לִבְטוֹחַ בְּשֵׁם ה׳, וְלָא בְּטַח.
human_translation: “Let him trust in the name of the Lord.” What is the reason Because he should have relied on the name of the Lord, and he did not rely
llm_translation: "Yivtach b'shem Hashem" what is the reason? - Because he trusted in the name of Hashem, and not in trust.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בָּא בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, וְלֹא מָצָא בָּהּ עֲשָׂרָה — מִיָּד הוּא כּוֹעֵס, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מַדּוּעַ בָּאתִי וְאֵין אִישׁ קָרָאתִי וְאֵין עוֹנֶה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: When the Holy One, Blessed be He, enters a synagogue and does not find ten He immediately becomes angry, as it is stated: “Why, when I came, was there no one? When I called, there was no one to answer…
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: At the time when the Holy One, blessed be He, enters the synagogue and does not find ten people in it, immediately He becomes angry, as it is stated: "Why have I come and there is no man, I called and there is no answer."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כׇּל הַקּוֹבֵעַ מָקוֹם לִתְפִלָּתוֹ — אֱלֹהֵי אַבְרָהָם בְּעֶזְרוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥelbo said that Rav Huna said: One who sets a fixed place for his prayer, the God of Abraham assists him.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Helbo, said Rav Huna: Anyone who establishes a fixed place for his prayer - the God of Abraham, his help.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁמֵּת, אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: ״אֵי עָנָיו, אֵי חָסִיד, מִתַּלְמִידָיו שֶׁל אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ״.
human_translation: When he dies, say about him: “Where is the humble where is the pious of the disciples of our father Abraham?”
llm_translation: And when he dies, they say to him: "Where is the poor, where is the righteous, from the disciples of our father Abraham."

hebrew_text: וְאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ מְנָא לַן דִּקְבַע מָקוֹם? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּשְׁכֵּם אַבְרָהָם בַּבֹּקֶר אֶל הַמָּקוֹם אֲשֶׁר עָמַד שָׁם״, וְאֵין ״עֲמִידָה״ אֶלָּא תְּפִלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעֲמֹד פִּינְחָס וַיְפַלֵּל״.
human_translation: From where do we that Abraham our father set a fixed place As it is written: “And Abraham rose in the morning to the place where he had stood and “standing” means nothing other than prayer, as it is stated: “And Pinehas stood and prayed”
llm_translation: Our father Abraham, how did he establish a place for us? As it is written: "And Abraham arose early in the morning to the place where he had stood." And "standing" refers only to prayer, as it is said: "And Phinehas stood up and prayed."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הַיּוֹצֵא מִבֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת אַל יַפְסִיעַ פְּסִיעָה גַסָּה. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא אֲמַרַן, אֶלָּא לְמִיפַּק. אֲבָל לְמֵיעַל — מִצְוָה לְמִרְהַט, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נִרְדְּפָה לָדַעַת אֶת ה׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥelbo said Rav Huna said: One who leaves the synagogue should not take large strides Abaye said: was only said to leaving However, to entering it is a mitzva to run As it is said: eagerly strive to know the Lord”
llm_translation: Rabbi Helbo said, Rabbi Huna said: One who leaves the synagogue should not take a large step. Abaye said: We did not say this, but rather to take a small step. However, to ascend - it is a mitzvah to hurry, as it is said: "Let us pursue knowledge of the Lord."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: מֵרֵישׁ כִּי הֲוָה חֲזֵינָא לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דְּקָא רָהֲטִי לְפִרְקָא בְּשַׁבְּתָא, אָמֵינָא: ״קָא מְחַלַּיִין רַבָּנַן שַׁבְּתָא״. כֵּיוָן דִּשְׁמַעְנָא לְהָא דְּרַבִּי תַּנְחוּם אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: לְעוֹלָם יָרוּץ אָדָם לִדְבַר הֲלָכָה וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַחֲרֵי ה׳ יֵלְכוּ כְּאַרְיֵה יִשְׁאָג״ וְגוֹ׳, אֲנָא נָמֵי רָהֵיטְנָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Initially, when I saw the Sages running to the lecture on Shabbat, I said: These Sages are desecrating Shabbat. Once I heard that which Rabbi Tanḥum said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi One should always run for a matter of halakha , even on Shabbat, as it is stated: “They shall walk after the Lord, who will roar like a lion” I too run.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: From the beginning, when we used to see the Rabbis hurrying to the study hall on Shabbat eve, I would say, "The Rabbis are desecrating Shabbat." Once I heard what Rabbi Tanḥum said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: A person should always run to engage in matters of halakha, even on Shabbat, as it is stated, "They shall go after the Lord; He will roar like a lion" etc. I too would hurry.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אַגְרָא דְפִרְקָא — רִהֲטָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: The reward for the lecture is running.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira: "Agara d'Pirka - Rihata."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אַגְרָא דְכַלָּה — דּוּחְקָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: The reward for the kalla is the crowding.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "The reward of a bride - pressure."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אַגְרָא דִשְׁמַעְתָּא — סְבָרָא.
human_translation: Rava said: The reward for traditions is the logical
llm_translation: Rava said: "Agar d'shema'ta - svara."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אַגְרָא דְבֵי טַמְיָא — שְׁתִיקוּתָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: The reward for a house of mourning [ bei tammaya ] is silence,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: The reward of the house of impurity is silence.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: אַגְרָא דְתַעֲנִיתָא — צִדְקְתָא.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: The reward for fasting is charity
llm_translation: Mar Zutra said: "The reward of fasting is righteousness."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אַגְרָא דְהֶסְפֵּדָא — דַּלּוֹיֵי.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: The reward for a eulogy is raise their voices
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: The reward for mourning - is hanging.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אַגְרָא דְבֵי הִלּוּלֵי — מִילֵּי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: The reward for a wedding is the words,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: "Agar d'bei Hilulei - milei."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כׇּל הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל אֲחוֹרֵי בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת נִקְרָא ״רָשָׁע״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״סָבִיב רְשָׁעִים יִתְהַלָּכוּן״.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: One who prays behind the synagogue is called wicked, As it is stated: “The wicked walk round about,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Anyone who prays behind the synagogue is called a "wicked person," as it is stated: "The wicked walk on every side."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא מַהְדַּר אַפֵּיהּ לְבֵי כְּנִישְׁתָּא, אֲבָל מַהְדַּר אַפֵּיהּ לְבֵי כְּנִישְׁתָּא — לֵית לָן בַּהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: This was said only where one does not turn his face toward the synagogue. But he turns his face toward the synagogue we have no in
llm_translation: Abaye said: We only said that one should not adorn himself for the synagogue, but if one adorns himself for the synagogue - we have no objection.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא גַבְרָא דְּקָא מְצַלֵּי אֲחוֹרֵי בֵּי כְּנִישְׁתָּא, וְלָא מַהְדַּר אַפֵּיהּ לְבֵי כְּנִישְׁתָּא. חֲלַף אֵלִיָּהוּ. חַזְיֵיהּ, אִידְּמִי לֵיהּ כְּטַיָּיעָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּדוּ בָר קָיְימַתְּ קַמֵּי מָרָךְ?! שְׁלַף סַפְסֵרָא וְקַטְלֵיהּ.
human_translation: A certain individual prayed behind the synagogue and did not turn to face the synagogue. Elijah passed by and he saw him. He appeared to as an Arab [ taya’a ]. said: “This is how [ kadu bar ] you stand before your Master?” drew a sword and killed him.
llm_translation: That man who was peering behind the synagogue, and did not turn his face towards the synagogue. Elijah passed by. He saw him, mistook him for a demon, and said to him: "Are you the one who stands before your Master?!" He drew a sword and killed him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן לְרַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב בִּיבִי לְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַאי ״כְּרֻם זֻלּוּת לִבְנֵי אָדָם״?
human_translation: One of the Sages said to Rav Beivai bar Abaye, and some say Rav Beivai Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak: What is “When vileness is exalted among the sons of men”?
llm_translation: He said to him that certain scholar to Rav Bivi son of Abaye, and they said to him Rav Bivi to Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak: What is "like a vineyard that is open to the sons of man"?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁעוֹמְדִים בְּרוּמוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, וּבְנֵי אָדָם מְזַלְזְלִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: He said to him: These are matters of utmost importance, which people treat with contempt,
llm_translation: He said to him: These are the things that stand in the height of the world, and people treat them lightly.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּצְטָרֵךְ אָדָם לַבְּרִיּוֹת, פָּנָיו מִשְׁתַּנּוֹת כִּכְרוּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כְּרֻם זֻלּוּת לִבְנֵי אָדָם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar, both said Once a person needs others his face changes like a kerum , as it is stated: “When [ kerum ] vileness is exalted among the sons of men.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar both said: When a person needs to interact with others, his face changes like a vineyard, as it is stated: "A vineyard of delight for people."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כְּרוּם״? כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: עוֹף אֶחָד יֵשׁ בִּכְרַכֵּי הַיָּם, וּ״כְרוּם״ שְׁמוֹ, וְכֵיוָן שֶׁחַמָּה זוֹרַחַת מִתְהַפֵּךְ לְכַמָּה גְּווֹנִין.
human_translation: What is kerum When Rav Dimi came he said: There is a bird in the cities by the sea called kerum and when the sun rises, changes several colors.
llm_translation: What is "Kerum"? When Rav Dimi came, he said: There is a certain bird in the crevices of the sea, and its name is "Kerum," and once the sun shines, it changes to various colors.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי דְאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: כְּאִלּוּ נִדּוֹן בִּשְׁנֵי דִינִים, אֵשׁ וּמַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִרְכַּבְתָּ אֱנוֹשׁ לְרֹאשֵׁנוּ בָּאנוּ בָאֵשׁ וּבַמַּיִם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi both said: it is as if he was punished with two punishments: Fire and water. As it is stated: “You have caused men to ride over our heads; we have gone through fire and water”
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi who both said: It is as if he is judged in two judgments, fire and water, as it is stated: "You have brought a man over our heads; we came into fire and into water."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לְעוֹלָם יְהֵא אָדָם זָהִיר בִּתְפִלַּת הַמִּנְחָה, שֶׁהֲרֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ לֹא נַעֲנָה אֶלָּא בִּתְפִלַּת הַמִּנְחָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי בַּעֲלוֹת הַמִּנְחָה וַיִּגַּשׁ אֵלִיָּהוּ הַנָּבִיא וַיֹּאמַר וְגוֹ׳ עֲנֵנִי ה׳ עֲנֵנִי״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥelbo said Rav Huna said: One must always be vigilant with regard to the afternoon prayer, as Elijah’s was only answered in the afternoon prayer, as it is stated: “And it was at the time of the afternoon offering that Elijah the Prophet came near, and he said: Answer me, Lord, answer me,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Helbo said, Rabbi Huna said: Always should a person be careful with the prayer of the Minchah offering, for Elijah was answered only through the prayer of the Minchah offering, as it is stated: "And it came to pass at the time of the offering of the Minchah offering, that Elijah the prophet came near and said, etc. 'Answer me, O Lord, answer me.'"

hebrew_text: ״עֲנֵנִי״ — שֶׁתֵּרֵד אֵשׁ מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם, וַ״עֲנֵנִי״ — שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ מַעֲשֵׂה כְשָׁפִים הֵם.
human_translation: answer me that fire descend from the heavens, while answer me that not say that was an act of sorcery.
llm_translation: "Answer me" - that fire should come down from heaven, and "answer me" - so that they will not say it is the work of sorcery.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אַף בִּתְפִלַּת עַרְבִית, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תִּכּוֹן תְּפִלָּתִי קְטֹרֶת לְפָנֶיךָ מַשְׂאַת כַּפַּי מִנְחַת עָרֶב״. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: אַף תְּפִלַּת שַׁחֲרִית, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״ה׳ בֹּקֶר תִּשְׁמַע קוֹלִי, בֹּקֶר אֶעֱרׇךְ לְךָ וַאֲצַפֶּה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan with regard to the evening prayer as well, as it is stated: “Let my prayer come forth as incense before You, the lifting of my hands as the evening offering” Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: with regard to the morning prayer as well, as it is stated: “Lord, in the morning You shall hear my voice; in the morning I will order my prayer unto You and will look forward”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even in the evening prayer, as it is stated: "May my prayer be set before You as incense, the lifting up of my hands as the evening offering." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Even in the morning prayer, as it is stated: "In the morning, O Lord, You will hear my voice; in the morning I will set myself in array before You, and wait."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כׇּל הַנֶּהֱנֶה מִסְּעוּדַת חָתָן וְאֵינוֹ מְשַׂמְּחוֹ עוֹבֵר בַּחֲמִשָּׁה קוֹלוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קוֹל שָׂשׂוֹן וְקוֹל שִׂמְחָה קוֹל חָתָן וְקוֹל כַּלָּה קוֹל אוֹמְרִים הוֹדוּ אֶת ה׳ צְבָאוֹת״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥelbo said Rav Huna said: Anyone who benefits from the feast of a groom but does not cause him to rejoice violates the five voices as it is stated: “The voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the groom and the voice of the bride, and the voice of those who say: Give thanks to the Lord of hosts,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Helbo said, Rabbi Huna said: Anyone who benefits from the feast of a groom and does not make him rejoice, transgresses five voices, as it is said: "The voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the groom and the voice of the bride, the voice of those who say, 'Praise the Lord of hosts!'"

hebrew_text: וְאִם מְשַׂמְּחוֹ מַה שְּׂכָרוֹ? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: זוֹכֶה לַתּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּתְּנָה בַּחֲמִשָּׁה קוֹלוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי בַיּוֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי בִּהְיוֹת הַבֹּקֶר וַיְהִי קֹלֹת וּבְרָקִים וְעָנָן כָּבֵד עַל הָהָר וְקֹל שׁוֹפָר וְגוֹ׳. וַיְהִי קוֹל הַשֹּׁפָר וְגוֹ׳ וְהָאֱלֹהִים יַעֲנֶנּוּ בְקוֹל״.
human_translation: What is his reward if he causes to rejoice? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: the Torah, which was given with five voices, as it is stated: “And it was on the third day, when it was morning, there were sounds [ kolot ], and lightning and a thick cloud upon the mountain, and the voice of the shofar ” “And when the voice of the shofar and God answered him by a voice”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And if one rejoices, what is his reward?" Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: He merits the Torah that was given with five voices, as it is stated: "And it came to pass on the third day, when it was morning, that there were thunders and lightnings and a thick cloud upon the mount, and the voice of the shofar exceeding loud." "And the sound of the shofar continued and God answered him by voice."

hebrew_text: אִינִּי? וְהָא כְּתִיב ״וְכׇל הָעָם רוֹאִים אֶת הַקּוֹלוֹת״!
human_translation: Is this so? Isn’t it also written: “And the whole nation saw the voices
llm_translation: I am not? But isn't it written, "and all the people see the voices"!

hebrew_text: אוֹתָן קוֹלוֹת, דְּקוֹדֶם מַתַּן תּוֹרָה הֲווֹ.
human_translation: Those voices were prior to the giving of the Torah,
llm_translation: Those voices, before the giving of the Torah, were.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר: כְּאִילּוּ הִקְרִיב תּוֹדָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מְבִאִים תּוֹדָה בֵּית ה׳״. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: כְּאִילּוּ בָּנָה אַחַת מֵחוּרְבוֹת יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״כִּי אָשִׁיב אֶת שְׁבוּת הָאָרֶץ כְּבָרִאשׁוֹנָה אָמַר ה׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: is as if one had offered a thanks-offering as it is stated “Those who bring a thanks-offering to the house of the Lord.” And Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: as if one rebuilt one of Jerusalem’s ruins, as it is stated “For I will restore the captivity of the land as it was in the beginning.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: As if he brought a thanksgiving offering, as it is stated: "Bringing thanksgiving offerings to the house of the Lord." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: As if he rebuilt one of the ruins of Jerusalem, as it is stated: "For I will restore the fortunes of the land as in the beginning, says the Lord."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ יִרְאַת שָׁמַיִם — דְּבָרָיו נִשְׁמָעִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״סוֹף דָּבָר הַכֹּל נִשְׁמָע אֶת הָאֱלֹהִים יְרָא וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥelbo said Rav Huna said: Any person who has the fear of Heaven, his words are heeded, as it is stated: “The end of the matter, all having been heard: Fear God,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Helbo said, Rabbi Huna said: Any person who has fear of Heaven - his words are heard, as it says: "The end of the matter, all has been heard: Fear God and so forth."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כִּי זֶה כׇּל הָאָדָם״? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כֻּלּוֹ לֹא נִבְרָא אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל זֶה.
human_translation: What is “for this is all of man”? Rabbi Elazar said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said The entire world was created only for this
llm_translation: "What is 'for this is the whole man' (Ecclesiastes 12:13)? Rabbi Elazar said, the Holy One, blessed be He, said: The entire world was created only for this."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא אָמַר: שָׁקוּל זֶה כְּנֶגֶד כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן זוֹמָא אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ לֹא נִבְרָא אֶלָּא לִצְווֹת לָזֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said: this is equivalent to the entire world, Rabbi Shimon ben Azzai, and some say Rabbi Shimon ben Zoma, says: the entire world was created as companions for him,
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said: "This world is balanced against the entire world." Rabbi Shimon ben Azai says, and some say it was Rabbi Shimon ben Zoma who said: "The entire world was created only to fulfill this."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כׇּל שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ בַּחֲבֵרוֹ שֶׁהוּא רָגִיל לִיתֵּן לוֹ שָׁלוֹם, יַקְדִּים לוֹ שָׁלוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּקֵּשׁ שָׁלוֹם וְרׇדְפֵהוּ״. וְאִם נָתַן לוֹ וְלֹא הֶחֱזִיר — נִקְרָא ״גַּזְלָן״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתֶּם בִּעַרְתֶּם הַכֶּרֶם גְּזֵלַת הֶעָנִי בְּבָתֵּיכֶם״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥelbo said Rav Huna said: One who is aware that another is accustomed to greet him he greet him first, as it is stated: “Seek peace and pursue it” If extended greeting to him and he did not respond, he is called a robber, as it is stated: “It is you who have eaten up the vineyard, the spoils of the poor is in your houses”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Helbo said, Rabbi Huna said: Anyone who knows about his friend that he is accustomed to greet him with peace, should greet him with peace first, as it is stated: "Seek peace and pursue it." And if he greeted him and he did not return the greeting, he is called a robber, as it is stated: "And you have despoiled the vineyard, the spoil of the poor is in your houses."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מִנַּיִן שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִתְפַּלֵּל? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַהֲבִיאוֹתִים אֶל הַר קָדְשִׁי וְשִׂמַּחְתִּים בְּבֵית תְּפִלָּתִי״, ״תְּפִלָּתָם״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״תְּפִלָּתִי״, מִכָּאן שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִתְפַּלֵּל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei: From where that the Holy One, Blessed be He, prays? As it is stated: “I will bring them to My holy mountain, and make them joyful in the house of My prayer” does not say their prayer, but rather, “ My prayer”; from here that the Holy One, Blessed be He, prays.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Yosei: From where do we know that the Holy One, blessed be He, prays? As it is stated: "And I will bring them to My holy mountain, and make them joyful in My house of prayer," it does not say "their prayer," but rather "My prayer," from here that the Holy One, blessed be He, prays.

hebrew_text: מַאי מְצַלֵּי?
human_translation: What does pray?
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "m'tzalei"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה, אָמַר רַב: ״יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנַי שֶׁיִּכְבְּשׁוּ רַחֲמַי אֶת כַּעֲסִי, וְיִגּוֹלּוּ רַחֲמַי עַל מִדּוֹתַי, וְאֶתְנַהֵג עִם בָּנַי בְּמִדַּת רַחֲמִים, וְאֶכָּנֵס לָהֶם לִפְנִים מִשּׁוּרַת הַדִּין״.
human_translation: Rav Zutra bar Tovia said Rav said: May it be My will that My mercy will overcome My anger and may My mercy prevail over My attributes and may I conduct toward My children, with the attribute of mercy, and may I enter before them beyond the letter of the law.
llm_translation: Rav Zutra bar Tobiah said, Rav said: "May it be the will before Me that My mercy shall suppress My anger, and My mercy shall prevail over My attributes, and I shall deal with My children in the attribute of mercy, and I shall enter before them within the line of strict justice."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן אֱלִישָׁע: פַּעַם אַחַת, נִכְנַסְתִּי לְהַקְטִיר קְטוֹרֶת לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים, וְרָאִיתִי אַכְתְּרִיאֵל יָהּ ה׳ צְבָאוֹת, שֶׁהוּא יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רָם וְנִשָּׂא, וְאָמַר לִי: ״יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנִי, בָּרְכֵנִי!״ אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: ״יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ, שֶׁיִּכְבְּשׁוּ רַחֲמֶיךָ אֶת כַּעַסְךָ, וְיִגּוֹלּוּ רַחֲמֶיךָ עַל מִדּוֹתֶיךָ, וְתִתְנַהֵג עִם בָּנֶיךָ בְּמִדַּת הָרַחֲמִים, וְתִכָּנֵס לָהֶם לִפְנִים מִשּׁוּרַת הַדִּין״. וְנִעְנַע לִי בְּרֹאשׁוֹ. וְקָמַשְׁמַע לַן, שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא בִּרְכַּת הֶדְיוֹט קַלָּה בְּעֵינֶיךָ.
human_translation: it was taught Rabbi Yishmael ben Elisha, Once, I entered the innermost sanctum, to offer incense, and I saw Akatriel Ya, the Lord of Hosts, seated upon a high and exalted throne And He said to me: Yishmael, My son, bless Me. I said to Him “May it be Your will that Your mercy overcome Your anger, and may Your mercy prevail over Your attributes, and may You act toward Your children with the attribute of mercy, and may You enter before them beyond the letter of the law.” nodded His head teaches us that you should not take the blessing of an ordinary person lightly.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yishmael ben Elisha said: Once, I entered to offer incense in the innermost chamber and saw Akatriel Yah Hashem Tzevaot, who was seated on a high and exalted throne, and he said to me, "Yishmael my son, bless me!" I said to him, "May it be Your will, that Your mercies overcome Your anger, and Your mercies prevail over Your attributes, and may You deal with Your children with the attribute of mercy, and may You treat them with kindness beyond the strict requirements of the law." And he nodded his head to me. And it was heard by us, that the blessing of a commoner should not be light in your eyes.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין מְרַצִּין לוֹ לְאָדָם בִּשְׁעַת כַּעְסוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״פָּנַי יֵלֵכוּ וַהֲנִחֹתִי לָךְ״. אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: הַמְתֵּן לִי עַד שֶׁיַּעַבְרוּ פָּנִים שֶׁל זַעַם וְאָנִיחַ לְךָ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei: From where that one must not placate a person while his anger, As it is written, “My face will go, and I will give you rest” The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Wait until My face of wrath will pass and I will grant your
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei: From where do we know that one should not appease a person at the time of his anger? As it is written: "My face shall go and I will give you rest." The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses: Wait for Me until the face of anger passes, and then I will leave you.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא רִתְחָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּקוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא?
human_translation: And is there anger before the Holy One, Blessed be He?
llm_translation: And who is there boiling before the Holy One, blessed be He?

hebrew_text: אִין, דְּתַנְיָא ״וְאֵל זוֹעֵם בְּכָל יוֹם״.
human_translation: Yes, as it was taught God is furious every day”
llm_translation: "It is taught: 'And God is angry every day.'"

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה זַעְמוֹ — רֶגַע. וְכַמָּה רֶגַע — אֶחָד מֵחֲמֵשֶׁת רִבּוֹא וּשְׁמוֹנַת אֲלָפִים וּשְׁמֹנֶה מֵאוֹת וּשְׁמֹנִים וּשְׁמֹנָה בְּשָׁעָה, וְזוֹ הִיא רֶגַע. וְאֵין כָּל בְּרִיָּה יְכוֹלָה לְכַוֵּין אוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה, חוּץ מִבִּלְעָם הָרָשָׁע, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״וְיוֹדֵעַ דַּעַת עֶלְיוֹן״.
human_translation: How much His anger a moment. And how is a moment? One fifty-eight thousand, eight hundred and eighty-eighth of an hour, that is a moment. And no creature can determine that moment except for Balaam the wicked, about whom it is written: “He who knows the knowledge of the Most High”
llm_translation: "And how long is a 'za'am' - an instant. And how long is an 'instant' - one of five thousand eight hundred and eighty-eight parts of an hour, and this is an 'instant.' And no creature can calculate that hour, except for Balaam the wicked, as it is written about him: 'And knows the knowledge of the Most High.'"

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דַּעַת בְּהֶמְתּוֹ לֹא הֲוָה יָדַע, דַּעַת עֶלְיוֹן הֲוָה יָדַע?
human_translation: Now, did not know the mind of his animal; and he did know the mind of the Most High?
llm_translation: This is the question: Does an animal have knowledge, but not knowledge of the Supreme?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיָה יוֹדֵעַ לְכַוֵּין אוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא כּוֹעֵס בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, this teaches that was able to determine the hour that the Holy One, Blessed be He, is angry.
llm_translation: Rather, it teaches that he knew to designate that hour when the Holy One, blessed be He, was angry with her.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר לְהוּ נָבִיא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: ״עַמִּי זְכָר נָא מַה יָּעַץ בָּלָק מֶלֶךְ מוֹאָב וְגוֹ׳״. מַאי ״לְמַעַן דַּעַת צִדְקוֹת ה׳״?
human_translation: And that is what the prophet said to Israel: “My nation, remember what Balak king of Moab advised, What is “So that you may know the righteous acts of the Lord”?
llm_translation: And this is what the prophet said to the Israelites: "O my people, remember now what Balak king of Moab consulted, and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him." What is "in order to know the righteousness of the Lord"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אָמַר לָהֶם הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: דְּעוּ כַּמָּה צְדָקוֹת עָשִׂיתִי עִמָּכֶם שֶׁלֹּא כָּעַסְתִּי בִּימֵי בִּלְעָם הָרָשָׁע, שֶׁאִלְמָלֵי כָּעַסְתִּי — לֹא נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר מִשּׂוֹנְאֵיהֶם שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל שָׂרִיד וּפָלִיט.
