human_translation: Rav Yosef said: This is not difficult This, is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya. While this, is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. As it was taught “And they shall eat of the meat on that night; Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: Here it is stated: “On that night,” “And I will pass through the land of Egypt on that night just as below, until midnight, so too here, until midnight.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: It is not difficult. This is Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, and this is Rabbi Akiva. As it was taught: "And they shall eat the flesh in this night," Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says: It is stated here "in this night," and it is stated elsewhere: "And I will pass through the land of Egypt in this night," just as there until midnight, so too here until midnight.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״בְּחִפָּזוֹן״, עַד שְׁעַת חִפָּזוֹן. אִם כֵּן מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בַּלַּיְלָה״?
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to him: Was it not already said, in haste until the time of haste. If that is so, why does the verse state: On night?
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva: But hasn't it already been said "in haste," until the time of haste. If so, what does the Talmud mean to say "at night"?

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יְהֵא נֶאֱכָל כְּקָדָשִׁים בַּיּוֹם תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בַּלַּיְלָה״, בַּלַּיְלָה הוּא נֶאֱכָל, וְלֹא בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: might is eaten during the day, like sacrifices, the verse states: On night, is eaten at night and not during the day.
llm_translation: He might have thought that it should be eaten like sacred offerings during the day; Scripture states "at night," it is to be eaten at night, not during the day.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה דְּאִית לֵיהּ גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה, אִצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב לֵיהּ ״הַזֶּה״. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הַאי ״הַזֶּה״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, who has a verbal analogy it was necessary to write “that” However, according to Rabbi Akiva, what does he do with “that”?
llm_translation: In truth, for Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah who had a similar decree, it was necessary to write for him "this." But for Rabbi Akiva, what does he do with this "this"?

hebrew_text: לְמַעוֹטֵי לַיְלָה אַחֵר הוּא דַּאֲתָא, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּפֶסַח קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים, וּשְׁלָמִים קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים, מָה שְׁלָמִים נֶאֱכָלִין לִשְׁנֵי יָמִים וְלַיְלָה אֶחָד — אַף פֶּסַח נֶאֱכָל שְׁתֵּי לֵילוֹת בִּמְקוֹם שְׁנֵי יָמִים, וִיהֵא נֶאֱכָל לִשְׁנֵי לֵילוֹת וְיוֹם אֶחָד. קָמַשְׁמַע לָן ״בַּלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה״, בַּלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה הוּא נֶאֱכָל וְאֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל בְּלַיְלָה אַחֵר.
human_translation: comes to exclude another night, It would have entered your mind to say: Since the Paschal lamb sacrifices of lesser sanctity, and peace-offerings are sacrifices of lesser sanctity, just as peace-offerings may be eaten for two days and one night, so too the Paschal lamb may be eaten for two nights instead of two days. is to be eaten for two nights and the day teaches us on that night, on that night it is eaten, and it is not eaten on another night.
llm_translation: To the exclusion of the following night he comes, I would say: Since peace offerings are light holy offerings, and Passover offerings are light holy offerings, just as peace offerings are eaten for two days and one night - so too Passover should be eaten for two nights in the place of two days, and it should be eaten for two nights and one day. It is inferred for us from "on this night," on this night it is eaten and it is not eaten on another night.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah

hebrew_text: מִ״לֹּא תוֹתִירוּ עַד בֹּקֶר״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: derives from “It should not remain until the morning”
llm_translation: "From 'Do not leave over until morning' it is derived."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — אִי מֵהָתָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא מַאי ״בֹּקֶר״ — בֹּקֶר שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva if from I would have said: What morning? second morning,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva - if from there, I would say what is "morning" - second morning.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר לָךְ: כָּל ״בֹּקֶר״ — בֹּקֶר רִאשׁוֹן הוּא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar could have said to you: every morning refers to the first, morning.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said to you: Every "morning" - it is the first morning.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי כְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי. דְּתַנְיָא, ״שָׁם תִּזְבַּח אֶת הַפֶּסַח בָּעָרֶב כְּבוֹא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ מוֹעֵד צֵאתְךָ מִמִּצְרָיִם״.
human_translation: these tanna’im is parallel to those tanna’im , As it was taught “There you will offer the Paschal lamb, in the evening when the sun sets at the time when you left the land of Egypt”
llm_translation: The text reads: "And these Tannaim are like the Tannaim. As it was taught: 'There you shall sacrifice the Passover offering in the evening, at the going down of the sun, at the appointed time of your departure from Egypt.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״בָּעֶרֶב״ אַתָּה זוֹבֵחַ, וּ״כְבוֹא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ״ אַתָּה אוֹכֵל, וּ״מוֹעֵד צֵאתְךָ מִמִּצְרָיִם״ אַתָּה שׂוֹרֵף. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר ״בָּעֶרֶב״ אַתָּה זוֹבֵחַ ״כְּבוֹא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ״ אַתָּה אוֹכֵל וְעַד מָתַי אַתָּה אוֹכֵל וְהוֹלֵךְ — עַד ״מוֹעֵד צֵאתְךָ מִמִּצְרָיִם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: In the evening, you slaughter when the sun sets you eat it, and at the time when you left the land of Egypt you burn Rabbi Yehoshua says: In the evening, you slaughter when the sun sets, you eat it. And until when do you continue eating? Until the time when you left the land of Egypt,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: "In the evening" you slaughter, and "when the sun sets" you eat, and "at the time of your departure from Egypt" you burn. Rabbi Yehoshua says: "In the evening" you slaughter, "when the sun sets" you eat, and until when do you eat and walk - until "the time of your departure from Egypt."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים כְּשֶׁנִּגְאֲלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִמִּצְרַיִם, לֹא נִגְאֲלוּ אֶלָּא בָּעֶרֶב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הוֹצִיאֲךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ מִמִּצְרַיִם לָיְלָה״, וּכְשֶׁיָּצְאוּ — לֹא יָצְאוּ אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִמָּחֳרַת הַפֶּסַח יָצְאוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּיָד רָמָה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said: Everyone agrees that when Israel were redeemed from Egypt they were redeemed only in the evening, as it is stated: the Lord, your God, took you out from Egypt at night” And when they left, they left only during the day, as it is stated: on the day after the Paschal lamb, the children of Israel went out with a high hand
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said: All agree that when the Israelites were redeemed from Egypt, they were redeemed only at night, as it is stated: "The Lord your God brought you out of Egypt at night." And when they went out, they went out only by day, as it is stated: "On the day after the Passover, the children of Israel went out with a high hand."

hebrew_text: עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל שְׁעַת חִפָּזוֹן, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה סָבַר: מַאי ״חִפָּזוֹן״ — חִפָּזוֹן דְּמִצְרַיִם.
human_translation: with regard to what did they disagree? with regard to the time of haste, Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya held: What is haste? the haste of the Egyptians
llm_translation: On what did they argue? - On the moment of haste. Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah holds: What is "haste"? - The haste of Egypt.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: מַאי ״חִפָּזוֹן״ — חִפָּזוֹן דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva held: What is haste? the haste of Israel
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva holds: What is "chippazon" - the chippazon of Israel.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״הוֹצִיאֲךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ מִמִּצְרַיִם לָיְלָה״: וְכִי בַּלַּיְלָה יָצְאוּ? וַהֲלֹא לֹא יָצְאוּ אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִמָּחֳרַת הַפֶּסַח יָצְאוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּיָד רָמָה״! אֶלָּא, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִתְחִילָה לָהֶם גְּאוּלָּה מִבָּעֶרֶב.
human_translation: it was also taught “The Lord, your God, took you out from Egypt at night,” Did they leave at night? Didn’t they leave during the day, as it is stated: “On the day after the offering of the Paschal lamb, the children of Israel went out with a high hand”? Rather, this teaches that the redemption began for them in the evening.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "The Lord your God brought you out of Egypt at night." Did they indeed leave at night? But did they not leave only during the day, as it is stated: "On the day after the Passover, the children of Israel went out with a high hand"! Rather, this teaches that their redemption began for them at night.

hebrew_text: ״דַּבֶּר נָא בְּאָזְנֵי הָעָם״ וְגוֹ׳. אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: אֵין ״נָא״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן בַּקָּשָׁה, אָמַר לֵיהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִמְּךָ, לֵךְ וֶאֱמוֹר לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִכֶּם, שַׁאֲלוּ מִמִּצְרַיִם כְּלֵי כֶסֶף וּכְלֵי זָהָב, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר
human_translation: “Speak, please [ na ] in the ears of the people, the school of Rabbi Yannai said: Please na ] is nothing more than an expression of supplication. Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Moses I beseech you, go and tell Israel: I beseech you; borrow vessels of silver and vessels of gold from the Egyptians so that
llm_translation: "Speak now in the ears of the people," etc. The House of Rabbi Yannai said: "There is no 'now' except as a language of difficulty." The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses: "With difficulty from you, go and say to the children of Israel: 'With difficulty from you, ask of the Egyptians articles of silver and articles of gold, so that they will not say..."

hebrew_text: אוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק, ״וַעֲבָדוּם וְעִנּוּ אֹתָם״ — קִייֵּם בָּהֶם, ״וְאַחֲרֵי כֵן יֵצְאוּ בִּרְכֻשׁ גָּדוֹל״ — לֹא קִייֵּם בָּהֶם.
human_translation: that righteous person, will not say: fulfilled “And they will be enslaved and afflicted,” did not fulfill “And afterward, they will leave with great possessions.”
llm_translation: That righteous one, "and they shall serve them and afflict them" - he fulfilled in them, "and afterwards they shall leave with great possessions" - he did not fulfill in them.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: וּלְוַאי שֶׁנֵּצֵא בְּעַצְמֵנוּ! מָשָׁל: לְאָדָם שֶׁהָיָה חָבוּשׁ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִים וְהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים לוֹ בְּנֵי אָדָם: מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתְךָ לְמָחָר מִבֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין, וְנוֹתְנִין לְךָ מָמוֹן הַרְבֵּה, וְאוֹמֵר לָהֶם: בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִכֶּם, הוֹצִיאוּנִי הַיּוֹם, וְאֵינִי מְבַקֵּשׁ כְּלוּם.
human_translation: said to If only we could get out ourselves. a parable to one who was incarcerated in prison, and people would say to him: we will release you tomorrow and give you much money. He says to them: I beseech you, release me today and I ask for nothing.
llm_translation: They said to him: "And if only we could get out by ourselves!" Parable: To a person who was imprisoned in a prison and the sons of man were saying to him: "We will take you out tomorrow from the prison, and we will give you a large sum of money," and he says to them: "Please, take me out today, and I do not ask for anything."

hebrew_text: ״וַיַּשְׁאִלוּם״, אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִשְׁאִילוּם בְּעַל כָּרְחָם. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי בְּעַל כָּרְחָם דְּמִצְרַיִם, וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי בְּעַל כָּרְחָם דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: and they gave them what they requested Rabbi Ami said: This teaches that gave them what they requested against their will. Some say against the will of the Egyptians, and some say against the will of Israel.
llm_translation: "And they lent them," Rabbi Ammi said: It teaches that they lent them willingly. Some say willingly as in Egypt, and some say willingly as in Israel."

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר בְּעַל כָּרְחָם דְּמִצְרַיִם — דִּכְתִיב: ״וּנְוַת בַּיִת תְּחַלֵּק שָׁלָל״. מַאן דְּאָמַר בְּעַל כָּרְחָם דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל — מִשּׁוּם מַשּׂוֹי.
human_translation: The one who said against the will of the Egyptians as it is written: “And she who tarries at home divides the spoils” The one who said against the will of Israel, because of the load
llm_translation: The one who says "Ba'al Karḥam of Egypt" — as it is written: "And the spoils of the house you shall divide." The one who says "Ba'al Karḥam of Israel" — because of the found object.

hebrew_text: ״וַיְנַצְּלוּ אֶת מִצְרָיִם״. אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעֲשָׂאוּהָ כִּמְצוּדָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ דָּגָן, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר, עֲשָׂאוּהָ כִּמְצוּלָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ דָּגִים.
human_translation: And they emptied Egypt, Rabbi Ami said: they made like a trap in which there is no grain Reish Lakish said: They made like an abyss without fish.
llm_translation: "And they plundered Egypt." Rabbi Ammi said: This teaches that they made it like a fish trap that does not contain grain. And Resh Lakish said: They made it like a fish net that does not contain fish.

hebrew_text: ״אֶהְיֶה אֲשֶׁר אֶהְיֶה״, אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה, לֵךְ אֱמוֹר לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: אֲנִי הָיִיתִי עִמָּכֶם בְּשִׁעְבּוּד זֶה, וַאֲנִי אֶהְיֶה עִמָּכֶם בְּשִׁעְבּוּד מַלְכֻיוֹת.
human_translation: ‘I will be that I will be,’ The Holy One, Blessed be He, told to go and tell Israel: I was with you in this enslavement, and I will be with you in the enslavement of the kingdoms
llm_translation: "The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses, 'I will be what I will be.' Go and say to the children of Israel: I was with you in this servitude, and I will be with you in the servitude of the kingdoms."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, דַּיָּה לַצָּרָה בִּשְׁעָתָהּ. אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: לֵךְ אֱמוֹר לָהֶם ״אֶהְיֶה שְׁלָחַנִי אֲלֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: said before Him: Master of the Universe, it is enough the suffering at its time. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to him: Go and tell “I will be has sent me to you.”
llm_translation: He said before Him: Master of the world, it is fitting to the trouble in its time. The Holy One, blessed be He, said to him: Go and say to them, "I will send Me to you."

hebrew_text: ״עֲנֵנִי ה׳ עֲנֵנִי״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: לָמָה אָמַר אֵלִיָּהוּ עֲנֵנִי שְׁתֵּי פְּעָמִים? מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאָמַר אֵלִיָּהוּ לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, ״עֲנֵנִי״ — שֶׁתֵּרֵד אֵשׁ מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם וְתֹאכַל כָּל אֲשֶׁר עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, וַ״עֲנֵנִי״ — שֶׁתַּסִּיחַ דַּעְתָּם, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ מַעֲשֵׂה כְשָׁפִים הֵם. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה הֲסִבֹּתָ אֶת לִבָּם אֲחוֹרַנִּית״:
human_translation: “Answer me, Lord, answer me, Rabbi Abbahu said: Why did Elijah say answer me twice? teaches that Elijah said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, answer me that fire will descend from heaven and consume everything that is on the altar, and answer me that You will divert their mind that they will not say that they were acts of sorcery. As it is stated “And You have turned their hearts backward,”
llm_translation: "Answer me, O Lord, answer me." Rabbi Avahu said: Why did Elijah say 'answer me' twice? This teaches that Elijah said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, 'answer me' - that fire should come down from heaven and consume all that is on the altar, and 'answer me' - that you should divert their minds, so that they should not say it is the work of sorcery. As it is said: "And you have turned their hearts backward."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מֵאֵימָתַי קוֹרִין אֶת שְׁמַע בְּשַׁחֲרִית? מִשֶּׁיַּכִּיר בֵּין תְּכֵלֶת לְלָבָן. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בֵּין תְּכֵלֶת לְכָרָתֵי. וְגוֹמְרָהּ, עַד הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר עַד שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁעוֹת, שֶׁכֵּן דֶּרֶךְ מְלָכִים לַעֲמוֹד בְּשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁעוֹת.
human_translation: From when does one recite Shema in the morning From can distinguish between sky-blue [ tekhelet ] and white. Rabbi Eliezer says: between sky-blue and leek-green. And finish until sunrise, Rabbi Yehoshua says: until three hours as that is the habit of kings to rise at three hours
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: From when may one recite the Shema in the morning? From the time one can distinguish between blue and white. Rabbi Eliezer says: Between blue and green. And one completes it until sunrise. Rabbi Yehoshua says until three hours, for it is the way of kings to rise at three hours.

hebrew_text: הַקּוֹרֵא מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — לֹא הִפְסִיד, כְּאָדָם הַקּוֹרֵא בַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: one who recites from that time onward loses nothing. he is like one who reads the Torah,
llm_translation: The one who reads from here and onward - has not lost, like a person who reads in the Torah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי בֵּין תְּכֵלֶת לְלָבָן? אִילֵּימָא בֵּין גְּבָבָא דְעַמְרָא חִיוָּרָא לִגְבָבָא דְעַמְרָא דִתְכֵלְתָּא — הָא בְּלֵילְיָא נָמֵי מִידָּע יָדְעִי. אֶלָּא, בֵּין תְּכֵלֶת שֶׁבָּהּ לְלָבָן שֶׁבָּהּ.
human_translation: what between sky-blue and white If you say a pile of white wool and a pile of sky-blue wool, wouldn’t one know at night, as well? Rather, between the sky-blue and the white in
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the difference between tekhelet and lavan? Perhaps between the sky-blue dye of the wool of Amra and the sky-blue dye of the wool of Tekhelet — that at night one can distinguish. Rather, the difference is between the tekhelet in it and the white in it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁיַּכִּיר בֵּין זְאֵב לְכֶלֶב. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: בֵּין חֲמוֹר לְעָרוֹד. וַאֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: מִשֶּׁיִּרְאֶה אֶת חֲבֵרוֹ רָחוֹק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וְיַכִּירֶנּוּ.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Meir says one can distinguish between a wolf and a dog. Rabbi Akiva says that the between a donkey and a wild donkey. And Aḥerim say: When one can see another a distance of four cubits and recognize him.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Meir says: From when one can distinguish between a wolf and a dog. Rabbi Akiva says: Between a donkey and a wild donkey. And others say: From when one can see his friend from a distance of four cubits, and recognize him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הֲלָכָה כַּאֲחֵרִים. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לִתְפִילִּין כַּאֲחֵרִים. לִקְרִיאַת שְׁמַע כְּוָתִיקִין. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וָתִיקִין הָיוּ גּוֹמְרִין אוֹתָהּ עִם הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: The halakha is in accordance with Aḥerim . Abaye said: phylacteries, is in accordance with Aḥerim . the recitation of in accordance with the vatikin , Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The vatikin would conclude with sunrise,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Halacha like others. Abaye said: Regarding Tefillin like others. Regarding the recitation of Shema, like the elders. As Rabbi Yochanan said, the elders used to finish it with the rising of the sun.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: וָתִיקִין הָיוּ גּוֹמְרִין אוֹתָהּ עִם הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּסְמוֹךְ גְּאוּלָּה לִתְפִלָּה, וְנִמְצָא מִתְפַּלֵּל בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: It was also taught The vatikin would conclude with sunrise in order to juxtapose redemption, with prayer, and pray during the day.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: The elders used to complete it with the rising of the sun, so that redemption would be close to prayer, and one would be found praying during the day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: מַאי קְרָאָה — ״יִירָאוּךָ עִם שָׁמֶשׁ וְלִפְנֵי יָרֵחַ דּוֹר דּוֹרִים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: What verse “They shall fear You with the sun, and before the moon for all generations”
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: What is the verse referring to - "Let them fear you with the sun, and before the moon, generation to generation."

hebrew_text: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן אֶלְיָקִים מִשּׁוּם קְהָלָא קַדִּישָׁא דְבִירוּשָׁלַיִם: כָּל הַסּוֹמֵךְ גְּאוּלָּה לִתְפִלָּה אֵינוֹ נִזּוֹק כָּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei ben Elyakim testified in the name of the holy community in Jerusalem, one who juxtaposes redemption and prayer will incur no harm for the entire day.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei ben Eliezer testified in the name of the holy congregation of Jerusalem: Anyone who connects redemption to prayer is not harmed all day long.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אִינִי?! וְהָא אֲנָא סְמַכִי וְאִיתְּזַקִי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּמַאי אִיתְּזַקְתְּ — דְּאַמְטֵיִית אָסָא לְבֵי מַלְכָּא. הָתָם נָמֵי מִבְּעֵי לָךְ לְמֵיהַב אַגְרָא לְמִחְזֵי אַפֵּי מַלְכָּא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְעוֹלָם יִשְׁתַּדֵּל אָדָם לָרוּץ לִקְרַאת מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל. וְלֹא לִקְרַאת מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּלְבַד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לִקְרַאת מַלְכֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם, שֶׁאִם יִזְכֶּה — יַבְחִין בֵּין מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמַלְכֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Is that so? Didn’t I juxtapose and I was harmed? asked How were you harmed? That you brought a myrtle branch to the king’s palace? there, too, you had to pay a price in order to see the face of the king, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One should always strive to run to greet the kings of Israel And not only to greet the kings of Israel, but even to greet the kings of the nations of the world, so that if he will be privileged he will distinguish between the kings of Israel and the kings of the nations of the world,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: "I?! But I lean on and am supported!" He said to him: "With what are you supported - that you brought a cup to the king's house." There too, if you want, to receive a reward to see the king's face, as Rabbi Yochanan said: "A person should always make an effort to run to meet the kings of Israel. And not only to meet the kings of Israel, but even to meet the kings of the nations of the world, for if he is successful - he will distinguish between the kings of Israel and the kings of the nations of the world!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אִלָּעָא לְעוּלָּא: כִּי עָיְילַתְּ לְהָתָם שְׁאֵיל בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּרַב בְּרוֹנָא אֲחִי בְּמַעֲמַד כָּל הַחֲבוּרָה, דְּאָדָם גָּדוֹל הוּא וְשָׂמֵחַ בְּמִצְוֹת. זִימְנָא חֲדָא סְמַךְ גְּאוּלָּה לִתְפִלָּה וְלָא פְּסֵיק חוּכָא מִפּוּמֵּיהּ כּוּלֵּיהּ יוֹמָא.
human_translation: Rabbi El’a said to Ulla When you go to ask after my brother, Rav Beruna, in the presence of the entire group, as he is a great man who rejoices in mitzvot, Once, juxtaposed redemption and prayer and laughter did not cease from his mouth for the entire day.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Ela'a to Ulai: When you go there, inquire about the well-being of Rav Barona's brother, who is a prominent member of the community, for he is a great man and rejoices in fulfilling commandments. Once, he connected the redemption to the prayer seamlessly, and did not interrupt his daily study at all.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי מָצֵי סָמֵיךְ? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּתְּחִלָּה הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״ה׳ שְׂפָתַי תִּפְתָּח״, וּלְבַסּוֹף הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״יִהְיוּ לְרָצוֹן אִמְרֵי פִי וְגוֹ׳״!
human_translation: How is one able to juxtapose redemption and prayer? Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: At the beginning one says: “Lord, open my lips, and at the end “May the words of my mouth be acceptable
llm_translation: "How is it found adjacent? And this is what Rabbi Yochanan said: Initially, he says, 'Hashem, open my lips,' and in the end, he says, 'May the expressions of my mouth be favorable, etc.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: תְּהֵא בִּתְפִלָּה שֶׁל עַרְבִית.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Let this in the evening prayer
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Let the evening prayer be.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵיזֶהוּ בֶּן הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא — זֶהוּ הַסּוֹמֵךְ גְּאוּלָּה שֶׁל עַרְבִית לִתְפִלָּה שֶׁל עַרְבִית!
human_translation: Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: Who is worthy of the World-to-Come? He who juxtaposes redemption of the evening prayer to the evening prayer.
llm_translation: And this, Rabbi Yochanan said: Who is the son of the world to come? - This is one who connects the redemption of the evening prayer to the evening prayer!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: תְּהֵא בִּתְפִלַּת הַמִּנְחָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Elazar said: Let this the afternoon prayer.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Elazar said: "Let it be in the prayer of the Mincha offering."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא אַכּוּלְּהוּ, וְכֵיוָן דְּקַבְעוּהָ רַבָּנַן בִּתְפִלָּה — כִּתְפִלָּה אֲרִיכְתָּא דָּמְיָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said Even if you say all Since the Sages instituted it is considered as an extended prayer;
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even if you say "eat it," and since the Rabbis established it in prayer - like a long prayer it is considered.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, עַרְבִית הֵיכִי מָצֵי סָמֵיךְ, וְהָא בָּעֵי לְמֵימַר ״הַשְׁכִּיבֵנוּ״! אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן דְּתַקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן הַשְׁכִּיבֵנוּ — כִּגְאוּלָּה אֲרִיכְתָּא דָּמְיָא. הָכִי נָמֵי כֵּיוָן דְּקַבְעוּהָ רַבָּנַן בִּתְפִלָּה — כִּתְפִלָּה אֲרִיכְתָּא דָּמְיָא.
human_translation: As if you do not say so, how does one juxtapose the evening prayer? Mustn’t one recite: Help us lie down [ hashkivenu ] Rather, since the Sages instituted Help us lie down, it is considered as an extended blessing of redemption. So, too, since the Sages instituted it is considered as an extended prayer.
llm_translation: If you don't say it like this, how can you find the evening prayer adjacent, and he wants to say "lay us down"! Rather, since the Rabbis established "lay us down" - it is like a lengthy redemption. This is what is said: since the Rabbis established it in the prayer - it is like a lengthy prayer.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי, הַאי ״יִהְיוּ לְרָצוֹן אִמְרֵי פִי״ מַשְׁמַע לִבְסוֹף, וּמַשְׁמַע מֵעִיקָּרָא דְּבָעֵינָא לְמֵימַר. מַאי טַעְמָא תַּקְּנוּהוּ רַבָּנַן לְאַחַר שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה בְּרָכוֹת? לֵימְרוּ מֵעִיקָּרָא!
human_translation: Now, since this “May the words of my mouth be acceptable connote the end and connote the beginning that he wants to recite: Why did the Sages institute after the eighteen blessings Let it be recited at the beginning
llm_translation: From when, this "May the sayings of my mouth be acceptable" implies at the end, and it implies from the beginning that I want to say. What is the reason the Rabbis instituted it after the eighteen blessings? Let them say it from the beginning!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי: הוֹאִיל וְלֹא אֲמָרוֹ דָּוִד אֶלָּא לְאַחַר שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת, לְפִיכָךְ תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן לְאַחַר שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה בְּרָכוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, said: because David only said after eighteen chapters Therefore, the Sages instituted after the eighteen blessings
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazzi, said: Since David only instituted the recitation of the blessing of "David the King of Israel lives forever" after eighteen sections of Psalms, therefore the Rabbis established the recitation of the blessing of "Who builds Jerusalem" after eighteen blessings.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה?! תְּשַׁע עֶשְׂרֵה הָוְיָן!
human_translation: these eighteen They are nineteen
llm_translation: These eighteen?! They are nineteen!

hebrew_text: ״אַשְׁרֵי הָאִישׁ״ וְ״לָמָּה רָגְשׁוּ גוֹיִם״ חֲדָא פָּרָשָׁה הִיא.
human_translation: “Happy is the man,” and “Why are the nations in an uproar,” constitute a single chapter,
llm_translation: "Fortunate is the man" and "Why have the nations tumultuously assembled" - this is one interpretation.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי: מֵאָה וְשָׁלֹשׁ פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת אָמַר דָּוִד, וְלֹא אָמַר ״הַלְלוּיָהּ״ עַד שֶׁרָאָה בְּמַפַּלְתָּן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יִתַּמּוּ חַטָּאִים מִן הָאָרֶץ וּרְשָׁעִים עוֹד אֵינָם, בָּרְכִי נַפְשִׁי אֶת ה׳ הַלְלוּיָהּ״.
human_translation: As Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, said: David said one hundred and three chapters, and he did not say Halleluya until he saw the downfall of the wicked. As it is stated: “Let sinners cease from the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless the Lord, my soul, Halleluya ”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, said: David said one hundred and three sections, and did not say "Hallelujah" until he saw the downfall of the wicked, as it is stated: "Let sinners be consumed from the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless the Lord, Hallelujah."

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מֵאָה וְשָׁלֹשׁ? מֵאָה וְאַרְבַּע הָוְיָין! אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ ״אַשְׁרֵי הָאִישׁ״ וְ״לָמָּה רָגְשׁוּ גוֹיִם״ חֲדָא פָּרָשָׁה הִיא.
human_translation: these one hundred and three They are one hundred and four. Rather, conclude from this “Happy is the man” and “Why are the nations in uproar” constitute a single portion.
llm_translation: These one hundred and three? They are actually one hundred and four! Rather, learn from it "Happy is the man" and "Why have the nations raged" - this is one section.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yoḥanan said:
llm_translation: As Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said, Rabbi Yochanan said:

hebrew_text: כָּל פָּרָשָׁה שֶׁהָיְתָה חֲבִיבָה עַל דָּוִד, פָּתַח בָּהּ בְּ״אַשְׁרֵי״ וְסִייֵּם בָּהּ בְּ״אַשְׁרֵי״. פָּתַח בְּ״אַשְׁרֵי״, דִּכְתִיב: ״אַשְׁרֵי הָאִישׁ״. וְסִייֵּם בְּ״אַשְׁרֵי״, דִּכְתִיב: ״אַשְׁרֵי כָּל חוֹסֵי בוֹ״.
human_translation: Every chapter that was dear to David, he began with “happy is” and concluded with “happy is.” He opened with “happy is,” as it is written: “Happy is the man And he concluded with “happy,” as it is written Happy are those who take refuge in Him”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Every portion that was beloved to David, he began with "Ashrei" and ended with "Ashrei." He began with "Ashrei," as it is written: "Happy is the man." And he ended with "Ashrei," as it is written: "Happy are all who take refuge in Him." English translation: Every portion that was beloved to David, he began with "Ashrei" and ended with "Ashrei." He began with "Ashrei," as it is written: "Happy is the man." And he ended with "Ashrei," as it is written: "Happy are all who take refuge in Him."

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ בִּרְיוֹנֵי דַּהֲווֹ בְּשִׁבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר וַהֲווֹ קָא מְצַעֲרוּ לֵיהּ טוּבָא. הֲוָה קָא בָּעֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר רַחֲמֵי עִלָּוַיְהוּ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֵימוּתוּ. אָמְרָה לֵיהּ בְּרוּרְיָא דְּבֵיתְהוּ: מַאי דַּעְתָּךְ — מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב ״יִתַּמּוּ חַטָּאִים״, מִי כְּתִיב ״חוֹטְאִים״? ״חַטָּאִים״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: There were these hooligans in Rabbi Meir’s neighborhood who caused him a great deal of anguish. Rabbi Meir prayed for mercy on them, that they should die. Rabbi Meir’s wife, Berurya, said to him: What is your thinking? as it is written: “Let sins cease from the land” is it written, sinners sins is written.
llm_translation: Behold, the sons of the household who were in the neighborhood of Rabbi Meir were causing him great distress. Rabbi Meir sought mercy for them, that they should repent. His wife Beruriah said to him: "What is your opinion? Because it is written 'Let sinners be consumed,' who is written as 'sinners'? 'Sinners' is written."

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, שְׁפֵיל לְסֵיפֵיהּ דִּקְרָא ״וּרְשָׁעִים עוֹד אֵינָם״, כֵּיוָן דְּ״יִתַּמּוּ חַטָּאִים״ ״וּרְשָׁעִים עוֹד אֵינָם״? אֶלָּא בְּעִי רַחֲמֵי עִלָּוַיְהוּ דְּלַהְדְּרוּ בִּתְשׁוּבָה, ״וּרְשָׁעִים עוֹד אֵינָם״.
human_translation: Moreover, go to the end of the verse, “And the wicked will be no more.” transgressions shall cease the wicked will be no more, Rather, pray for mercy on them, that they should repent,
llm_translation: And furthermore, low to its end of the verse "And the wicked are no more," since "sinners will be consumed" "And the wicked are no more"? Rather, seek mercy for them that they may return in repentance, "And the wicked are no more."

hebrew_text: בְּעָא רַחֲמֵי עִלָּוַיְהוּ, וַהֲדַרוּ בִּתְשׁוּבָה.
human_translation: and he prayed for mercy on them, and they repented.
llm_translation: Requested: Inquired the Merciful Ones for Eliyahu, and they adorned in repentance.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לַהּ הַהוּא מִינָא לִבְרוּרְיָא: כְּתִיב ״רָנִּי עֲקָרָה לֹא יָלָדָה״, מִשּׁוּם דְּלֹא יָלָדָה — רָנִּי?
human_translation: A certain heretic said to Berurya: It is written: “Sing, barren woman who has not given birth, Because she has not given birth, sing
llm_translation: He said to her that heretic: It is written, "Rejoice, O barren one who did not give birth," because she did not give birth - rejoice?

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: שָׁטְיָא, שְׁפֵיל לְסֵיפֵיהּ דִּקְרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי רַבִּים בְּנֵי שׁוֹמֵמָה מִבְּנֵי בְעוּלָה אָמַר ה׳״.
human_translation: said: Fool! Go to the end of the verse, where it is written: “For the children of the desolate shall be more numerous than the children of the married wife, said the Lord.”
llm_translation: She said to him: "Shatya, bow down to the end of the verse, as it is written: 'For many are the children of the desolate one, more than the children of the married one,' says the Lord."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי ״עֲקָרָה לֹא יָלָדָה״ — רָנִּי כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁדּוֹמָה לְאִשָּׁה עֲקָרָה שֶׁלֹּא יָלְדָה בָּנִים לְגֵיהִנָּם כְּוָתַיְיכוּ.
human_translation: Rather, what “Sing, barren woman who has not given birth”? Sing congregation of Israel, which is like a barren woman who did not give birth to children who are for Gehenna like you.
llm_translation: Rather, what is the meaning of "a barren woman did not give birth"? — Rejoice, congregation of Israel, who is likened to a barren woman who did not give birth to children for Gehinnom, like the verse says: "Sing, O barren one, who did not bear!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, כְּתִיב: ״מִזְמוֹר לְדָוִד בְּבָרְחוֹ מִפְּנֵי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנוֹ״, וּכְתִיב: ״לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם בְּבָרְחוֹ מִפְּנֵי שָׁאוּל בַּמְּעָרָה״. הֵי מַעֲשֶׂה הֲוָה בְּרֵישָׁא? מִכְּדִי מַעֲשֵׂה שָׁאוּל הֲוָה בְּרֵישָׁא, לִכְתּוֹב בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: A certain heretic said to Rabbi Abbahu, it is written: “A Psalm of David, when he fled from his son, Absalom” and it is said: a mikhtam of David when fleeing from Saul into the cave” Which event was first? Since the event with Saul was first, to write it first.
llm_translation: He said to him that heretic to Rabbi Avahu, it is written: "A Psalm of David when he fled from Absalom his son," and it is written: "Of David, a Michtam, when he fled from Saul in the cave." Was the incident at the beginning? Since the incident of Saul was at the beginning, it should be written at the beginning.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתּוּן דְּלָא דָּרְשִׁיתוּן סְמוּכִין — קַשְׁיָא לְכוּ, אֲנַן דְּדָרְשִׁינַן סְמוּכִים — לָא קַשְׁיָא לַן.
human_translation: said to him: you, who do homiletic of juxtaposition it is difficult. us, who homiletic of juxtaposition it is not difficult,
llm_translation: He said to them: You who did not expound adjacent texts — it is difficult for you, we who expound adjacent texts — it is not difficult for us.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: סְמוּכִין מִן הַתּוֹרָה מִנַּיִן — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״סְמוּכִים לָעַד לְעוֹלָם עֲשׂוּיִם בֶּאֱמֶת וְיָשָׁר״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: From where juxtaposition As it is said: Adjoined forever and ever, made in truth and uprightness”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Derived from the Torah, how do we know the concept of 'close to God forever, made in truth and uprightness'?" English translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Derived from the Torah, how do we know the concept of 'close to God forever, made in truth and uprightness'?"

hebrew_text: לָמָּה נִסְמְכָה פָּרָשַׁת אַבְשָׁלוֹם לְפָרָשַׁת גּוֹג וּמָגוֹג — שֶׁאִם יֹאמַר לְךָ אָדָם: כְּלוּם יֵשׁ עֶבֶד שֶׁמּוֹרֵד בְּרַבּוֹ?! אַף אַתָּה אֱמוֹר לוֹ: כְּלוּם יֵשׁ בֵּן שֶׁמּוֹרֵד בְּאָבִיו? אֶלָּא הֲוָה, הָכָא נָמֵי הֲוָה.
human_translation: Why was the chapter of Absalom juxtaposed with the chapter of Gog and Magog? so if a person should say to you, Is there a slave who rebels against his master? You too say to him: Is there a son who rebels against his father Yet, there was so too there be
llm_translation: Why was the portion of Absalom juxtaposed to the portion of Gog and Magog? Because if someone says to you: Is there such a thing as a slave who rebels against his master?! You should respond to him: Is there such a thing as a son who rebels against his father? Rather, just as it was here, so it was there.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי. מַאי דִּכְתִיב, ״פִּיהָ פָּתְחָה בְחָכְמָה וְתוֹרַת חֶסֶד עַל לְשׁוֹנָהּ״. כְּנֶגֶד מִי אָמַר שְׁלֹמֹה מִקְרָא זֶה? — לֹא אֲמָרוֹ אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד דָּוִד אָבִיו, שֶׁדָּר בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עוֹלָמִים, וְאָמַר שִׁירָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: What is that which is written: “She opens her mouth with wisdom, and the teaching of loving-kindness is on her tongue” with reference to whom did Solomon say this verse? He said this about none other than his father, David, who resided in five worlds and said a song
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: What is the meaning of what is written, "She opens her mouth with wisdom, and the teaching of kindness is on her tongue"? Against whom did Solomon say this verse? — They did not say except against his father David, who expounded in five worlds, and said a song.

hebrew_text: דָּר בִּמְעֵי אִמּוֹ וְאָמַר שִׁירָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּרְכִי נַפְשִׁי אֶת ה׳ וְכָל קְרָבַי אֶת שֵׁם קָדְשׁוֹ״.
human_translation: He resided in his mother’s womb, and said a song as it is stated: Bless the Lord, O my soul and all that is within me bless His holy name”
llm_translation: He resided in the innards of his mother and said a song, as it is stated: "Bless the Lord, O my soul, and all that is within me, bless His holy name."

hebrew_text: יָצָא לַאֲוִיר הָעוֹלָם וְנִסְתַּכֵּל בְּכוֹכָבִים וּמַזָּלוֹת וְאָמַר שִׁירָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּרְכוּ ה׳ מַלְאָכָיו גִּבֹּרֵי כֹחַ עוֹשֵׂי דְבָרוֹ לִשְׁמֹעַ בְּקוֹל דְּבָרוֹ בָּרְכוּ ה׳ כָּל צְבָאָיו וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: He emerged into the atmosphere of the world, looked upon the stars and constellations and said a song as it is stated: “Bless the Lord, His angels, mighty in strength, that fulfill His word, listening to the voice of His word. Bless the Lord, all His hosts,
llm_translation: He went out to the air of the world and gazed at the stars and constellations and said a song, as it is said: "Bless the Lord, His angels, mighty in strength, who do His bidding, obedient to the sound of His words. Bless the Lord, all His hosts, etc."

hebrew_text: יָנַק מִשְּׁדֵי אִמּוֹ וְנִסְתַּכֵּל בְּדַדֶּיהָ וְאָמַר שִׁירָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּרְכִי נַפְשִׁי אֶת ה׳ וְאַל תִּשְׁכְּחִי כָּל גְּמוּלָיו״.
human_translation: He nursed from his mother’s breast, and he looked upon her bosom and said a song as it is stated: “Bless the Lord, O my soul, and do not forget all His benefits [ gemulav ]”
llm_translation: He sucked from his mother's breasts and gazed at her breasts and said a song, as it is said: "Bless the Lord, O my soul, and forget not all His benefits."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כָּל גְּמוּלָיו״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: שֶׁעָשָׂה לָהּ דַּדִּים בִּמְקוֹם בִּינָה.
human_translation: what is all His benefits? Rabbi Abbahu said: placed her breasts the place of understanding.
llm_translation: "What is 'all his dealings'?" Rabbi Abbahu said: that he made for her breasts in place of understanding."

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא מַאי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִסְתַּכֵּל בִּמְקוֹם עֶרְוָה. רַב מַתְנָא אָמַר: כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִינַק מִמְּקוֹם הַטִּנּוֹפֶת.
human_translation: What is the reason Rav Yehuda said: So that would not look upon the place of nakedness. Rav Mattana said: So that would not nurse from a place of uncleanliness.
llm_translation: Reason what? Said Rav Yehudah: in order not to look at a place of nakedness. Rav Matna said: in order not to suck from the place of the teat.

hebrew_text: רָאָה בְּמַפַּלְתָּן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים, וְאָמַר שִׁירָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יִתַּמּוּ חַטָּאִים מִן הָאָרֶץ וּרְשָׁעִים עוֹד אֵינָם בָּרְכִי נַפְשִׁי אֶת ה׳ הַלְלוּיָהּ״.
human_translation: He witnessed the downfall of the wicked and he said a song as it is stated: “Let sinners cease from the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless the Lord, O my soul, Halleluya ”
llm_translation: He saw in the destruction of the wicked, and he said a song, as it is said: "Let sinners be consumed from the earth, and let the wicked be no more. Bless the Lord, O my soul. Hallelujah."

hebrew_text: נִסְתַּכֵּל בְּיוֹם הַמִּיתָה, וְאָמַר שִׁירָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּרְכִי נַפְשִׁי אֶת ה׳, ה׳ אֱלֹהַי גָּדַלְתָּ מְּאֹד הוֹד וְהָדָר לָבָשְׁתָּ״.
human_translation: looked upon the day of death and said a song as it is stated: “Bless the Lord, O my soul. Lord my God, You are very great; You are clothed in glory and majesty”
llm_translation: He gazed on the day of death, and said a song, as it is said: "Bless, O my soul, the Lord, O Lord my God, You are very great; You have donned grandeur and splendor."

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּעַל יוֹם הַמִּיתָה נֶאֱמַר? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא, מִסֵּיפָא דְעִנְיָינָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״תַּסְתִּיר פָּנֶיךָ יִבָּהֵלוּן תֹּסֵף רוּחָם יִגְוָעוּן וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: From where is it inferred this was stated with regard to the day of death? from the end of the matter, it is written: “You hide Your face, they vanish; You gather Your breath, they perish
llm_translation: What is implied by the fact that it is stated "on the day of death"? Rabba bar Rav Sheila said, from the latter part of the matter, as it is written: "You hide Your face, they are terrified; You take away their breath, they expire" (Job 34:29).

hebrew_text: רַב שִׁימִי בַּר עוּקְבָא וְאָמְרִי לַהּ מָר עוּקְבָא, הֲוָה שְׁכִיחַ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי, וַהֲוָה מְסַדַּר אַגָּדָתָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי דִּכְתִיב, ״בָּרְכִי נַפְשִׁי אֶת ה׳ וְכָל קְרָבַי אֶת שֵׁם קָדְשׁוֹ״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בֹּא וּרְאֵה שֶׁלֹּא כְּמִדַּת הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וָדָם. מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וָדָם צָר צוּרָה עַל גַּבֵּי הַכּוֹתֶל, וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהָטִיל בָּהּ רוּחַ וּנְשָׁמָה קְרָבַיִם וּבְנֵי מֵעַיִם. וְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֵינוֹ כֵּן, צָר צוּרָה בְּתוֹךְ צוּרָה וּמֵטִיל בָּהּ רוּחַ וּנְשָׁמָה קְרָבַיִם וּבְנֵי מֵעַיִם. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרָה חַנָּה: ״אֵין קָדוֹשׁ כַּה׳ כִּי אֵין בִּלְתֶּךָ וְאֵין צוּר כֵּאלֹהֵינוּ״.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ukva, and some say Mar Ukva, would regularly before Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, would arrange the aggada before Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. said to him: What is that which is written: “Bless the Lord, my soul, and all that is within me bless His Holy name”? said to Come and see that the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He, is not like the attribute of flesh and blood, The attribute of flesh and blood is shapes a form on the wall he cannot instill it with a spirit and soul, bowels and intestines. the Holy One, Blessed be He, is not so, shapes one form within another form, and instills it with spirit and soul, bowels and intestines. And this is what Hannah said “There is none holy like the Lord, for there is none like You, and there is no Rock like our God”
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ukva and some say Mar Ukva, was often found standing before Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, arranging aggadeta before Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. He said to him: What is the meaning of what is written, "Bless the Lord, O my soul, and all that is within me, bless His holy name"? He said to him: Come and see that the attribute of the Holy One, blessed be He, is not like the attribute of flesh and blood. The attribute of flesh and blood forms a vessel on the wall, and cannot contain within it the breath, soul, innards, and offspring. But the Holy One, blessed be He, is not so; He forms one vessel within another and places within it the breath, soul, innards, and offspring. This is what Hannah said: "There is none holy as the Lord, for there is none beside You, neither is there any rock like our God."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אֵין צוּר כֵּאלֹהֵינוּ״ — אֵין צַיָּיר כֵּאלֹהֵינוּ.
human_translation: What is there is no rock [ tzur ] like our God? There is no artist [ tzayyar ] like our God.
llm_translation: What is "There is no rock like our God"? - There is no artist like our God.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כִּי אֵין בִּלְתֶּךָ״? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר מְנַסְיָא: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״כִּי אֵין בִּלְתֶּךָ״, אֶלָּא ״אֵין לְבַלּוֹתֶךָ״. שֶׁלֹּא כְּמִדַּת הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וָדָם: מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וָדָם — מַעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו מְבַלִּין אוֹתוֹ, וְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְבַלֶּה מַעֲשָׂיו.
human_translation: What is “there is none like You”? Rabbi Yehuda ben Menasya said: Do not read “there is none like You [ biltekha ]”; rather, read “none can outlast You [ levalotkha ],” as the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He, is not like the attribute of flesh and blood: The attribute of flesh and blood is that his creations outlast him, the Holy One, Blessed be He, outlasts His actions.
llm_translation: What is "for there is no enchantment against Jacob"? Rabbi Yehuda bar Menasya said: Do not read "for there is no enchantment against Jacob," but rather "for there is no divination against Israel." Not like the measure of the Holy One, blessed be He, is the measure of flesh and blood. The measure of flesh and blood - his handiwork may be nullified, but the Holy One, blessed be He, nullifies His handiwork.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, אֲנָא הָכִי קָא אָמֵינָא לָךְ: הָנֵי חֲמִשָּׁה ״בָּרְכִי נַפְשִׁי״ כְּנֶגֶד מִי אֲמָרָן דָּוִד? לֹא אֲמָרָן אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וּכְנֶגֶד נְשָׁמָה.
human_translation: said to I say to you as follows: Corresponding to whom did David say these five “Bless O my soul”? He said them about none other than the Holy One, Blessed be He, and corresponding to the soul,
llm_translation: He said to him, "I thus say to you: These five 'Bar'khi Nafshi' correspond to whom did David say? He did not say except corresponding to the Holy One, blessed be He, and corresponding to the soul."

hebrew_text: מָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מָלֵא כָּל הָעוֹלָם — אַף נְשָׁמָה מְלֵאָה אֶת כָּל הַגּוּף. מָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רוֹאֶה וְאֵינוֹ נִרְאֶה — אַף נְשָׁמָה רוֹאָה וְאֵינָהּ נִרְאֵית. מָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא זָן אֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם כֻּלּוֹ — אַף נְשָׁמָה זָנָה אֶת כָּל הַגּוּף. מָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא טָהוֹר — אַף נְשָׁמָה טְהוֹרָה. מָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא יוֹשֵׁב בְּחַדְרֵי חֲדָרִים — אַף נְשָׁמָה יוֹשֶׁבֶת בְּחַדְרֵי חֲדָרִים. יָבֹא מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ חֲמִשָּׁה דְבָרִים הַלָּלוּ וִישַׁבֵּחַ לְמִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ חֲמִשָּׁה דְבָרִים הַלָּלוּ.
human_translation: Just as the Holy One, Blessed be He, fills the entire world, so too the soul fills the entire body. Just as the Holy One, Blessed be He, sees but is not seen, so too does the soul see, but is not seen. Just as the Holy One, Blessed be He, sustains the entire world, so too the soul sustains the entire body. Just as the Holy One, Blessed be He, is pure, so too is the soul pure. Just as the Holy One, Blessed be He, resides in a chamber within a chamber, so too the soul resides in a chamber within a chamber, that which has these five characteristics, should come and praise He Who has these five characteristics.
llm_translation: The Holy One, blessed be He, fills the entire world - so too, the soul fills the entire body. Just as the Holy One, blessed be He, sees but is not seen - so too, the soul sees but is not seen. Just as the Holy One, blessed be He, sustains the entire world - so too, the soul sustains the entire body. Just as the Holy One, blessed be He, is pure - so too, the soul is pure. Just as the Holy One, blessed be He, dwells in the innermost chambers - so too, the soul dwells in the innermost chambers. Let one come who possesses these five attributes and praise one who possesses these five attributes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״מִי כְּהֶחָכָם וּמִי יוֹדֵעַ פֵּשֶׁר דָּבָר״ — מִי כְּהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לַעֲשׂוֹת פְּשָׁרָה בֵּין שְׁנֵי צַדִּיקִים, בֵּין חִזְקִיָּהוּ לִישַׁעְיָהוּ. חִזְקִיָּהוּ אֲמַר: לֵיתֵי יְשַׁעְיָהוּ גַּבַּאי, דְּהָכִי אַשְׁכְּחַן בְּאֵלִיָּהוּ דַּאֲזַל לְגַבֵּי אַחְאָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ אֵלִיָּהוּ לְהֵרָאוֹת אֶל אַחְאָב״. יְשַׁעְיָהוּ אֲמַר: לֵיתֵי חִזְקִיָּהוּ גַּבַּאי דְּהָכִי אַשְׁכְּחַן בִּיהוֹרָם בֶּן אַחְאָב דַּאֲזַל לְגַבֵּי אֱלִישָׁע.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: What is that which is written “Who is like the wise man, and who knows the interpretation [ pesher ] of the matter” Who is like the Holy One, Blessed be He, Who knows how to effect compromise [ peshara ] between two righteous individuals, between Hezekiah, and Isaiah Hezekiah said: Let Isaiah come to me, as that is what we find with regard to Elijah who went to Ahab, as it is stated: “And Elijah went to appear to Ahab” And Isaiah said: Let Hezekiah come to me, as that is what we find with regard to Yehoram ben Ahab, who went to Elisha
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: What is the meaning of the verse, "Who is like the wise man, and who knows the interpretation of a matter"? — It is like the Holy One, blessed be He, who knows how to interpret between two righteous individuals, between Hezekiah and Isaiah. Hezekiah said: Let Isaiah come and resolve the difficulty, for thus I found in Elijah who went to meet Ahab, as it is stated, "And Elijah went to show himself to Ahab." Isaiah said: Let Hezekiah come and resolve the difficulty, for thus I found in Jehoram son of Ahab who went to meet Elisha.

hebrew_text: מָה עָשָׂה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא — הֵבִיא יִסּוּרִים עַל חִזְקִיָּהוּ, וְאָמַר לוֹ לִישַׁעְיָהוּ: לֵךְ וּבַקֵּר אֶת הַחוֹלֶה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּיָּמִים הָהֵם חָלָה חִזְקִיָּהוּ לָמוּת וַיָּבֹא אֵלָיו יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶּן אָמוֹץ הַנָּבִיא וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלָיו כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ צְבָאוֹת צַו לְבֵיתֶךָ כִּי מֵת אַתָּה וְלֹא תִחְיֶה וְגוֹ׳״. מַאי ״כִּי מֵת אַתָּה וְלֹא תִחְיֶה״: מֵת אַתָּה — בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, וְלֹא תִחְיֶה — לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: What did the Holy One, Blessed be He, do He brought the suffering upon Hezekiah and told Isaiah: Go and visit the sick. as it is stated: “In those days Hezekiah became deathly ill, and Isaiah ben Amoz the prophet came and said to him: Thus says the Lord of Hosts: Set your house in order, for you will die and you will not live” what is you will die and you will not live? You will die in this world, and you will not live, in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: The Holy One, blessed be He, what did He do? He brought afflictions upon Hezekiah, and said to Isaiah: "Go and visit the sick." As it is stated: "In those days Hezekiah became ill to the point of death, and Isaiah the son of Amoz the prophet came to him and said to him, 'Thus says the Lord of hosts: Command your household, for you shall die and not live, etc.'" What is meant by "for you shall die and not live"? "You shall die" - in this world, "and not live" - in the world to come.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי כּוּלֵּי הַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא עֲסַקְתְּ בִּפְרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשּׁוּם דַּחֲזַאי לִי בְּרוּחַ הַקֹּדֶשׁ דְּנָפְקִי מִינַּאי בְּנִין דְּלָא מְעַלּוּ.
human_translation: said to him: What is all of this? said to him: Because you did not engage in procreation. said: because I envisaged through divine inspiration that the children that emerge from me will not be virtuous.
llm_translation: He said to him: What is the reason for all this? He said to him: Because you did not engage in the commandment of procreation. He said to him: Because I saw with the Holy Spirit that offspring would come out from me who would not be worthy.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בַּהֲדֵי כַּבְשֵׁי דְרַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לָךְ? מַאי דְּמִפַּקְּדַתְּ אִיבְּעִי לָךְ לְמֶעְבַּד, וּמָה דְנִיחָא קַמֵּיהּ קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא — לַעֲבֵיד.
human_translation: said to him: Why do you yourself with the secrets of the Holy One, Blessed be He? That which you have been commanded, you are required to perform, and that which is acceptable the Holy One, Blessed be He, let Him perform,
llm_translation: He said to him: "With the help of the Merciful One's lambs, why do you need? What you are entrusted with, ask for it to be done for you, and what is left appropriate before the Holy One, blessed be He - do."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא הַב לִי בְּרַתָּךְ, אֶפְשָׁר דְּגָרְמָא זְכוּתָא דִידִי וְדִידָךְ, וְנָפְקִי מִנַּאי בְּנִין דִּמְעַלּוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּבָר נִגְזְרָה עָלֶיךָ גְּזֵירָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בֶּן אָמוֹץ, כַּלֵּה נְבוּאָתְךָ וָצֵא!
human_translation: said to Now give me your daughter perhaps my merit and your merit will cause virtuous children to emerge from me. said to him: The decree has already been decreed against you said to him: Son of Amoz, cease your prophecy and leave.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Now bring me your daughter, perhaps the merit of mine and yours will cause the building above to come out from us." He said to him: "A decree has already been decreed upon you." He said to him: "Son of Amotz, fulfill your prophecy and leave!"

hebrew_text: כָּךְ מְקּוּבְּלַנִי מִבֵּית אֲבִי אַבָּא, אֲפִילּוּ חֶרֶב חַדָּה מוּנַּחַת עַל צַוָּארוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם, אַל יִמְנַע עַצְמוֹ מִן הָרַחֲמִים.
human_translation: I have received a tradition from the house of my father’s father, Even a sharp sword rests upon a person’s neck, he should not prevent himself from mercy.
llm_translation: So was I received from the house of my father's father, even if a sharp sword is placed upon the neck of a person, he should not withhold himself from mercy.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר נָמֵי, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: אֲפִילּוּ חֶרֶב חַדָּה מוּנַּחַת עַל צַוָּארוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם, אַל יִמְנַע עַצְמוֹ מִן הָרַחֲמִים. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֵן יִקְטְלֵנִי לוֹ אֲיַחֵל״.
human_translation: it was also said Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Eliezer both said: Even if a sharp sword is resting upon a person’s neck, he should not prevent himself from mercy, as it is stated “Though He slay me, I will trust in Him”
llm_translation: It was stated: Namely, Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Eliezer who both said: Even if a sharp sword is placed upon the neck of a person, he should not withhold himself from mercy. As it is said: "If he would kill me, I will hope in him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָנָן: אֲפִילּוּ בַּעַל הַחֲלוֹמוֹת אוֹמֵר לוֹ לְאָדָם לְמָחָר הוּא מֵת — אַל יִמְנַע עַצְמוֹ מִן הָרַחֲמִים. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי בְרֹב חֲלֹמוֹת וַהֲבָלִים וּדְבָרִים הַרְבֵּה כִּי אֶת הָאֱלֹהִים יְרָא״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanan said: Even if the master of dreams, tells a person that tomorrow he will die, he should not prevent himself from mercy, as it is stated: “For in the multitude of dreams and vanities there are many words; but fear God”
llm_translation: Rabbi Hanan said: Even if a dream interpreter tells a person that he will die tomorrow, he should not withhold himself from seeking mercy. As it is stated: "For with many dreams and vanities and many words, fear God."

hebrew_text: מִיָּד ״וַיַּסֵּב חִזְקִיָּהוּ פָּנָיו אֶל הַקִּיר וַיִּתְפַּלֵּל אֶל ה׳״.
human_translation: immediately “Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall and prayed to the Lord”
llm_translation: Immediately "And Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the Lord."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״קִיר״? אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: מִקִּירוֹת לִבּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מֵעַי מֵעַי אוֹחִילָה קִירוֹת לִבִּי וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: What is “wall [ kir ]” Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: from the chambers [ kirot ] of his heart, as it is stated “My anguish, my anguish, I am in pain. The chambers of my heart.
llm_translation: What is "kiyr"? Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: From the walls of his heart, as it is said: "My bowels, my bowels! I writhe in pain! The walls of my heart!" (Jeremiah 4:19)

hebrew_text: רַבִּי לֵוִי אָמַר: עַל עִסְקֵי הַקִּיר, אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, וּמָה שׁוּנַמִּית שֶׁלֹּא עָשְׂתָה אֶלָּא קִיר אַחַת קְטַנָּה הֶחֱיֵיתָ אֶת בְּנָהּ, אֲבִי אַבָּא שֶׁחִפָּה אֶת הַהֵיכָל כּוּלּוֹ בְּכֶסֶף וּבְזָהָב עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה. ״זְכָר נָא אֵת אֲשֶׁר הִתְהַלַּכְתִּי לְפָנֶיךָ בֶּאֱמֶת וּבְלֵב שָׁלֵם וְהַטּוֹב בְּעֵינֶיךָ עָשִׂיתִי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Levi said: matters to a wall, he said before Master of the Universe, and if the woman from Shunem, who made only a single small wall you revived her son, all the more so my father’s father, who covered the entire Sanctuary with silver and gold. please remember that I walked before You in truth, and with a complete heart, and what was good in Your eyes I did.
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi said: Regarding the matters of the wall, he said before Him: Master of the world, and what difference is there that she only made one small wall, and You have revived her son, whereas my grandfather's father adorned the entire Temple with silver and gold, how much more so. "Remember now what I have walked before You in truth and with a whole heart, and what is good in Your eyes I have done."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְהַטּוֹב בְּעֵינֶיךָ עָשִׂיתִי״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שֶׁסָּמַךְ גְּאוּלָּה לִתְפִלָּה. רַבִּי לֵוִי אָמַר: שֶׁגָּנַז סֵפֶר רְפוּאוֹת.
human_translation: what “And what was good in your sight I did”? Rav Yehuda said in the name of Rav that he juxtaposed redemption and prayer Rabbi Levi said: He suppressed the Book of Remedies
llm_translation: What is "And the good in Your eyes I have done"? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: that he connected redemption to prayer. Rabbi Levi said: that he stored away the book of remedies.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁשָּׁה דְבָרִים עָשָׂה חִזְקִיָּהוּ הַמֶּלֶךְ, עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה הוֹדוּ לוֹ, וְעַל שְׁלֹשָׁה לֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: King Hezekiah performed six actions. With regard to three agreed with him, and with regard to three they did not agree with him.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Six things did King Hezekiah do, for three he was praised, and for three he was not praised.

hebrew_text: עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה הוֹדוּ לוֹ: גָּנַז סֵפֶר רְפוּאוֹת — וְהוֹדוּ לוֹ. כִּתֵּת נְחַשׁ הַנְּחשֶׁת — וְהוֹדוּ לוֹ. גֵּירַר עַצְמוֹת אָבִיו עַל מִטָּה שֶׁל חֲבָלִים — וְהוֹדוּ לוֹ.
human_translation: With regard to three agreed with him: He suppressed the Book of Remedies, and they agreed with him. He ground the copper snake and they agreed with him. He dragged the bones of his father, on a bed of ropes; and they agreed with him.
llm_translation: On three things they praised him: He hid the book of remedies - and they praised him. He smashed the copper serpent - and they praised him. He gathered the bones of his father on a bed of ropes - and they praised him.

hebrew_text: וְעַל שְׁלֹשָׁה לֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ: סָתַם מֵי גִיחוֹן — וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ. קִצֵּץ דַּלְתוֹת הֵיכָל וְשִׁגְּרָם לְמֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר — וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ. עִבֵּר נִיסָן בְּנִיסָן — וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ.
human_translation: with regard to three did not agree with him: He stopped up the waters of the Gihon, and they did not agree with him. He cut off the doors of the Sanctuary and sent them to the king of Assyria and they did not agree with him. He intercalated Nisan in Nisan,
llm_translation: And on three they did not praise him: The flowing waters of Gihon - and they did not praise him. He cut the doors of the Temple and sent them to the king of Assyria - and they did not praise him. He passed over Nisan in Nisan - and they did not praise him.

hebrew_text: וּמִי לֵית לֵיהּ לְחִזְקִיָּהוּ, ״הַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה לָכֶם רֹאשׁ חֳדָשִׁים״: זֶה נִיסָן וְאֵין אַחֵר נִיסָן?!
human_translation: Did Hezekiah not “This month will be for you the first of the months; this is Nisan, and no other is Nisan.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who does not agree with Hezekiah, "This month is for you the beginning of months": this is Nisan, and there is no other Nisan?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, טְעָה בְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה בְּיוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים שֶׁל אֲדָר, הוֹאִיל וְרָאוּי לְקוֹבְעוֹ נִיסָן. סָבַר: ״הוֹאִיל וְרָאוּי״ — לָא אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: Rather, Hezekiah erred with regard to Shmuel, Shmuel said: One may not intercalate the year on the thirtieth day of Adar, since it is fit to establish it Nisan. held we do not say: Since is fit to establish it
llm_translation: Rather, he erred in the name of Shmuel, for Shmuel said: "We do not intercalate the year on the thirtieth day of Adar, since it is fit to establish Nisan." He thought: "Since it is fit" - we do not say.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן זִמְרָא: כָּל הַתּוֹלֶה בִּזְכוּת עַצְמוֹ — תּוֹלִין לוֹ בִּזְכוּת אֲחֵרִים. וְכָל הַתּוֹלֶה בִּזְכוּת אֲחֵרִים — תּוֹלִין לוֹ בִּזְכוּת עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra: Anyone who bases upon his own merit, it is based upon the merit of others. And anyone who bases upon the merit of others, it is based upon his own merit.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra: Anyone who attributes merit to himself - they attribute merit to him on account of others. And anyone who attributes merit to others - they attribute merit to him on account of himself.

hebrew_text: מֹשֶׁה תָּלָה בִּזְכוּת אֲחֵרִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זְכֹר לְאַבְרָהָם לְיִצְחָק וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵל עֲבָדֶיךָ״. תָּלוּ לוֹ בִּזְכוּת עַצְמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לְהַשְׁמִידָם לוּלֵי מֹשֶׁה בְחִירוֹ עָמַד בַּפֶּרֶץ לְפָנָיו לְהָשִׁיב חֲמָתוֹ מֵהַשְׁחִית״.
human_translation: he based upon the merit of others, as it is stated: “Remember Abraham, Isaac and Israel your servants, is based upon Moses’ own merit, as it is stated: “And He said He would destroy them, had Moses, His chosen, not stood before Him in the breach to turn back His destructive fury, lest He should destroy them”
llm_translation: Moses relied on the merit of others, as it is stated: "Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, Your servants." They relied on his own merit, as it is stated: "And He said that He would destroy them, had not Moses His chosen one stood before Him in the breach, to turn back His wrath from destroying."

hebrew_text: חִזְקִיָּהוּ תָּלָה בִּזְכוּת עַצְמוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״זְכָר נָא אֵת אֲשֶׁר הִתְהַלַּכְתִּי לְפָנֶיךָ״, תָּלוּ לוֹ בִּזְכוּת אֲחֵרִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְגַנּוֹתִי אֶל הָעִיר הַזֹּאת לְהוֹשִׁיעָהּ לְמַעֲנִי וּלְמַעַן דָּוִד עַבְדִּי״. וְהַיְינוּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״הִנֵּה לְשָׁלוֹם מָר לִי מָר״ — אֲפִילּוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁשִּׁיגֵּר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שָׁלוֹם, מָר הוּא לוֹ.
human_translation: Hezekiah, based upon his own merit, as it is written: “Please, remember that I walked before You” it was based upon the merit of others as it is stated: “And I will protect this city to save it, for My sake and for the sake of David, My servant” And that is what Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is that which is written: “Behold, for my peace I had great bitterness; even when the Holy One, Blessed be He, sent him peace it was bitter for him,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Hezekiah relied on his own merit, as it is written: "Remember now how I have walked before You." They relied on the merit of others for him, as it is said: "And I will defend this city to save it for My own sake and for the sake of My servant David." And this is what Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is the meaning of what is written, "Behold, for peace bitterness is bitter to me"? Even at the moment when the Holy One, blessed be He, greets him with peace, it is bitter for him.

hebrew_text: ״נַעֲשֶׂה נָא עֲלִיַּת קִיר קְטַנָּה״.
human_translation: “Let us make, I pray thee, a small chamber on the roof,
llm_translation: "Let us now make a small upper room."

hebrew_text: רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, חַד אָמַר: עֲלִיָּיה פְּרוּעָה הָיְתָה, וְקֵירוּהָ. וְחַד אָמַר: אַכְסַדְרָה גְּדוֹלָה הָיְתָה וְחִלְּקוּהָ לִשְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: Rav and Shmuel One said: They had an uncovered second story over which they built a ceiling; one said: There was an enclosed veranda [ akhsadra ] and they divided it in half.
llm_translation: Rav and Shmuel, one said: "It was spread out and its wall." And one said: "It was a large courtyard and they divided it into two."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אַכְסַדְרָה, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״קִיר״ אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר עֲלִיָּיה, מַאי ״קִיר״?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said that it was an enclosed veranda that wall [ kir ] was written. However, according to the one who said that they had an second story, what is wall?
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says "Achsadra," that is what is written "wall." But according to the one who says "Aliyah," what is "wall"?

hebrew_text: שֶׁקֵּירוּהָ.
human_translation: built a ceiling
llm_translation: That they uprooted it.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר עֲלִיָּיה, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״עֲלִיַּית״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אַכְסַדְרָה, מַאי ״עֲלִיַּית״?
human_translation: granted, according to the one who said that they had an second story, that second story aliyat ] was written. But according to the one who said an enclosed veranda, what is second story?
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who said 'aliyah,' that is what is written as "aliyat." But according to the one who said 'akhsadra,' what is "aliyat"?

hebrew_text: ״מְעוּלָּה״ שֶׁבַּבָּתִּים.
human_translation: as the most outstanding [ me’ula ] of the rooms.
llm_translation: "Me'ulah" shebabitim.

hebrew_text: ״וְנָשִׂים לוֹ שָׁם מִטָּה וְשֻׁלְחָן וְכִסֵּא וּמְנוֹרָה״.
human_translation: “And let us place a bed, table, stool and candlestick for him there.”
llm_translation: "And women for him there bed and table and chair and lamp."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יִצְחָק: הָרוֹצֶה לֵהָנוֹת — יֵהָנֶה, כֶּאֱלִישָׁע. וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה לֵהָנוֹת — אַל יֵהָנֶה, כִּשְׁמוּאֵל הָרָמָתִי. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּתְשׁוּבָתוֹ הָרָמָתָה כִּי שָׁם בֵּיתוֹ״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁכָּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהָלַךְ שָׁם — בֵּיתוֹ עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye, and some say Rabbi Yitzḥak, said: who seeks to enjoy may enjoy as Elisha And one who does not seek to enjoy should not enjoy them, as Samuel from Rama, As it is stated: “And he returned to Rama, for there was his house, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Every place where went, his house was with him,
llm_translation: Abaye said, and it was stated by Rabbi Yitzchak: One who desires to benefit — let him benefit, like Elisha. And one who does not desire to benefit — let him not benefit, like Shmuel HaRamati. As it is stated: "And his return to Ramah, for there was his house." And Rabbi Yochanan said: For wherever he went, his house was with him.

hebrew_text: ״וַתֹּאמֶר אֶל אִישָׁהּ הִנֵּה נָא יָדַעְתִּי כִּי אִישׁ אֱלֹהִים קָדוֹשׁ הוּא״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִכָּאן שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה מַכֶּרֶת בְּאוֹרְחִין יוֹתֵר מִן הָאִישׁ.
human_translation: “And she said to her husband: Behold now, I perceive that he is a holy man of God Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: From here, that a woman recognizes guests more than a man
llm_translation: "And she said to her husband, 'Behold now, I know that he is a holy man of God.'" Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: From here we learn that a woman discerns more than a man in matters of hospitality.

hebrew_text: ״קָדוֹשׁ הוּא״: מְנָא יָדְעָה? רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל. חַד אָמַר: שֶׁלֹּא רָאֲתָה זְבוּב עוֹבֵר עַל שֻׁלְחָנוֹ, וְחַד אָמַר: סָדִין שֶׁל פִּשְׁתָּן הִצִּיעָה עַל מִטָּתוֹ וְלֹא רָאֲתָה קֶרִי עָלָיו.
human_translation: “he is holy.” From where did she know Rav and Shmuel One said: She never saw a fly pass over his table; and the other said: She spread a linen sheet on his bed, she never saw a seminal emission on it.
llm_translation: "HE IS HOLY": FROM WHERE DID SHE KNOW? RAV AND SHMUEL. ONE SAID: THAT SHE DID NOT SEE A FLY PASSING OVER HIS TABLE, AND ONE SAID: THAT SHE OFFERED HIM A LINEN SHEET ON HIS BED AND DID NOT SEE EMISSION UPON IT.

hebrew_text: ״קָדוֹשׁ הוּא״ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הוּא קָדוֹשׁ וּמְשָׁרְתוֹ אֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּגַּשׁ גֵּיחֲזִי לְהָדְפָהּ״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שֶׁאֲחָזָהּ בְּהוֹד יָפְיָהּ.
human_translation: “He is holy,” Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: He is holy, his attendant, is not holy, as it is stated: “And Geihazi approached her to push her away [ lehodfa ]” Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: He grabbed her by the majesty of her beauty [ hod yofya ],
llm_translation: "Kadosh Hu" said Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina: He is holy and His servant is not holy. As it is stated: "And Gehazi approached to push her away," said Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina: that he seized her by her beauty.

hebrew_text: ״עוֹבֵר עָלֵינוּ תָּמִיד״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: כָּל הַמְאָרֵחַ תַּלְמִיד חָכָם בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ וּמְהַנֵּהוּ מִנְּכָסָיו — מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ מַקְרִיב תְּמִידִין.
human_translation: who passes by us continually,” Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov: one who hosts a Torah scholar in his home and lets him enjoy his possessions, the verse ascribes to him as if he is sacrificing the daily [ tamid ] offering,
llm_translation: "Transgresses upon us constantly," said Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov: Anyone who hosts a Torah scholar in his home and benefits him from his possessions - the Scripture considers it as if he offers continual sacrifices."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: אַל יַעֲמוֹד אָדָם בְּמָקוֹם גָּבוֹהַּ וְיִתְפַּלֵּל, אֶלָּא בְּמָקוֹם נָמוּךְ וְיִתְפַּלֵּל. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִמַּעֲמַקִּים קְרָאתִיךָ ה׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov: A person should not stand in a high place and pray; rather, in a low place and pray, as it is stated: “I called to You, Lord, from the depths”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov: A person should not stand in a high place and pray, but rather in a low place and pray. As it is stated: "From the depths I called You, O Lord."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: לֹא יַעֲמוֹד אָדָם לֹא עַל גַּבֵּי כִּסֵּא, וְלֹא עַל גַּבֵּי שְׁרַפְרַף, וְלֹא בְּמָקוֹם גָּבוֹהַּ, וְיִתְפַּלֵּל, אֶלָּא בְּמָקוֹם נָמוּךְ, וְיִתְפַּלֵּל. לְפִי שֶׁאֵין גַּבְהוּת לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״מִמַּעֲמַקִּים קְרָאתִיךָ ה׳״. וּכְתִיב: ״תְּפִלָּה לְעָנִי כִי יַעֲטֹף״.
human_translation: That was also taught One should neither stand upon a chair nor upon a stool, nor in a high place and pray. Rather, in a low place and pray, for there is no haughtiness before God. As it is stated: “I called to You, Lord, from the depths” and it is written: “A prayer for the impoverished, when he is faint
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A person should not stand neither on the top of a chair, nor on the top of a bed, nor in a high place, and pray, but rather in a low place, and pray. Because there is no height before the Omnipresent, as it is stated, "Out of the depths I call to You, O Lord." And it is also written, "A prayer of the afflicted when he is faint."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּכַוֵּין אֶת רַגְלָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרַגְלֵיהֶם רֶגֶל יְשָׁרָה״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov: When praying, one should align his feet it is stated: “And their feet were a straight foot”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov: One who prays must direct his feet, as it is stated: "And their feet were a straight foot."

hebrew_text: (אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן) וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב, ״לֹא תֹאכְלוּ עַל הַדָּם״ — לֹא תֹאכְלוּ קוֹדֶם שֶׁתִּתְפַּלְּלוּ עַל דִּמְכֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said Rabbi Yoḥanan said and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov: What is that which is written: “You shall not eat with the blood” You may not eat before you pray for your blood.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak said Rabbi Yochanan, and said Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov: What is the meaning of what is written, "Do not eat upon the blood"? — Do not eat before you pray over your blood.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: כָּל הָאוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מִתְפַּלֵּל עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְאֹתִי הִשְׁלַכְתָּ אַחֲרֵי גַוֶּךָ״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״גַּוֶּיךָ״ אֶלָּא ״גֵּאֶיךָ״. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּתְגָּאָה זֶה קִבֵּל עָלָיו מַלְכוּת שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: Others say Rabbi Yitzḥak said Rabbi Yoḥanan said Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov: One who eats and drinks and later prays, about him the verse states “And Me you have cast behind your back” do not read your back [ gavekha ]; rather, your pride [ ge’ekha ]. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: After this has become arrogant he accepted upon himself the kingdom of Heaven.
llm_translation: There are those who say: Rabbi Yitzchak said, Rabbi Yochanan said, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov: Anyone who eats and drinks and only afterwards prays, the verse says about him, "And you have cast me behind your back." Do not read "your back" but rather "your pride." The Holy One, blessed be He, said: After this one has shown pride, he has accepted upon himself the yoke of the Kingdom of Heaven.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר עַד שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁעוֹת. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: until three hours Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says until three hours. Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: Halacha follows Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: הַקּוֹרֵא מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, לֹא הִפְסִיד.
human_translation: one who recites from that time onward loses nothing; he is
llm_translation: The one who reads from here and onwards, has not lost.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר יוֹצֵר אוֹר.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said Mar Ukva said: provided one does not recite: Who forms light [ yotzer or ],
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Mar Ukva: And only that he should not say, "Creator of light."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַקּוֹרֵא מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ לֹא הִפְסִיד, כְּאָדָם שֶׁהוּא קוֹרֵא בַּתּוֹרָה, אֲבָל מְבָרֵךְ הוּא שְׁתַּיִם לְפָנֶיהָ וְאַחַת לְאַחֲרֶיהָ. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב חִסְדָּא, תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: raises an objection to One who recites from that time onward loses nothing, and is considered like one who reads Torah, but he recites two blessings beforehand and one thereafter. the refutation of Rav Ḥisda is a refutation,
llm_translation: Challenger: One who reads from here and onward has not lost, like a person who reads in the Torah, but he should recite two blessings before it and one after it. A support for Rav Ḥisda’s opinion, a support.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא: מַאי ״לֹא הִפְסִיד״ — שֶׁלֹּא הִפְסִיד בְּרָכוֹת. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַקּוֹרֵא מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ לֹא הִפְסִיד כְּאָדָם שֶׁקּוֹרֵא בַּתּוֹרָה, אֲבָל מְבָרֵךְ הוּא שְׁתַּיִם לְפָנֶיהָ וְאַחַת לְאַחֲרֶיהָ.
human_translation: Some say that Rav Ḥisda said Mar Ukva said What is Loses nothing, does not lose the blessings That was also taught One who recites after this time loses nothing, and is considered like one who reads the Torah, but he recites two blessings beforehand and one thereafter.
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rav Ḥisda said, Mar Ukva said: What is "he did not diminish"? — That he did not diminish blessings. It was also taught similarly: One who reads from here and onwards, he did not diminish, like a person who reads in the Torah, but he recites two blessings before it and one after it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי מָנִי: גָּדוֹל הַקּוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע בְּעוֹנָתָהּ יוֹתֵר מֵהָעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה. מִדְּקָתָנֵי: הַקּוֹרֵא מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ לֹא הִפְסִיד כְּאָדָם הַקּוֹרֵא בַּתּוֹרָה. מִכְּלַל דְּקוֹרֵא בְּעוֹנָתָהּ — עָדִיף.
human_translation: Rabbi Mani said: Greater is one who recites Shema at its time than one who engages in Torah what was taught One who recites after this time loses nothing and is like one who reads the Torah. by inference, one who recites at its time is greater
llm_translation: Rabbi Mani said: Great is one who recites the Shema prayer at its proper time more than one who engages in Torah study. As it is taught: One who recites from here and onwards has not lost out, like a person who reads from the Torah. From the principle that one who recites at its proper time - is preferable.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בָּעֶרֶב — כָּל אָדָם יַטֶּה וְיִקְרָא. וּבַבֹּקֶר יַעֲמוֹד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְשָׁכְבְּךָ וּבְקוּמֶךָ״.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: in the evening every person must recline and in the morning he must stand as it is stated: “When you lie down, and when you rise.”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Beit Shammai say: In the evening - every person should lie down and read. And in the morning, one should stand, as it is stated: "When you lie down and when you rise up."

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: כָּל אָדָם קוֹרֵא כְּדַרְכּוֹ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וּבְלֶכְתְּךָ בַדֶּרֶךְ״.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say: Every person recites as he is, as it is stated: “And when you walk along the way,”
llm_translation: Beit Hillel say: Every person reads in his own way. As it is stated, "And as you walk on the way."

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״וּבְשָׁכְבְּךָ וּבְקוּמֶךָ״ — בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁבְּנֵי אָדָם שׁוֹכְבִים וּבְשָׁעָה שֶׁבְּנֵי אָדָם עוֹמְדִים.
human_translation: If so, why was it stated: “When you lie down, and when you rise”? at the time when people lie down and the time when people rise.
llm_translation: "If so, why is it stated, 'and when you lie down and when you rise up' - at the time when people are lying down and at the time when people are standing."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: אֲנִי הָיִיתִי בָּא בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְהִטֵּתִי לִקְרוֹת כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי. וְסִכַּנְתִּי בְּעַצְמִי מִפְּנֵי הַלִּסְטִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon said: I was coming on the road reclined to recite in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai. I endangered myself due to the highwaymen [ listim ]
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon said: I was once traveling on the road and inclined to read according to the words of Beit Shammai. And I endangered myself because of the bandits.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: כְּדַי הָיִיתָ לָחוּב בְּעַצְמְךָ, שֶׁעָבַרְתָּ עַל דִּבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: said to him: You deserved liable with your life, as you transgressed the statement of Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: They said to him: "You were deserving to incur upon yourself, for you transgressed the words of Beit Hillel."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא בֵּית הִלֵּל — קָא מְפָרְשִׁי טַעְמַיְיהוּ וְטַעְמָא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, אֶלָּא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי — מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמְרִי כְּבֵית הִלֵּל?
human_translation: Granted, Beit Hillel explain the rationale their and the rationale for Beit Shammai’s . , , ., However, what is the reason that Beit Shammai do not state in accordance with Beit Hillel?
