llm_translation: Gemara: In truth, Beit Hillel — they are explaining their reasons, and the reason of Beit Shammai. Rather, Beit Shammai — what is the reason they do not say like Beit Hillel?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לָךְ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: אִם כֵּן, נֵימָא קְרָא ״בַּבֹּקֶר וּבָעֶרֶב״, מַאי ״בְּשָׁכְבְּךָ וּבְקוּמֶךָ״? בִּשְׁעַת שְׁכִיבָה — שְׁכִיבָה מַמָּשׁ, וּבִשְׁעַת קִימָה — קִימָה מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: Beit Shammai have said to you: If so then let the verse say: “In the morning and in the evening.” What “When you lie down, and when you rise”? at the time of lying down actually lying down, and at the time of arising actually risen.
llm_translation: They said to you, Beit Shammai: If so, let us say the verse "in the morning and in the evening," what is "when you lie down and when you rise up"? At the time of lying down - actual lying down, and at the time of rising up - actual rising up.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי: הַאי ״וּבְלֶכְתְּךָ בַדֶּרֶךְ״, מַאי עֲבִיד לְהוּ?
human_translation: And what do Beit Shammai do with this “And when you walk along the way,”
llm_translation: House of Shammai: This "and as you walk on the way," what does it do for them?

hebrew_text: הָהוּא מִבְּעֵי לְהוּ, לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״בְּשִׁבְתְּךָ בְּבֵיתֶךָ״ — פְּרָט לְעוֹסֵק בְּמִצְוָה, ״וּבְלֶכְתְּךָ בַדֶּרֶךְ״ — פְּרָט לְחָתָן. מִכָּאן, אָמְרוּ: הַכּוֹנֵס אֶת הַבְּתוּלָה — פָּטוּר, וְאֶת הָאַלְמָנָה — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: need this as it was taught when you sit in your home, to the exclusion of one who is engaged in a mitzva, and when you walk along the way, to the exclusion of a groom, from here, they said: One who marries a virgin is exempt but one who marries a widow is obligated.
llm_translation: That one inquired, as it was taught: "When you sit in your house" - excluding one engaged in a mitzvah, "and when you walk on the way" - excluding a groom. From here, they said: One who marries a virgin - exempt, and one who marries a widow - obligated.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע?
human_translation: From where may it be inferred
llm_translation: What is the implication?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כִּי דֶרֶךְ. מָה דֶּרֶךְ רְשׁוּת, אַף כֹּל רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said Like the way; just as way is voluntary so too all voluntary
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "As the way. Just as the way is a domain, so too every domain."

hebrew_text: מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דְּקָא אָזֵיל לִדְבַר מִצְוָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: לִקְרֵי. אִם כֵּן לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״בְּשֶׁבֶת וּבְלֶכֶת״ מַאי ״בְּשִׁבְתְּךָ וּבְלֶכְתְּךָ״? — בְּשֶׁבֶת דִּידָךְ וּבְלֶכֶת דִּידָךְ הוּא דְּמִחַיְּיבַתְּ, הָא דְּמִצְוָה פְּטִירַתְּ.
human_translation: Are we not dealing with one walks to perform a mitzva? nevertheless, the Torah said to recite If so, let the Torah write: When sitting and when walking. What is When you sit and when you walk? in your sitting down and in your walking, he is obligated but a mitzva, he is exempt
llm_translation: We are dealing with one who is going to perform a mitzvah, and even so, the Merciful One said: "To read." If so, why did the Merciful One write "on your sitting and on your walking"? What is "on your sitting and on your walking"? — On your sitting is what obligates you, but the mitzvah is the conclusion.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי אֲפִילּוּ כּוֹנֵס אֶת הָאַלְמָנָה נָמֵי?
human_translation: If so, even one who marries a widow should be
llm_translation: If so, even if one gathers the widow, is it effective?

hebrew_text: הַאי טְרִיד, וְהַאי לָא טְרִיד.
human_translation: One is preoccupied one is not preoccupied.
llm_translation: This one is "trid," and this one is not "trid."

hebrew_text: אִי מִשּׁוּם טִרְדָּא, אֲפִילּוּ טָבְעָה סְפִינָתוֹ בַּיָּם נָמֵי! וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכִי נָמֵי, אַלְּמָה אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא אָמַר רַב: אָבֵל חַיָּיב בְּכָל הַמִּצְוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה, חוּץ מִן הַתְּפִילִּין, שֶׁהֲרֵי נֶאֱמַר בָּהֶם ״פְּאֵר״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פְּאֵרְךָ חֲבוֹשׁ עָלֶיךָ״?!
human_translation: If due to preoccupation, even one his ship sank at sea also And if you say in this case as well, why did Rabbi Abba bar Zavda say Rav said: A mourner is obligated in all the mitzvot mentioned in the Torah except for phylacteries, as splendor is stated as it is stated: bind your splendor upon yourself”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If because of trouble, even his ship sank in the sea! And if you say: So what, why did Rabbi Abba bar Zavda say in the name of Rav: But a mourner is obligated in all the commandments stated in the Torah, except for Tefillin, for it is stated about them "Your beauty is bound upon you" as it is said: "Your beauty is bound upon you"?!

hebrew_text: הָתָם טְרִיד טִרְדָּא דְמִצְוָה, הָכָא טְרִיד טִרְדָּא דִרְשׁוּת.
human_translation: there, he is preoccupied with the preoccupation of a mitzva here, he is preoccupied with the preoccupation of a voluntary
llm_translation: There, the trid tidah of mitzvah, here the trid tidah of drashut.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי?
human_translation: And Beit Shammai
llm_translation: "And Beit Shammai?"

hebrew_text: הָהוּא מִבְּעֵי לְהוּ — פְּרָט לִשְׁלוּחֵי מִצְוָה.
human_translation: need this exclude one who is on the path a mitzva
llm_translation: That one wants to — specify for emissaries of commandment.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אָמְרִי: מִמֵּילָא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דַּאֲפִילּוּ בַדֶּרֶךְ נָמֵי קָרֵי.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say: Derive from this itself recites even along the way.
llm_translation: And Beit Hillel said: From where do we derive that even on the way one may recite the Shema?

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: עוֹמְדִין וְקוֹרִין, יוֹשְׁבִין וְקוֹרִין, וּמַטִּין וְקוֹרִין, הוֹלְכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְקוֹרִין, עוֹשִׂין בִּמְלַאכְתָּן וְקוֹרִין. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה, שֶׁהָיוּ מְסוּבִּין בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד, וְהָיָה רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל מוּטֶּה, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה זָקוּף. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ זְמַן קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע, הִטָּה רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְזָקַף רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה לְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָחִי, אֶמְשׁוֹל לְךָ מָשָׁל לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה — מָשָׁל לְאֶחָד שֶׁאוֹמְרִים לוֹ זְקָנְךָ מְגוּדָּל! אָמַר לָהֶם: יִהְיֶה כְּנֶגֶד הַמַּשְׁחִיתִים. אַף כָּךְ אַתָּה, כָּל זְמַן שֶׁאֲנִי זָקוּף — אַתָּה מוּטֶּה, עַכְשָׁיו כְּשֶׁאֲנִי הִטֵּתִי אַתָּה זָקַפְתָּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught Beit Hillel say: Standing and reciting, sitting and reciting, reclining and reciting, walking and reciting working and reciting. And an incident Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, were reclining in one place and Rabbi Yishmael was reclined and Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya was upright. When the time to recite Shema arrived, Rabbi Elazar reclined while Rabbi Yishmael upright Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya said to Rabbi Yishmael: Yishmael, my brother, I will tell you a parable to which this is similar. It is comparable to one to whom people say Your beard is full says to them: May it be against those who destroy You are the same. As long as I am upright, you are reclined, and now when I reclined you upright
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Beit Hillel says: One may stand and read, sit and read, lie down and read, walk on the way and read, and engage in their work and read. It once happened with Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah that they were reclining in one place, and Rabbi Yishmael was leaning back and Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah was sitting up. When the time for reciting the Shema arrived, Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah leaned back and Rabbi Yishmael sat up. Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah said to Rabbi Yishmael: Yishmael my brother, I will give you a parable. To what is this matter comparable? It is comparable to one whom they say, "Your beard has grown!" He said to them: Let it be against the destroyers. So too, whenever I am leaning back, you are sitting up; now that I have sat up, you have leaned back.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: אֲנִי עָשִׂיתִי כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל, וְאַתָּה עָשִׂיתָ כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁמָּא יִרְאוּ הַתַּלְמִידִים וְיִקְבְּעוּ הֲלָכָה לְדוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: said to him: I acted in accordance with Beit Hillel, while you acted in accordance with Beit Shammai. And furthermore, lest the students see and establish the halakha for generations
llm_translation: He said to him: I did according to the words of Beit Hillel, and you did according to the words of Beit Shammai. And not only that, but perhaps the disciples will see and establish the halakha for generations.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְלֹא עוֹד״?
human_translation: What is And furthermore?
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "ve'lo od"?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: בֵּית הִלֵּל נָמֵי אִית לְהוּ מַטִּין, הָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּמַטֵּה וַאֲתָא מֵעִיקָּרָא. אֲבָל הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּעַד הַשְׁתָּא הֲוֵית זָקוּף וְהַשְׁתָּא מוּטֶּה, אָמְרִי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי סְבִירָא לְהוּ, שֶׁמָּא יִרְאוּ הַתַּלְמִידִים וְיִקְבְּעוּ הֲלָכָה לְדוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: if you say: Beit Hillel also hold reclining this only applies when one had already been reclining originally, However, here, since until now he had been upright, and now he is reclined, will say: Conclude from this, that they hold in accordance with Beit Shammai. the students might see and establish the halakha for generations
llm_translation: And if you will say: Beit Hillel also have matin, those words of mati'eh that are from the beginning. But here, since until now it was upright and now it is inclined, they said: Learn from it that Beit Shammai is more likely, lest the students see and establish the halakha for generations.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב יְחֶזְקֵאל: עָשָׂה כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי — עָשָׂה, כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל — עָשָׂה.
human_translation: Rav Yeḥezkel taught: One who acted in accordance with Beit Shammai acted in accordance with Beit Hillel acted
llm_translation: It was taught by Rav Yehezkel: He acted in accordance with the words of Beit Shammai - he acted; in accordance with the words of Beit Hillel - he acted.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: עָשָׂה כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי — לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם. דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁהָיָה רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ בַּסּוּכָּה וְשֻׁלְחָנוֹ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי פּוֹסְלִין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַכְשִׁירִין.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: One who acts in accordance with Beit Shammai has done nothing as we learned One who had his head and most of his in the sukka , and his table inside the house, Beit Shammai invalidate And Beit Hillel validate
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: If one acted in accordance with the words of Beit Shammai - he did not fulfill the obligation and not even anything. For it was taught: If one's head and the majority of his body were within the sukkah and his table was inside the house, Beit Shammai disqualify the sukkah, and Beit Hillel validate it.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָלְכוּ זִקְנֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וְזִקְנֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבַקֵּר אֶת רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן הַחוֹרָנִית, מְצָאוּהוּ שֶׁהָיָה רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ בַּסּוּכָּה וְשֻׁלְחָנוֹ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת, וְלֹא אָמְרוּ לוֹ כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai There was an incident where the elders of Beit Shammai and the elders of Beit Hillel went to visit Rabbi Yoḥanan ben HaḤoranit. They found him with his head and most of his in the sukka and his table inside the house and they said nothing to him.
llm_translation: They said to them, Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: The incident where the elders of Beit Shammai and the elders of Beit Hillel went to visit Rabbi Yochanan ben HaChoranit, they found him with his head and most of his body in the sukkah and his table inside the house, and they did not say anything to him.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם: וּמִשָּׁם רְאָיָה?! אַף הֵם אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִם כֵּן הָיִיתָ נוֹהֵג לֹא קִייַּמְתָּ מִצְוַת סוּכָּה מִיָּמֶיךָ.
human_translation: said to them: And proof from there? they said to him If you have been act in this manner, you have never in your life fulfilled the mitzva of sukka .
llm_translation: They said to him: "And from there a proof?!" Also they said to him: "If so, you would not have fulfilled the mitzvah of Sukkah all your days."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: עָשָׂה כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי — חַיָּיב מִיתָה. דִּתְנַן, אָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: אֲנִי הָיִיתִי בָּא בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְהִטֵּתִי לִקְרוֹת כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וְסִכַּנְתִּי בְּעַצְמִי מִפְּנֵי הַלִּסְטִים, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: כְּדַאי הָיִיתָ לָחוּב בְּעַצְמְךָ, שֶׁעָבַרְתָּ עַל דִּבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak stated One who acted in accordance with Beit Shammai is liable to death as we learned Rabbi Tarfon said I was coming on the road reclined to recite in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai. I endangered myself due to the highwaymen said to him: You deserved liable with your life, as you transgressed the statement of Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: One who acts in accordance with the words of Beit Shammai - is liable to death. As we learned in a Mishnah, Rabbi Tarfon said: I was once traveling on the road and I inclined to follow the words of Beit Shammai, putting myself in danger from bandits. They said to him: You would have been deserving of punishment, for you transgressed the words of Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בַּשַּׁחַר מְבָרֵךְ שְׁתַּיִם לְפָנֶיהָ וְאַחַת לְאַחֲרֶיהָ. וּבָעֶרֶב מְבָרֵךְ שְׁתַּיִם לְפָנֶיהָ וּשְׁתַּיִם לְאַחֲרֶיהָ. אַחַת אֲרוּכָּה וְאַחַת קְצָרָה.
human_translation: In morning one recites two blessings beforehand, and one thereafter, And in the evening one recites two blessings beforehand, and two thereafter, whether long and whether short
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: In the morning, one recites two blessings before it and one after it. And in the evening, one recites two blessings before it and two blessings after it. One is lengthy and one is short.

hebrew_text: מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמְרוּ לְהַאֲרִיךְ — אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְקַצֵּר, לְקַצֵּר — אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְהַאֲרִיךְ. לַחְתּוֹם — אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי שֶׁלֹּא לַחְתּוֹם, שֶׁלֹּא לַחְתּוֹם — אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לַחְתּוֹם.
human_translation: Where said a long one may not shorten it, a short one may not lengthen it. must conclude he may not fail to conclude not conclude one may not conclude
llm_translation: Place where they said to lengthen - not permitted to shorten, to shorten - not permitted to lengthen. To seal - not permitted not to seal, not to seal - not permitted to seal.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי מְבָרֵךְ?
human_translation: What blessing does one recite?
llm_translation: Gemara: What does Gemar mean?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא:
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov said in the name of Rabbi Oshaya:
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yaakov said Rabbi Oshaya:

hebrew_text: ״יוֹצֵר אוֹר וּבוֹרֵא חֹשֶׁךְ״.
human_translation: “Who forms light and creates darkness,
llm_translation: "yotzer or u'vorei choshech" - Creator of light and Maker of darkness.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא: ״יוֹצֵר אוֹר וּבוֹרֵא נוֹגַהּ״!
human_translation: Let him say Who forms light and creates brightness,
llm_translation: Let us say: "Yotzer ohr u'vorei nogah!"

hebrew_text: כְּדִכְתִיב קָאָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: We say as is written
llm_translation: As it is written, we say.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה ״עֹשֶׂה שָׁלוֹם וּבוֹרֵא רָע״, מִי קָא אָמְרִינַן כְּדִכְתִיב?! אֶלָּא כְּתִיב ״רַע״ וְקָרֵינַן ״הַכֹּל״ לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא, הָכָא נָמֵי לֵימָא ״נוֹגַהּ״, לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא!
human_translation: But if so, “Who makes peace and creates evil”? Do we say as it is written Rather, it is written evil and we euphemistically recite all things Here, too, let us euphemistically say brightness
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, "He makes peace and creates evil," who said it as it is written?! Rather, it is written "evil," and we interpret "all" to mean above. Here too, let us say "nogah," to mean above!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כְּדֵי לְהַזְכִּיר מִדַּת יוֹם בַּלַּיְלָה וּמִדַּת לַיְלָה בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: in order to mention the attribute of day at night and the attribute of night during the day,
llm_translation: Rava said: In order to mention the attribute of day at night, and the attribute of night during the day.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מִדַּת לַיְלָה בַּיּוֹם כִּדְאָמְרִינַן: ״יוֹצֵר אוֹר וּבוֹרֵא חֹשֶׁךְ״, אֶלָּא מִדַּת יוֹם בַּלַּיְלָה, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: Granted, the attribute of night during the day, as we say: Who forms light and creates darkness, but where do you find the attribute of day at night?
llm_translation: In truth, the attribute of night during the day, as we say: "He forms light and creates darkness," but the attribute of day during the night, how does one attribute it to Him?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״גּוֹלֵל אוֹר מִפְּנֵי חֹשֶׁךְ וְחֹשֶׁךְ מִפְּנֵי אוֹר״.
human_translation: Abaye said: Rolling away light before the darkness and darkness before the light.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "Roll light because of darkness, and darkness because of light."

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ מַאי הִיא? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: ״אַהֲבָה רַבָּה״. וְכֵן אוֹרִי לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְרַבִּי פְּדָת בְּרֵיהּ, ״אַהֲבָה רַבָּה״.
human_translation: And what is the other Rav Yehuda said in the name of Shmuel: An abounding love [ ahava rabba ]. And Rabbi Elazar instructed his son, Rabbi Pedat, also An abounding love.
llm_translation: The other one, what is it? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: "Great love." And Rabbi Elazar said to Rabbi Pedat his son, "Great love."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אֵין אוֹמְרִים ״אַהֲבַת עוֹלָם״, אֶלָּא ״אַהֲבָה רַבָּה״. וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי אַהֲבַת עוֹלָם, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְאַהֲבַת עוֹלָם אֲהַבְתִּיךְ עַל כֵּן מְשַׁכְתִּיךְ חָסֶד״.
human_translation: That was also taught One does not recite: An eternal love [ ahavat olam ]; rather, An abounding love. And the Rabbis say An eternal love, and so it says: “And an eternal love I have loved you, therefore I have drawn you with kindness”
llm_translation: Mishnaic text: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: One does not say "eternal love," rather "great love." And the Sages say "eternal love," as it is written: "I have loved you with an everlasting love, therefore I have drawn you with loving-kindness."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הִשְׁכִּים לִשְׁנוֹת, עַד שֶׁלֹּא קָרָא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע — צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ. מִשֶּׁקָּרָא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ, שֶׁכְּבָר נִפְטַר בְּ״אַהֲבָה רַבָּה״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: One who arose to study, until he recites Shema he must recite a blessing If he recited Shema he need not recite blessing, as he has exempted by An abounding love,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: If one arose early to recite the Shema, before he has read the Shema, he must recite a blessing. Once he has read the Shema, he does not need to recite a blessing, as he has already fulfilled his obligation with "Ahavah Rabbah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לַמִּקְרָא צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ, וְלַמִּדְרָשׁ — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: For Bible, one must recite a blessing, and for midrash, one need not recite a blessing.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: For the Scripture, one must recite a blessing, but for the Midrash, one does not need to recite a blessing.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: לַמִּקְרָא וְלַמִּדְרָשׁ צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ, לַמִּשְׁנָה — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: For Bible and midrash, one must recite a blessing; for Mishna, one need not recite a blessing.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: For Scripture and for Midrash one must bless, for Mishnah - one need not bless.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אַף לַמִּשְׁנָה נָמֵי צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ [אֲבָל לַתַּלְמוּד, אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵךְ].
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even for Mishna, one must recite a blessing as well, but for Talmud, one need not recite a blessing.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even for the Mishnah, one must recite a blessing but for the Talmud, one does not need to recite a blessing.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר: אַף לַתַּלְמוּד צָרִיךְ (לַחֲזוֹר וּלְבָרֵךְ) [לְבָרֵךְ].
human_translation: And Rava said: Even for Talmud, one must recite a blessing.
llm_translation: Rava said: Even for learning, one must (repeat and) bless bless.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי: זִימְנִין סַגִּיאִין הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב לְתַנּוֹיֵי פִּרְקִין בְּ״סִפְרָא דְבֵי רַב״, הֲוָה מַקְדֵּים וְקָא מָשֵׁי יְדֵיהּ, וּבָרֵיךְ, וּמַתְנֵי לַן פִּרְקִין.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi, said: Many times I stood before Rav to study our chapter in the Sifra , of the school of Rav, would first wash his hands, recite a blessing, he would teach us our chapter.
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Ashe said: Sometimes, when we were standing before Rav to recite chapters in the book of the house of Rav, he would precede and place his hands, bless, and teach us chapters.

hebrew_text: מַאי מְבָרֵךְ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: ״אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּנוּ לַעֲסוֹק בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה״.
human_translation: What blessings does he recite? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Who sanctified us with his mitzvot and commanded us to engage in matters of Torah.
llm_translation: What does one bless? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: "Who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us to engage in the words of Torah."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מְסַיֵּים בַּהּ הָכִי ״הַעֲרֵב נָא ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ אֶת דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָתְךָ בְּפִינוּ וּבְפִיפִיּוֹת עַמְּךָ בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל וְנִהְיֶה אֲנַחְנוּ וְצֶאֱצָאֵינוּ וְצֶאֱצָאֵי עַמְּךָ בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל כֻּלָּנוּ יוֹדְעֵי שְׁמֶךָ וְעוֹסְקֵי תוֹרָתֶךָ בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ הַמְלַמֵּד תּוֹרָה לְעַמּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan concludes the following: Lord our God, make the words of Your Torah sweet in our mouths and in the mouths of Your people, the house of Israel, so that we and our descendants and the descendants of Your people, the house of Israel, may be those who know Your name and engage in Your Torah. Blessed are You, Lord, Who teaches Torah to His people Israel.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan concludes it thus: "Please, Hashem our God, sweeten the words of Your Torah in our mouths and in the mouths of Your people, the house of Israel. And may we and our offspring and the offspring of Your people, the house of Israel, all of us know Your name and engage in Your Torah. Blessed are You, Hashem, Who teaches Torah to His nation, Israel."

hebrew_text: וְרַב הַמְנוּנָא אָמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר בָּחַר בָּנוּ מִכׇּל הָעַמִּים וְנָתַן לָנוּ אֶת תּוֹרָתוֹ. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ נוֹתֵן הַתּוֹרָה״. אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: זוֹ הִיא מְעוּלָּה שֶׁבַּבְּרָכוֹת.
human_translation: And Rav Hamnuna said Who has chosen us from all the peoples and given us His Torah. Blessed are You, Lord, Giver of the Torah. Rav Hamnuna said: This is the most outstanding of all the blessings
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: "Who chose us from all the nations and gave us His Torah. Blessed are You, Hashem, who gives the Torah." Rav Hamnuna said: This is the excellence in the blessings.

hebrew_text: הִלְכָּךְ לֵימְרִינְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: Therefore, let us recite them all
llm_translation: Therefore, let us say to all of them.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: אָמַר לָהֶם הַמְמוּנֶּה: ״בָּרְכוּ בְּרָכָה אַחַת!״. וְהֵם בֵּרְכוּ. וְקָרְאוּ עֲשֶׂרֶת הַדִּבְּרוֹת, ״שְׁמַע״, ״וְהָיָה אִם שָׁמוֹעַ״, ״וַיֹּאמֶר״. וּבֵרְכוּ אֶת הָעָם שָׁלֹשׁ בְּרָכוֹת, ״אֱמֶת וְיַצִּיב״, וַעֲבוֹדָה, וּבִרְכַּת כֹּהֲנִים. וּבְשַׁבָּת מוֹסִיפִין בְּרָכָה אַחַת לַמִּשְׁמָר הַיּוֹצֵא.
human_translation: We learned there, the appointed said to Recite a single blessing. recited a blessing, and read the Ten Commandments, Shema , VeHaya im Shamoa and VaYomer , they blessed the people three blessings. True and Firm, Avoda , and the priestly benediction, And on Shabbat one blessing is added to the outgoing priestly watch,
llm_translation: We learned there: The appointed one said to them, "Bless with one blessing." And they blessed. And they recited the Ten Commandments, "Hear," "And it shall come to pass if you diligently obey," "And He said." And they blessed the people with three blessings, "Truth and Stability," Service, and the Priestly Blessing. And on Shabbat, they add one blessing for the outgoing watch.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״בְּרָכָה אַחַת״? כִּי הָא דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אַבָּא אִקְּלַעוּ לְהָהוּא אַתְרָא, בְּעוֹ מִנַּיְיהוּ: מַאי ״בְּרָכָה אַחַת״? לָא הֲוָה בִּידַיְיהוּ. וַאֲתוֹ שַׁיְילוּהוּ לְרַב מַתְנָה לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ. אֲתוֹ שַׁיְילוּהוּ לְרַב יְהוּדָה. אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, ״אַהֲבָה רַבָּה״.
human_translation: what is the single blessing like where Rabbi Abba and Rabbi Yosei bar Abba happened to a certain place, asked them: What is the single blessing did not have readily available. they came and asked Rav Mattana, and he did not have readily available. They came and asked Rav Yehuda, he told them: Shmuel said as follows: An abounding love
llm_translation: What is "one blessing"? Like this case of Rabbi Abba and Rabbi Yosei bar Abba who came to that place, they asked them: What is "one blessing"? It was not in their hands. They came and asked Rav Matnah, it was not in his hands. They came and asked Rav Yehudah. He said to them: So said Shmuel, "Great love."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי זְרִיקָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: ״יוֹצֵר אוֹר״. כִּי אֲתָא רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף, אָמַר, הָא דְּרַבִּי זְרִיקָא לָאו בְּפֵירוּשׁ אִתְּמַר אֶלָּא מִכְּלָלָא אִתְּמַר. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זְרִיקָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת בְּרָכוֹת אֵין מְעַכְּבוֹת זוֹ אֶת זוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zerika said Rabbi Ami said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said Who creates light. when Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef came he said That which Rabbi Zerika said was not stated explicitly rather it was inferred from As Rabbi Zerika said Rabbi Ami said Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: it follows blessings does not prevent other.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Zerika said, Rabbi Ammi said, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: "Yotzer Or" (Creator of Light). When Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef came, he said, what Rabbi Zerika said was not said specifically but was said in general. For Rabbi Zerika said, Rabbi Ammi said, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: This means that blessings do not delay one another.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא ״יוֹצֵר אוֹר״ הֲווֹ אָמְרִי, הַיְינוּ דִּבְרָכוֹת אֵין מְעַכְּבוֹת זוֹ אֶת זוֹ, דְּלָא קָא אָמְרִי ״אַהֲבָה רַבָּה״.
human_translation: Granted, if you say that they would recite: Who creates light, blessings does not prevent one other, and did not recite: An abounding love,
llm_translation: If you say, "Yotzer Or," they have said, that is, the blessings do not hinder one another, for they did not say, "Ahava Rabbah."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי אָמְרַתְּ ״אַהֲבָה רַבָּה״ הֲווֹ אָמְרִי, מַאי בְּרָכוֹת אֵין מְעַכְּבוֹת זוֹ אֶת זוֹ? דִּלְמָא הַאי דְּלָא אָמְרִי ״יוֹצֵר אוֹר״ מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מְטָא זְמַן ״יוֹצֵר אוֹר״, וְכִי מְטָא זְמַן ״יוֹצֵר אוֹר״ הֲווֹ אָמְרִי.
human_translation: However, if you say that they would recite: An abounding love, what blessings does not prevent other? Perhaps that they did not recite: Who creates light was because the time for the recitation of: Who creates light, had not yet arrived, However, when the time Who creates light arrived, they would recite it. Shema
llm_translation: Rather, if you say "great love," do they say, what blessings do not delay one another? Perhaps this one, who did not say "Creator of light" because the time of "Creator of light" did not come, when the time of "Creator of light" comes, will they say.

hebrew_text: וְאִי מִכְּלָלָא מַאי?
human_translation: And if based on inference, what
llm_translation: And if from the general, what?

hebrew_text: דְּאִי מִכְּלָלָא, לְעוֹלָם ״אַהֲבָה רַבָּה״ הֲווֹ אָמְרִי. וְכִי מְטָא זְמַן ״יוֹצֵר אוֹר״ הֲווֹ אָמְרִי לֵיהּ. וּמַאי ״בְּרָכוֹת אֵין מְעַכְּבוֹת זוֹ אֶת זוֹ״ — סֵדֶר בְּרָכוֹת.
human_translation: If were based on an inference, actually they recited: An abounding love, and when the time Who creates light arrived, they would recite it. what blessings does not prevent other? the order of the blessings
llm_translation: From the general principle, they always said "great love." And when the time comes, they said to Him "Creator of light." And what is "blessings do not impede one another"? — the order of blessings.

hebrew_text: וְקוֹרִין עֲשֶׂרֶת הַדִּבְּרוֹת ״שְׁמַע״, ״וְהָיָה אִם שָׁמוֹעַ״, ״וַיֹּאמֶר״, ״אֱמֶת וְיַצִּיב״, וַעֲבוֹדָה, וּבִרְכַּת כֹּהֲנִים.
human_translation: read the Ten Commandments, Shema , VeHaya im Shamoa , VaYomer , True and Firm, Avoda, and the priestly benediction.
llm_translation: And they read the Ten Commandments "Shema", "Vehaya im shamo'a", "Vayomer", "Emet veyatziv", and Avodah, and Birkat Kohanim.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אַף בִּגְבוּלִין בִּקְּשׁוּ לִקְרוֹת כֵּן, אֶלָּא שֶׁכְּבָר בִּטְּלוּם מִפְּנֵי תַּרְעוֹמֶת הַמִּינִין.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Even in the outlying areas, they sought to recite in this manner but they had already abolished due to the grievance of the heretics,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Even in the border areas they sought to read it thus, but they had already annulled them because of the incitement of the heretics.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: בִּגְבוּלִין בִּקְּשׁוּ לִקְרוֹת כֵּן, אֶלָּא שֶׁכְּבָר בִּטְּלוּם מִפְּנֵי תַּרְעוֹמֶת הַמִּינִין.
human_translation: That was also taught Rabbi Natan says: In the outlying areas, they sought to recite in this manner, but they had already abolished due to the grievance of the heretics.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Natan says: In the border towns they sought to read thus, but they have already annulled them because of the fear of the heretics.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חַנָּה סְבַר לְמִקְבְּעִינְהוּ בְּסוּרָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: כְּבָר בִּטְּלוּם מִפְּנֵי תַּרְעוֹמֶת הַמִּינִין.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana thought to institute this in Sura, Rav Ḥisda said to him: They already abolished them due to the grievance of the heretics.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Bar Ḥana thought to establish them in Sura, Rav Ḥisdah said to him: They have already been nullified because of the influence of the heretics.

hebrew_text: אֲמֵימַר סְבַר לְמִקְבְּעִינְהוּ בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: כְּבָר בִּטְּלוּם מִפְּנֵי תַּרְעוֹמֶת הַמִּינִין.
human_translation: Ameimar thought to institute this in Neharde’a. Rav Ashi, said to him: They already abolished them due to the grievance of the heretics.
llm_translation: Ameimar thinks to establish them in Nehardea, Rav Ashe said to him: They have already been nullified because of the arrogance of the heretics.

hebrew_text: וּבְשַׁבָּת מוֹסִיפִין בְּרָכָה אַחַת לַמִּשְׁמָר הַיּוֹצֵא. מַאי בְּרָכָה אַחַת? אָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ: מִשְׁמָר הַיּוֹצֵא אוֹמֵר לַמִּשְׁמָר הַנִּכְנָס: ״מִי שֶׁשִּׁכֵּן אֶת שְׁמוֹ בַּבַּיִת הַזֶּה, הוּא יַשְׁכִּין בֵּינֵיכֶם אַהֲבָה וְאַחְוָה וְשָׁלוֹם וְרֵיעוּת״.
human_translation: on Shabbat a single blessing is added to the outgoing priestly watch. What is single blessing? Rabbi Ḥelbo said: the outgoing priestly watch would say to the incoming priestly watch: May He who caused His Name to dwell in this house cause love and brotherhood, peace and camaraderie to dwell among you.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And on Shabbat, we add one blessing for the outgoing watch. What is the blessing? Rabbi Helbo said: The outgoing watch says to the incoming watch: "May He who caused His name to dwell in this house cause love, brotherhood, peace, and companionship to dwell among you."

hebrew_text: מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמְרוּ לְהַאֲרִיךְ. פְּשִׁיטָא הֵיכָא דְּקָא נָקֵיט כָּסָא דְחַמְרָא בִּידֵיהּ וְקָסָבַר דְּשִׁכְרָא הוּא, וּפָתַח וּמְבָרֵךְ אַדַּעְתָּא דְשִׁכְרָא, וְסַיֵּים בִּדְחַמְרָא — יָצָא. דְּאִי נָמֵי אִם אָמַר ״שֶׁהַכֹּל נִהְיֶה בִּדְבָרוֹ״ — יָצָא. דְּהָא תְּנַן: עַל כּוּלָּם אִם אָמַר ״שֶׁהַכֹּל נִהְיֶה בִּדְבָרוֹ״ — יָצָא.
human_translation: Where said a long Obviously, in a case where one took a cup of wine in his hand and thought it was beer, and began reciting the blessing thinking it was beer, and he concluded with that wine: he fulfilled even had he recited: By Whose word all things came to be, he fulfilled as we learned If one By Whose word all things came to be, over all he fulfilled
llm_translation: Place where they said to prolong. It is obvious, where he takes a cup of wine in his hand and he thinks that it is beer, and he begins and blesses with the knowledge of beer, and finishes with wine - he has fulfilled his obligation. For if he also said, "that everything is accomplished by His word" - he has fulfilled his obligation. For we learned: for all of them, if he said, "that everything is accomplished by His word" - he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הֵיכָא דְּקָא נָקֵיט כָּסָא דְשִׁכְרָא בִּידֵיהּ וְקָסָבַר דְּחַמְרָא הוּא, פְּתַח וּבָרֵיךְ אַדַּעְתָּא דְחַמְרָא, וְסַיֵּים בִּדְשִׁכְרָא, מַאי?
human_translation: However in a case where one took a cup of beer in his hand and thought it was wine, and began reciting the blessing thinking it was wine, and he concluded with that beer: what
llm_translation: Rather, here where he took a cup of wine in his hand and he thought that it is vinegar, he began with the blessing of vinegar and concluded with wine, what is the law?

hebrew_text: בָּתַר עִיקַּר בְּרָכָה אָזְלִינַן, אוֹ בָּתַר חֲתִימָה אָזְלִינַן?
human_translation: Do we follow the essence or do we follow the conclusion
llm_translation: After the main blessing do we go, or after the final seal do we go?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שַׁחֲרִית, פָּתַח בְּ״יוֹצֵר אוֹר״ וְסִיֵּים בְּ״מַעֲרִיב עֲרָבִים״ — לֹא יָצָא. פָּתַח בְּ״מַעֲרִיב עֲרָבִים״ וְסִיֵּים בְּ״יוֹצֵר אוֹר״ — יָצָא.
human_translation: Come and hear the morning prayer began with: Who creates light, and concluded with Who brings on evenings, he did not fulfill commenced with: Who brings on evenings, and concluded with: Who creates light, he fulfilled
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: Shacharit, patach b'Yotzer Or v'siyeim b'Ma'ariv Aravim - lo yatza. Patach b'Ma'ariv Aravim v'siyeim b'Yotzer Or - yatza." English translation: "Come and hear: If one began Shacharit with 'Yotzer Or' and concluded with 'Ma'ariv Aravim' - he has not fulfilled his obligation. If he began with 'Ma'ariv Aravim' and concluded with 'Yotzer Or' - he has fulfilled his obligation."

hebrew_text: עַרְבִית, פָּתַח בְּ״מַעֲרִיב עֲרָבִים״ וְסִיֵּים בְּ״יוֹצֵר אוֹר״ — לֹא יָצָא. פָּתַח בְּ״יוֹצֵר אוֹר״ וְסִיֵּים בְּ״מַעֲרִיב עֲרָבִים״ — יָצָא.
human_translation: the evening prayer one commenced with: Who brings on evenings and concluded with: Who creates light, he did not fulfill one commenced with: Who creates light and concluded with: Who brings on evenings, he fulfilled
llm_translation: Evening, he began with "Who creates evenings" and concluded with "Who forms light" - he has not fulfilled his obligation. He began with "Who forms light" and concluded with "Who creates evenings" - he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: הַכֹּל הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר הַחִתּוּם.
human_translation: the general principle is: Everything follows the conclusion
llm_translation: The principle of the matter: Everything follows the seal.

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּקָאָמַר ״בָּרוּךְ יוֹצֵר הַמְּאוֹרוֹת״.
human_translation: There, it is different, as one recites: Blessed forms the radiant lights,
llm_translation: The difference there is that it says, "Blessed is He who forms the luminaries."

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַב דְּאָמַר כָּל בְּרָכָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ הַזְכָּרַת הַשֵּׁם אֵינָהּ בְּרָכָה — שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר כָּל בְּרָכָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ מַלְכוּת אֵינָהּ בְּרָכָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to Rav, who said: Any blessing that does not include mention of God’s name is not a blessing, However, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said: Any blessing that does not include mention of sovereignty, is not a blessing, what can be said
llm_translation: The Gemara left it as Rav said: Any blessing that does not contain mention of the Name is not a blessing - it is good. Rather, according to Rabbi Yochanan who said: Any blessing that does not contain mention of the Kingdom is not a blessing, what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא: כְּדֵי לְהַזְכִּיר מִדַּת יוֹם בַּלַּיְלָה וּמִדַּת לַיְלָה בַּיּוֹם, כִּי קָאָמַר בְּרָכָה וּמַלְכוּת מֵעִיקָּרָא — אַתַּרְוַיְיהוּ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rather, Since Rabba bar Ulla said: in order to mention the attribute of day at night and the attribute of night in the day, when one recites the blessing and sovereignty at the beginning of the blessing, to both
llm_translation: Rather, since Rabba bar Ulla said: In order to mention the attribute of day at night and the attribute of night during the day, for he said in the blessing and kingship from the beginning - they are intertwined.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע מִסֵּיפָא: ״כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: הַכֹּל הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר הַחִתּוּם״. כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר לְאֵתוּיֵי מַאי? לָאו לְאֵתוּיֵי הָא דַּאֲמַרַן?
human_translation: Come and hear in the latter clause The general principle is: Everything follows the conclusion What does to include Does it not come to include that we stated,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema miseifa: 'Klalo shel davar: hakol holekh achar hachitum.' Klalo shel davar le'etuyei mai? Lavo le'etuyei ha d'amaran?" English translation: "Come and hear from the end: 'The general principle of a matter: everything follows the seal.' What is the general principle of a matter for? Is it not for the purpose of what we have said?"

hebrew_text: לָא, לְאֵתוּיֵי נַהֲמָא וְתַמְרֵי. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דַּאֲכַל נַהֲמָא, וְקָסָבַר דְּתַמְרֵי אֲכַל, וּפְתַח אַדַּעְתָּא דְתַמְרֵי וְסַיֵּים בִּדְנַהֲמָא — הַיְינוּ בַּעְיָין!
human_translation: No, to include bread and dates. What are the circumstances If you say that where one ate bread and thought that he ate dates, and commenced thinking it was dates; he concluded with that over bread, isn’t that our dilemma,
llm_translation: Not for the purpose of Nahama and dates. How so? If one ate Nahama, and he thought that he ate dates, and he opened the knowledge of dates and concluded with Nahama - that is a problem!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא: כְּגוֹן דַּאֲכַל תַּמְרֵי, וְקָסָבַר נַהֲמָא אֲכַל, וּפְתַח בִּדְנַהֲמָא, וְסַיֵּים בִּדְתַמְרֵי [— יָצָא]. דַּאֲפִילּוּ סַיֵּים בִּדְנַהֲמָא — נָמֵי יָצָא.
human_translation: No; this is necessary case where one ate dates and thought that he ate bread, and commenced thinking they were bread. he concluded with that over dates. he fulfilled even had he concluded with that over bread, he fulfilled his obligation.
llm_translation: Not needed: For example, if one ate dates, and he thought that he ate figs, and he opened with dates, and concluded with figs — he has fulfilled his obligation. For even if he concluded with dates — he has also fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּתַמְרֵי נָמֵי מֵיזָן זָיְינִי.
human_translation: What is the reason because dates also provide sustenance.
llm_translation: What is the reason? - Because dates are beneficial for the eyesight.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר חִינָּנָא סָבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: כָּל שֶׁלֹּא אָמַר ״אֱמֶת וְיַצִּיב״ שַׁחֲרִית, וֶ״אֱמֶת וֶאֱמוּנָה״ עַרְבִית — לֹא יָצָא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְהַגִּיד בַּבֹּקֶר חַסְדֶּךָ וֶאֱמוּנָתְךָ בַּלֵּילוֹת״.
human_translation: Rabba bar Ḥinnana Sava said in the name of Rav: One who did not recite: True and Firm [ emet veyatziv ] in the morning prayer, and: True and Trustworthy [ emet ve’emuna ] in the evening prayer, he did not fulfill his obligation. as it is stated: “To declare Your kindness in the morning and Your faith in the nights”
llm_translation: Rabah bar Ḥinnana the Elder said in the name of Rav: Anyone who did not say "emet veyatziv" in the morning prayer, and "emet ve'emunah" in the evening prayer, has not fulfilled his obligation, as it is stated: "To declare Your kindness in the morning and Your faithfulness at night."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר חִינָּנָא [סָבָא] מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל, כְּשֶׁהוּא כּוֹרֵעַ כּוֹרֵעַ בְּבָרוּךְ, וּכְשֶׁהוּא זוֹקֵף — זוֹקֵף בַּשֵּׁם
human_translation: And Rabba bar Ḥinnana Sava said in the name of Rav: One who is praying, when he bows he bows when Blessed, and when he stands upright, he stands upright when he says name.
llm_translation: And Rabba bar Chinana Saba said in the name of Rav: One who prays, when he is bowing, he bows in Baruch, and when he is standing erect, he stands erect in the Name.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מַאי טַעְמָא דְרַב — דִּכְתִיב: ״ה׳ זוֹקֵף כְּפוּפִים״.
human_translation: Shmuel, said: What is Rav’s reason As it is written: “The Lord, who raises the bowed”
llm_translation: Shmuel said: What is the reason for Rav's statement? As it is written: "Hashem raises the downtrodden."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיבִי: ״מִפְּנֵי שְׁמִי נִחַת הוּא״.
human_translation: raises an objection “And he was afraid before My name”
llm_translation: The text states: "Meitvei: 'Mipnei shemi nichat hu'."

hebrew_text: מִי כְּתִיב ״בִּשְׁמִי״? ״מִפְּנֵי שְׁמִי״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Is it written: At My name? Before My name, is written,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is it written "in My name"? "Because of My name" is written.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְחִיָּיא בַּר רַב: בַּר אוֹרְיָאן, תָּא וְאֵימָא לְךָ מִלְּתָא מְעַלַּיְיתָא דְּאָמַר אֲבוּךְ. הָכִי אָמַר אֲבוּךְ: כְּשֶׁהוּא כּוֹרֵעַ — כּוֹרֵעַ בְּ״בָרוּךְ״, כְּשֶׁהוּא זוֹקֵף — זוֹקֵף בַּשֵּׁם.
human_translation: Shmuel said to Ḥiyya bar Rav: Son of Torah, come and I will tell you a great saying that your father said. Your father said the following: When one bows, he bows when Blessed, and when he stands upright, he stands upright when he says name.
llm_translation: He said to him, Samuel to Hiyya bar Rav: Bar Orayan, come and I will say to you a matter that your father said. Thus said your father: When he bows down - he bows down with "Baruch," when he straightens up - he straightens up with the Name.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, כִּי כָּרַע — כָּרַע כְּחִיזְרָא. כִּי קָא זָקֵיף — זָקֵיף כְּחִיוְיָא.
human_translation: When Rav Sheshet bowed he bowed like a cane, When he stood upright he stood upright like a snake,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet, when he bent down - he bent down like a lizard. When he stood up - he stood up like a snake.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר חִינָּנָא סָבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ אָדָם מִתְפַּלֵּל ״הָאֵל הַקָּדוֹשׁ״, ״מֶלֶךְ אוֹהֵב צְדָקָה וּמִשְׁפָּט״, חוּץ מֵעֲשָׂרָה יָמִים שֶׁבֵּין רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, שֶׁמִּתְפַּלֵּל ״הַמֶּלֶךְ הַקָּדוֹשׁ״, וְ״הַמֶּלֶךְ הַמִּשְׁפָּט״.
human_translation: And, Rabba bar Ḥinnana Sava said in the name of Rav: Throughout the year a person prays The holy God, King who loves righteousness and justice, with the exception of the ten days between Rosh HaShana and Yom Kippur, when he prays The holy King and: The King of justice,
llm_translation: And Rabba bar Chinana the Elder said in the name of Rav: Throughout the entire year, a person prays, "God, the Holy One," "King who loves righteousness and justice," except for the ten days between Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur, when one prays, "The King, the Holy One," and "The King of Justice."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר אֲפִילּוּ אָמַר ״הָאֵל הַקָּדוֹשׁ״ — יָצָא. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּגְבַּה ה׳ צְבָאוֹת בַּמִּשְׁפָּט וְהָאֵל הַקָּדוֹשׁ נִקְדָּשׁ בִּצְדָקָה״. אֵימָתַי ״וַיִּגְבַּה ה׳ צְבָאוֹת בַּמִּשְׁפָּט״ — אֵלּוּ עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים שֶׁמֵּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וְעַד יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, וְקָאָמַר ״הָאֵל הַקָּדוֹשׁ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said even he said: The holy God as it is stated: “And the Lord of Hosts is exalted through justice, and the holy God is sanctified through righteousness” When And the Lord of Hosts is exalted through justice? during the ten days between Rosh HaShana and Yom Kippur, says: The holy God.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Even if one says "the Holy God," he has fulfilled his obligation, as it is stated: "The Lord of hosts is exalted through justice, and the Holy God is sanctified through righteousness." When is "The Lord of hosts is exalted through justice"? These are the ten days from Rosh Hashanah until Yom Kippur, and it says "the Holy God."

hebrew_text: מַאי הֲוָה עֲלַהּ?
human_translation: What is about this
llm_translation: What was the matter with him?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: ״הָאֵל הַקָּדוֹשׁ״ וּ״מֶלֶךְ אוֹהֵב צְדָקָה וּמִשְׁפָּט״. רַבָּה אָמַר: ״הַמֶּלֶךְ הַקָּדוֹשׁ״ וְ״הַמֶּלֶךְ הַמִּשְׁפָּט״. וְהִלְכְתָא כְּרַבָּה.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said The holy God and: King Who loves righteousness and justice. Rabba said The holy King and: The King of justice. The halakha is with Rabba.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "The Holy God" and "a king who loves righteousness and justice." Rabbah said: "The Holy King" and "the King of Justice." And the halakha follows Rabbah.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר חִינָּנָא סָבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: כֹּל שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לְבַקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים עַל חֲבֵירוֹ וְאֵינוֹ מְבַקֵּשׁ — נִקְרָא ״חוֹטֵא״. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״גַּם אָנֹכִי חָלִילָה לִּי מֵחֲטֹא לַה׳ מֵחֲדֹל לְהִתְפַּלֵּל בַּעַדְכֶם״.
human_translation: And Rabba bar Ḥinnana Sava said in the name of Rav: Anyone who can ask for mercy on behalf of another, and does not ask is called a sinner, as it is stated “As for me, far be it from me that I should transgress against the Lord in ceasing to pray for you,
llm_translation: And Rabba bar Ḥinnana the Elder said in the name of Rav: Anyone who is able to request mercy for his fellow and does not request – he is called a sinner. As it is stated: "Far be it from me to sin against the Lord by ceasing to pray for you" (1 Samuel 12:23).

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִם תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הוּא, צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּחֲלֶה עַצְמוֹ עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rava said: If is a Torah scholar, one must make himself ill about him.
llm_translation: Rava said: If he is a Torah scholar, he must take care of himself.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֵין חֹלֶה מִכֶּם עָלַי וְאֵין גּוֹלֶה אֶת אָזְנִי״ — דִּילְמָא מֶלֶךְ שָׁאנֵי. אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וַאֲנִי בַּחֲלוֹתָם לְבוּשִׁי וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: What is the reason If you say because as it is written: “And there is none of you that is ill over me or tells unto me” Perhaps a king is different, from here: “But for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth,
llm_translation: What is the reason? Perhaps because it is written: "And none of you shall be sick, and none of you shall be barren in your land" - lest the king be different. Rather, from here: "But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth, etc."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר חִינָּנָא סָבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: כָּל הָעוֹשֶׂה דְּבַר עֲבֵירָה וּמִתְבַּיֵּישׁ בּוֹ — מוֹחֲלִין לוֹ עַל כָּל עֲוֹנוֹתָיו. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְמַעַן תִּזְכְּרִי וָבֹשְׁתְּ וְלֹא יִהְיֶה לָּךְ עוֹד פִּתְחוֹן פֶּה מִפְּנֵי כְּלִמָּתֵךְ בְּכַפְּרִי לָךְ לְכָל אֲשֶׁר עָשִׂית נְאֻם ה׳ אֱלֹהִים״.
human_translation: And Rabba bar Ḥinnana Sava said in the name of Rav: One who commits an act of transgression and is ashamed of it, all of his transgressions are forgiven. as it is stated: “In order that you remember, and be embarrassed, and never open your mouth anymore, because of your shame, when I have forgiven you for all that you have done, said the Lord, God”
llm_translation: And Rabba bar Chinana the Elder said in the name of Rav: Anyone who commits a transgression and feels ashamed of it - we forgive him for all his sins. As it is said: "So that you may remember and be ashamed, and never open your mouth again because of your disgrace, when I make atonement for you for all that you have done, says the Lord God."

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא צִבּוּר שָׁאנֵי. אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל אֶל שָׁאוּל לָמָּה הִרְגַּזְתַּנִי לְהַעֲלוֹת אֹתִי וַיֹּאמֶר שָׁאוּל צַר לִי מְאֹד וּפְלִשְׁתִּים נִלְחָמִים בִּי וַה׳ סָר מֵעָלַי וְלֹא עָנָנִי עוֹד גַּם בְּיַד הַנְּבִיאִים גַּם בַּחֲלֹמוֹת וָאֶקְרָאֶה לְךָ לְהוֹדִיעֵנִי מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה״. וְאִילּוּ ״אוּרִים וְתֻמִּים״ לָא קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Perhaps a community is different, Rather, from here, “And Samuel said to Saul, why have you angered me to bring me up? And Saul said, I am very pained, and the Philistines are waging war against me, and God has removed Himself from me and answers me no more, neither by the hands of the prophets nor by dreams. And I call to you to tell me what to do” he did not say the Urim VeTummim .
llm_translation: Perhaps the public is different. Rather, from here: "And Samuel said to Saul, 'Why have you disturbed me to bring me up?' And Saul said, 'I am greatly distressed, for the Philistines are warring against me, and God has turned away from me and does not answer me anymore, neither through prophets nor in dreams. So I called you to inform me what I should do.'" And if only "Urim and Thummim" was not mentioned.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּקַטְלֵיהּ לְנוֹב עִיר הַכֹּהֲנִים.
human_translation: because he killed Nov, the city of priests,
llm_translation: Because he killed him to Nob, city of the priests.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן דְּאַחִילוּ לֵיהּ מִן שְׁמַיָּא — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל אֶל שָׁאוּל (מָחָר) [וּמָחָר] אַתָּה וּבָנֶיךָ עִמִּי״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן ״עִמִּי״ — בִּמְחִיצָתִי.
human_translation: And from where that Saul was pardoned by the heavens As it is stated: “And Samuel said to Saul: Tomorrow you and your sons will be with me” And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: With me in my company
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we know that they began to hail from the heavens? - As it is stated: "And Samuel said to Saul, 'Tomorrow you and your sons will be with me.'" And Rabbi Yochanan said: "With me" - within my partition.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי, מֵהָכָא: ״וְהוֹקַעְנוּם לַה׳ בְּגִבְעַת שָׁאוּל בְּחִיר ה׳״. יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה ״בְּחִיר ה׳״.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say from here, and we will hang them up unto the Lord in the Giva of Saul, the chosen of the Lord” a Divine Voice that emerged and said the chosen of the Lord,
llm_translation: The sages said, from here: "And let us offer them to the Lord in Gibeah of Saul, the chosen one of the Lord." A heavenly voice emerged and said, "the chosen one of the Lord."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ בֶּן זוּטַרְתִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר זְבִידָא: בִּקְּשׁוּ לִקְבּוֹעַ פָּרָשַׁת בָּלָק בִּקְרִיאַת שְׁמַע, וּמִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא קְבָעוּהָ — מִשּׁוּם טוֹרַח צִבּוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu ben Zutarti said Rabbi Yehuda bar Zevida said: sought to establish the portion of Balak, the recitation of And why did they not establish it Because encumbrance on the congregation,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Avahu ben Zutarti, said Rabbi Yehuda bar Zvidah: They sought to establish the portion of Balak in the recitation of the Shema, and why did they not establish it? Because of the burden on the community.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב בָּהּ: ״אֵל מֹצִיאָם מִמִּצְרַיִם״ — לֵימָא פָּרָשַׁת רִבִּית וּפָרָשַׁת מִשְׁקָלוֹת דִּכְתִיב בָּהֶן יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם.
human_translation: Why If you say because as it is written therein: “God, who brought them forth out of Egypt, Let us say the portion of usury portion of weights as the exodus from Egypt is written therein
llm_translation: What is the reason? Perhaps because it is written in it: "God brought them out of Egypt" — let us say the portion of Ribit and the portion of Mishkalot in which it is written the exodus from Egypt.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין, מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב בָּהּ הַאי קְרָא: ״כָּרַע שָׁכַב כַּאֲרִי וּכְלָבִיא מִי יְקִימֶנּוּ״.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yosei bar Avin said: because it is written therein: “He couched, He lay down like a lion and a lioness; who shall rouse Him?
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yosei bar Avin said, because it is written in it this verse: "He crouched, he lay down like a lion, and like a lioness; who will rouse him?"

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא הַאי פְּסוּקָא וְתוּ לָא.
human_translation: And let us say this verse and nothing more.
llm_translation: And say, this verse and come not.

hebrew_text: גְּמִירִי: כֹּל פָּרָשָׁה דְּפַסְקַהּ מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ — פָּסְקִינַן, דְּלָא פַּסְקַהּ מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ — לָא פָּסְקִינַן.
human_translation: they learned any portion that Moses, our teacher, divided, we divide that Moses, our teacher, did not divide, we do not divide
llm_translation: Gemara: Every section that Moses our teacher concluded - we conclude, if Moses our teacher did not conclude - we do not conclude.

hebrew_text: פָּרָשַׁת צִיצִית מִפְּנֵי מָה קְבָעוּהָ?
human_translation: Why was the portion of ritual fringes established
llm_translation: The portion of tzitzit, why was it established?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר חֲבִיבָא, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים: מִצְוַת צִיצִית, יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם, עוֹל מִצְוֹת, וְדַעַת מִינִים, הִרְהוּר עֲבֵירָה, וְהִרְהוּר עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda bar Ḥaviva said: because it includes five elements The mitzva of ritual fringes, the exodus from Egypt, the yoke of mitzvot, the opinions of the heretics, thoughts of transgressions and thoughts of idolatry.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda bar Chaviva said, because it contains five things: the commandment of tzitzit, the exodus from Egypt, the yoke of commandments, knowledge of heretics, thoughts of sin, and thoughts of idolatry.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא הָנֵי תְּלָת מְפָרְשָׁן. עוֹל מִצְוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּרְאִיתֶם אֹתוֹ וּזְכַרְתֶּם אֶת כָּל מִצְוֹת ה׳״. צִיצִית, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעָשׂוּ לָהֶם צִיצִית וְגוֹ׳״. יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר הוֹצֵאתִי וְגוֹ׳״. אֶלָּא: דַּעַת מִינִים, הִרְהוּר עֲבֵירָה, וְהִרְהוּר עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה — מְנָלַן?
human_translation: Granted, these three are mentioned explicitly: The yoke of mitzvot as it is written: “And you shall look upon them and remember all the mitzvot of the Lord Ritual fringes as it is written: “And they will make for themselves ritual fringes” The exodus from Egypt as it is written: who took you out But where do we the opinions of the heretics, thoughts of transgressions and thoughts of idolatry?
llm_translation: In truth, these three are explained. The yoke of commandments, as it is written: "And you shall see it and remember all the commandments of the Lord." The fringes, as it is written: "And they shall make for themselves fringes, etc." The exodus from Egypt, as it is written: "That I brought you out, etc." Rather, the thoughts of heretics, sinful contemplation, and idolatrous contemplation — from where are they derived?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״אַחֲרֵי לְבַבְכֶם״ — זוֹ מִינוּת, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אָמַר נָבָל בְּלִבּוֹ אֵין אֱלֹהִים״. ״אַחֲרֵי עֵינֵיכֶם״ — זֶה הִרְהוּר עֲבֵירָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר שִׁמְשׁוֹן אֶל אָבִיו אוֹתָהּ קַח לִי, כִּי הִיא יָשְׁרָה בְעֵינָי״. ״אַתֶּם זוֹנִים״ — זֶה הִרְהוּר עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר ״וַיִּזְנוּ אַחֲרֵי הַבְּעָלִים״.
human_translation: As it was taught: “After your hearts” refers to of heresy as it is stated: “The fool said in his heart: ‘There is no God’; “After your eyes,” this thoughts of transgressions as it is stated: “And Samson said to his father, ‘That one take for me, for she is upright in my eyes’” “You shall stray after” idol worship, as it is stated: went astray after the Be’alim”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "After your own heart" - this refers to heresy, as it is stated: "Nabal said in his heart, 'There is no God.'" "After your own eyes" - this refers to sinful thoughts, as it is stated: "And Samson said to his father, 'Get her for me, for she is right in my eyes.'" "You are adulterers" - this refers to thoughts of idolatry, as it is stated: "And they played the harlot after the Baalim."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַזְכִּירִין יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם בַּלֵּילוֹת. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: הֲרֵי אֲנִי כְּבֶן שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה, וְלֹא זָכִיתִי שֶׁתֵּאָמֵר יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם בַּלֵּילוֹת, עַד שֶׁדְּרָשָׁהּ בֶּן זוֹמָא.
human_translation: The exodus from Egypt is mentioned at night, Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya said: I am approximately seventy years old, and I was never privileged the exodus from Egypt mentioned at night, until Ben Zoma interpreted it homiletically
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: We mention the Exodus from Egypt at night. Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah said: Behold, I am like a man of seventy years, and I did not merit that it should be said the Exodus from Egypt at night, until Ben Zoma expounded it.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לְמַעַן תִּזְכֹּר אֶת יוֹם צֵאתְךָ מֵאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם כֹּל יְמֵי חַיֶּיךָ״. ״יְמֵי חַיֶּיךָ״ — הַיָּמִים, ״כֹּל יְמֵי חַיֶּיךָ״ — הַלֵּילוֹת.
human_translation: as it is stated: “That you may remember the day you went out of the land of Egypt all the days of your life” The days of your life, All the days of your life,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "As it is stated, 'In order that you shall remember the day of your departure from the land of Egypt all the days of your life.' 'All the days of your life' - the days, 'all the days of your life' - the nights." English translation:

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: ״יְמֵי חַיֶּיךָ״ — הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה. ״כֹּל״ — לְהָבִיא לִימוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, say: The days of your life, this world, all to include the days of the Messiah.
llm_translation: The Sages say: "The days of your life" - this world. "All" - to bring to the days of the Messiah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, אָמַר לָהֶם בֶּן זוֹמָא לַחֲכָמִים: וְכִי מַזְכִּירִין יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם לִימוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ! וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״הִנֵּה יָמִים בָּאִים נְאֻם ה׳ וְלֹא יֹאמְרוּ עוֹד חַי ה׳ אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱלָה אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם כִּי אִם חַי ה׳ אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱלָה וַאֲשֶׁר הֵבִיא אֶת זֶרַע בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאֶרֶץ צָפוֹנָה וּמִכֹּל הָאֲרָצוֹת אֲשֶׁר הִדַּחְתִּים שָׁם״.
human_translation: it was taught Ben Zoma said to the Sages: And is the exodus from Egypt mentioned in the days of the Messiah? Was it not already said “Behold, days are coming, says the Lord, that they will no longer say: The Lord lives Who brought up the children of Israel out of the Land of Egypt. Rather: As the Lord lives, that brought up and led the seed of the house of Israel up out of the north country and from all the countries where I had driven them”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, Tanya, Amar Lahem Ben Zoma LaChachamim: Ve'chi Mazkirin Yetsiat Mitzrayim LiYemot HaMashiach! Ve'halo Kevar Ne'emar 'Hineh Yamim Ba'im Ne'um Hashem Ve'Lo Yomru Od Chai Hashem Asher He'alah Et Bnei Yisrael Me'eretz Mitzrayim Ki Im Chai Hashem Asher He'alah Va'asher Hevi Et Zera Beit Yisrael Me'eretz Tzafonah UmiKol Ha'aratzot Asher Hidachtim Sham'." English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא שֶׁתֵּעָקֵר יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם מִמְּקוֹמָהּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁתְּהֵא שִׁעְבּוּד מַלְכֻיוֹת עִיקָּר, וִיצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם טָפֵל לוֹ.
human_translation: and they said to him not that the exodus from Egypt will be uprooted from its place Rather, the subjugation of the kingdoms will be primary and the exodus from Egypt will be secondary.
llm_translation: They said to him: Not that the exodus from Egypt should be uprooted from its place, but that the servitude of kingdoms should be primary, and the exodus from Egypt secondary to it.

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא יִקָּרֵא שִׁמְךָ עוֹד יַעֲקֹב כִּי אִם יִשְׂרָאֵל יִהְיֶה שְׁמֶךָ״,
human_translation: On a similar you say: “Your name shall no longer be called Jacob; rather, Israel will be your name”
llm_translation: As an example of this, you say: "Your name shall no longer be called Jacob, but Israel shall be your name."

hebrew_text: לֹא שֶׁיֵּעָקֵר ״יַעֲקֹב״ מִמְּקוֹמוֹ, אֶלָּא ״יִשְׂרָאֵל״ עִיקָּר וְ״יַעֲקֹב״ טָפֵל לוֹ. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר ״אַל תִּזְכְּרוּ רִאשֹׁנוֹת וְקַדְמֹנִיּוֹת אַל תִּתְבֹּנָנוּ״: אַל תִּזְכְּרוּ רִאשֹׁנוֹת״ — זֶה שִׁעְבּוּד מַלְכֻיוֹת, ״וְקַדְמֹנִיּוֹת אַל תִּתְבֹּנָנוּ״ — זוֹ יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם.
human_translation: not that Jacob will be uprooted from its place, but that Israel primary to which Jacob secondary, And it also says “Do not remember the former events, and do not ponder things of old” “Do not remember the former events,” that is the subjugation to the kingdoms, and “do not ponder things of old,” that is the exodus from Egypt,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Not that 'Yaakov' was uprooted from his place, rather 'Yisrael' is primary and 'Yaakov' is secondary to it. And so it says, 'Do not remember the former things, nor consider the things of old.' 'Do not remember the former things' — this refers to the subjugation of kingdoms, 'nor consider the things of old' — this is the exodus from Egypt."

hebrew_text: ״הִנְנִי עֹשֶׂה חֲדָשָׁה עַתָּה תִצְמָח״, תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: זוֹ מִלְחֶמֶת גּוֹג וּמָגוֹג.
human_translation: “Behold, I will do new things, now it will spring forth” Rav Yosef taught This refers to the war of Gog and Magog,
llm_translation: "Behold, I am doing a new thing; now it shall spring forth." Rav Yosef taught: This refers to the war of Gog and Magog.

hebrew_text: מָשָׁל לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה — לְאָדָם שֶׁהָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ בַּדֶּרֶךְ וּפָגַע בּוֹ זְאֵב וְנִיצַּל מִמֶּנּוּ, וְהָיָה מְסַפֵּר וְהוֹלֵךְ מַעֲשֵׂה זְאֵב. פָּגַע בּוֹ אֲרִי וְנִיצַּל מִמֶּנּוּ, וְהָיָה מְסַפֵּר וְהוֹלֵךְ מַעֲשֵׂה אֲרִי. פָּגַע בּוֹ נָחָשׁ וְנִיצַּל מִמֶּנּוּ, שָׁכַח מַעֲשֵׂה שְׁנֵיהֶם, וְהָיָה מְסַפֵּר וְהוֹלֵךְ מַעֲשֵׂה נָחָשׁ. אַף כָּךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל — צָרוֹת אַחֲרוֹנוֹת מְשַׁכְּחוֹת אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: a parable: To what is this comparable? To a person who was walking along the way and a wolf accosted him and he survived it, and he continued to relate the story of the wolf. A lion accosted him and he survived it, and he continued to relate the story of the lion. A snake accosted him and he survived it, he forgot both and he continued to relate the story of the snake. So too Israel; more recent troubles cause the earlier to be forgotten.
llm_translation: A parable: To what is this matter similar? — To a person who was walking on the road and a wolf encountered him and he was saved from it, and he was recounting and going about the wolf's incident. A lion encountered him and he was saved from it, and he was recounting and going about the lion's incident. A snake encountered him and he was saved from it, he forgot the incidents of both of them, and he was recounting and going about the snake's incident. So too with Israel — the later troubles cause them to forget the earlier ones.

hebrew_text: ״אַבְרָם הוּא אַבְרָהָם״:
human_translation: “Abram is Abraham”
llm_translation: "Avram hu Avraham."

hebrew_text: בַּתְּחִלָּה נַעֲשָׂה אָב לַאֲרָם, וּלְבַסּוֹף נַעֲשָׂה אָב לְכָל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Initially he became a father, to Aram, and ultimately he became the father of the entire world,
llm_translation: At the beginning, he became a father to Aram, and in the end, he became a father to the entire world.

hebrew_text: ״שָׂרַי הִיא שָׂרָה״.
human_translation: Sarai is Sarah.”
llm_translation: "Sa'rai hee Sara."

hebrew_text: בַּתְּחִלָּה נַעֲשֵׂית שָׂרַי לְאוּמָּתָהּ, וּלְבַסּוֹף נַעֲשֵׂית שָׂרָה לְכָל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Initially she was a princess to her nation: but ultimately she became Sarah, for the entire world.
llm_translation: At the beginning, she was called Sarai, and in the end, she was called Sarah for the entire world.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי בַּר קַפָּרָא: כָּל הַקּוֹרֵא לְאַבְרָהָם ״אַבְרָם״ — עוֹבֵר בַּעֲשֵׂה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיָה שִׁמְךָ אַבְרָהָם״. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: עוֹבֵר בְּלָאו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא יִקָּרֵא עוֹד [אֶת] שִׁמְךָ אַבְרָם״.
human_translation: bar Kappara taught: Anyone who calls Abraham Abram transgresses a positive mitzva, as it is stated: “And your name will be Abraham” Rabbi Eliezer says: transgresses a negative mitzva, as it is stated: “And your name shall no longer be called Abram,
llm_translation: It was taught by Bar Kappara: Anyone who reads to Abraham "Avram" - transgresses a positive commandment, as it is stated: "And your name shall be Avraham." Rabbi Eliezer says: He transgresses a negative commandment, as it is stated: "And your name shall no longer be called Avram."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה הַקּוֹרֵא לְשָׂרָה ״שָׂרַי״ הָכִי נָמֵי?
human_translation: But from here one who calls Sarah Sarai also
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, one who reads to Sarah "Sarai," is this not accurate?

hebrew_text: הָתָם, קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא אָמַר לְאַבְרָהָם: ״שָׂרַי אִשְׁתְּךָ לֹא תִקְרָא אֶת שְׁמָהּ שָׂרָי כִּי שָׂרָה שְׁמָהּ״.
human_translation: There the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Abraham your wife Sarai, you shall not call her name Sarai; rather, Sarah is her name”
llm_translation: There, the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Abraham: "Your wife Sarai, you shall not call her name Sarai, for Sarah is her name."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה הַקּוֹרֵא לְיַעֲקֹב ״יַעֲקֹב״ הָכִי נָמֵי?!
human_translation: But if that is so, one who calls Jacob Jacob, also
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, one who reads "Yaakov" should read it as "Ya'akov" - is this really so?!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דַּהֲדַר אַהְדְּרֵיהּ קְרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֱלֹהִים לְיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּמַרְאוֹת הַלַּיְלָה וַיֹּאמֶר יַעֲקֹב יַעֲקֹב״.
human_translation: It is different there, as the verse reverts back as it is written “And God said to Israel in the visions of the night, and said, Jacob, Jacob,
llm_translation: The matter is different there, for the verse repeated itself, as it is written: "And God said to Israel in the visions of the night, and He said, 'Jacob, Jacob.'"

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר זְבִידָא: ״אַתָּה הוּא ה׳ הָאֱלֹהִים אֲשֶׁר בָּחַרְתָּ בְּאַבְרָם״!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin, and some say Rabbi Yosei bar Zevida, raised an objection “You are the Lord, God, Who chose Abram
llm_translation: The text states: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin raises an objection, and it was stated alternatively by Rabbi Yosei bar Zavida: "You are the Lord, the God who chose Abram!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לֵיהּ הָתָם נָבִיא הוּא דְּקָא מְסַדַּר לְשִׁבְחֵיהּ דְּרַחֲמָנָא מַאי דַּהֲוָה מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: There, the prophet is recounting God’s praises, that which was originally,
llm_translation: He said to him: There, it is a prophet who is arranging praises for the Compassionate One. What is it that was from the beginning.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך מאימתי
llm_translation: We will return to you from when.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיָה קוֹרֵא בַּתּוֹרָה וְהִגִּיעַ זְמַן הַמִּקְרָא, אִם כִּוֵּון לִבּוֹ — יָצָא.
human_translation: One who was reading the Torah and the time for the recitation arrived, if he focused his heart, he fulfilled
llm_translation: Mishnah: He was reading in the Torah and the time for the public reading arrived, if his heart was intent - he fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: בַּפְּרָקִים, שׁוֹאֵל מִפְּנֵי הַכָּבוֹד וּמֵשִׁיב. וּבְאֶמְצַע, שׁוֹאֵל מִפְּנֵי הַיִּרְאָה וּמֵשִׁיב, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: At the paragraphs, one may greet due to the respect and one may respond And in the middle one may greet due to the fear and one may respond statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: In the chapters, one asks out of respect and answers. And in the middle, one asks out of fear and answers, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בָּאֶמְצַע, שׁוֹאֵל מִפְּנֵי הַיִּרְאָה וּמֵשִׁיב מִפְּנֵי הַכָּבוֹד. וּבַפְּרָקִים, שׁוֹאֵל מִפְּנֵי הַכָּבוֹד וּמֵשִׁיב שָׁלוֹם לְכָל אָדָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: In the middle greet due to fear and respond due to respect. In the paragraphs, one may greet due to respect and respond with a greeting to any person
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: In the marketplace, one asks out of fear and answers out of respect. In the alleys, one asks out of respect and greets everyone with peace.

hebrew_text: אֵלּוּ הֵן בֵּין הַפְּרָקִים: בֵּין בְּרָכָה רִאשׁוֹנָה לַשְּׁנִיָּה, בֵּין שְׁנִיָּה לִ״שְׁמַע״, בֵּין ״שְׁמַע״ לִ״וְהָיָה אִם שָׁמוֹעַ״, בֵּין ״וְהָיָה אִם שָׁמוֹעַ״ לְ״וַיֹּאמֶר״, בֵּין ״וַיֹּאמֶר״ לֶ״אֱמֶת וְיַצִּיב״.
human_translation: these are between the paragraphs: Between the first blessing and the second, between the second and Shema , between Shema and If you indeed heed [ VeHaya im Shamoa ], between VeHaya im Shamoa and And the Lord spoke [ VaYomer ] and between VaYomer and True and Firm emet veyatziv
llm_translation: These are the intervals: between the first blessing and the second, between the second and "Shema," between "Shema" and "Vehaya Im Shamo'a," between "Vehaya Im Shamo'a" and "Vayomer," between "Vayomer" and "Emet Veyatziv."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בֵּין ״וַיֹּאמֶר״ לֶ״אֱמֶת וְיַצִּיב״ — לֹא יַפְסִיק.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, says: Between VaYomer and emet veyatziv , one may not interrupt
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Between "And He said" and "the Truth and He established" - do not interrupt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קָרְחָה: לָמָּה קָדְמָה פָּרָשַׁת ״שְׁמַע״ לְ״וְהָיָה אִם שָׁמוֹעַ״ — כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּקַבֵּל עָלָיו עוֹל מַלְכוּת שָׁמַיִם תְּחִלָּה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְקַבֵּל עָלָיו עוֹל מִצְוֹת. ״וְהָיָה אִם שָׁמוֹעַ״ לְ״וַיֹּאמֶר״ — שֶׁ״וְהָיָה אִם שָׁמוֹעַ״ נוֹהֵג בֵּין בַּיּוֹם וּבֵין בַּלַּיְלָה, ״וַיֹּאמֶר״ אֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa said: Why, did the portion of Shema precede VeHaya im Shamoa ? so that one will first accept upon himself the yoke of the kingdom of Heaven, and only then accept upon himself the yoke of the mitzvot, VeHaya im Shamoa VaYomer ? VeHaya im Shamoa is practiced both by day and by night, VaYomer , is only practiced during the day.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha said: Why did the portion of "Shema" precede "Vehaya im shamo'a"? - In order that one should first accept upon himself the yoke of the Kingdom of Heaven, and afterwards accept upon himself the yoke of the commandments. "Vehaya im shamo'a" to "Vayomer" - "Vehaya im shamo'a" is practiced both during the day and at night, "Vayomer" is practiced only during the day.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִצְוֹת צְרִיכוֹת כַּוָּונָה.
human_translation: Learn from this mitzvot require intent,
llm_translation: Gemara: Gemara, hear from it, from it, commandments require intention.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אִם כִּוֵּון לִבּוֹ״ — לִקְרוֹת. לִקְרוֹת?! וְהָא קָא קָרֵי!
human_translation: What is If one focused his heart? to read. to read? Isn’t he already reading?
llm_translation: What is "if his heart is directed" - to read. To read?! But he is already reading!

hebrew_text: בְּקוֹרֵא לְהַגִּיהַּ.
human_translation: is reading in order to emend
llm_translation: He who reads to her.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע כִּכְתָבָהּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בְּכָל לָשׁוֹן.
human_translation: The Sages taught Shema as it is written, statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: in any language.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The recitation of the Shema must be in its written form, the words of Rabbi. And the sages say: In any language.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי? אָמַר קְרָא ״וְהָיוּ״ בַּהֲוָיָיתָן יְהוּ.
human_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi “And will be as they are, so shall they be;
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi's opinion? The verse says, "and they shall be" in their existence they shall be.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ? אָמַר קְרָא: ״שְׁמַע״ — בְּכָל לָשׁוֹן שֶׁאַתָּה שׁוֹמֵעַ.
human_translation: And what is the reason for the Rabbis’ as it is stated: “Hear, in any language that you hear
llm_translation: The Sages, what is their reasoning? The verse says: "Hear" - in any language that you hear.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי נָמֵי, הָא כְּתִיב ״שְׁמַע״! הַהוּא מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: הַשְׁמַע לְאָזְנֶיךָ מַה שֶּׁאַתָּה מוֹצִיא מִפִּיךָ.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi isn’t it also stated: “Hear, He requires this verse Make your ears hear what your mouth utters,
llm_translation: To Rabbi Namei, is it not written "Listen"! That one wanted to say to him: "Listen with your ears to what you are uttering from your mouth."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? סָבְרִי לַהּ כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר לֹא הִשְׁמִיעַ לְאָזְנוֹ — יָצָא.
human_translation: And from the Rabbis they hold in accordance with the one who said: One who recited inaudible to his ears, fulfilled
llm_translation: The Sages? Hold like the one who says, "If he did not make him hear with his ear - he has fulfilled his obligation."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי הָא כְּתִיב ״וְהָיוּ״? הַהוּא מִבְּעֵי לְהוּ שֶׁלֹּא יִקְרָא לְמַפְרֵעַ.
human_translation: And according to the Rabbis, isn’t it also written: “And they will be”? They, too, require this that one may not recite out of order.
llm_translation: And for the sages it is also written "and they shall be"? That one wants to say that he should not call to rebellion.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי, שֶׁלֹּא יִקְרָא לְמַפְרֵעַ מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״דְּבָרִים״ ״הַדְּבָרִים״. וְרַבָּנַן, ״דְּבָרִים״ ״הַדְּבָרִים״ — לָא דָּרְשִׁי.
human_translation: And from where does Rabbi that one may not recite out of order? derives it Words [ devarim ], the words [ hadevarim ], The Rabbis, do not derive the words, words,
llm_translation: Rabbi, should he not read "mafrea" as "mena leih"? It is derived from "devarim" "hadevarim." And the Rabbis, "devarim" "hadevarim" - they did not expound.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּסָבַר רַבִּי דְּכָל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ בְּכָל לָשׁוֹן נֶאֶמְרָה. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ בִּלְשׁוֹן הַקּוֹדֶשׁ נֶאֶמְרָה, ״וְהָיוּ״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Is that to say that Rabbi holds that the entire Torah, may be recited in any language? As if it should enter your mind that may only be recited in the holy tongue then why do I need that which the Torah wrote: “And they will be”?
llm_translation: In the matter of Rabbi's opinion, that the entire Torah was spoken in every language. For if it were to enter your mind that it was spoken in the holy tongue, "and they shall be" - why did the Merciful One write this for me?

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב ״שְׁמַע״.
human_translation: is necessary because Shema , is written.
llm_translation: It is necessary because it is written "Shema."

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּסָבְרִי רַבָּנַן דְּכָל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ בִּלְשׁוֹן הַקּוֹדֶשׁ נֶאֶמְרָה. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ בְּכָל לָשׁוֹן נֶאֶמְרָה, ״שְׁמַע״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי?!
human_translation: Is that to say that the Rabbis hold that the entire Torah may only be recited in the holy tongue As if it should enter your mind that may be recited in any language, then why do I require that which the Torah wrote: Shema ,
llm_translation: In the matter of the opinion of the Sages who hold that the entire Torah was spoken in the Holy Tongue, for if it were to enter your mind that it was spoken in every language, "Hear" - why did the Merciful One write it for me?!

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב ״וְהָיוּ״.
human_translation: is necessary because and they will be, is written.
llm_translation: It is necessary because it is written "and they shall be."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהָיוּ״ שֶׁלֹּא יִקְרָא לְמַפְרֵעַ. ״הַדְּבָרִים … עַל לְבָבֶךָ״ — יָכוֹל תְּהֵא כָּל הַפָּרָשָׁה צְרִיכָה כַּוָּונָה? — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״הָאֵלֶּה״. עַד כָּאן צְרִיכָה כַּוָּונָה, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ אֵין צְרִיכָה כַּוָּונָה. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: The Rabbis taught: And they will be, one may not recite out of order. These words…upon your heart, might the entire paragraph requires intent? Therefore the verse teaches: These, to this point, one must have intent, from here on one need not have intent, statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And they shall not call to the rebellious" (Isaiah 1:23). "The matters... upon your heart" — Could it be that the entire portion requires intention? The Talmud teaches: "These" (Exodus 32:1). Up to this point, intention is required; from here on, it is not required. These are the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to him: But states:
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva: Behold he says:

hebrew_text: ״אֲשֶׁר אָנֹכִי מְצַוְּךָ הַיּוֹם עַל לְבָבֶךָ״. מִכָּאן אַתָּה לָמֵד שֶׁכָּל הַפָּרָשָׁה כּוּלָּהּ צְרִיכָה כַּוָּונָה.
human_translation: “Which I command you this day, will be upon your heart.” from here you derive that the entire portion requires intent.
llm_translation: "‘which I command you today upon your heart.’ From here you learn that the entire portion requires intention."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva;
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַהָא דְתַנְיָא. הַקּוֹרֵא אֶת שְׁמַע צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּכַוֵּין אֶת לִבּוֹ, רַבִּי אַחָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁכִּוֵּון לִבּוֹ בְּפֶרֶק רִאשׁוֹן שׁוּב אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אַחָא שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Some teach this with regard to that which was taught One who recites Shema must focus his heart Rabbi Aḥa says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda: Once he focused his heart for the first paragraph he no longer requires Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Aḥa who said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches about the following matter that was taught: One who recites the Shema must direct his heart, Rabbi Ahah in the name of Rabbi Yehuda says: Once he has directed his heart in the first chapter, he no longer needs to. Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Ahah who said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידָךְ. ״וְהָיוּ״ — שֶׁלֹּא יִקְרָא לְמַפְרֵעַ. ״עַל לְבָבֶךָ״ — רַב זוּטְרָא אוֹמֵר עַד כָּאן מִצְוַת כַּוָּונָה, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ מִצְוַת קְרִיאָה. רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה אוֹמֵר: עַד כָּאן מִצְוַת קְרִיאָה, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ מִצְוַת כַּוָּונָה.
human_translation: It was taught another And they will be, it may not be recited out of order. Upon your heart, Rav Zutra says: To this point, the mitzva of intent; from here on, the mitzva of recitation. Rabbi Yoshiya says To this point, the mitzva of recitation; from here on the mitzva of intent.
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: "And they shall be" - that one should not read it as "mafrea" (rebellious). "Upon your heart" - Rav Zutra says, until here is the mitzvah of intent, from here onward is the mitzvah of reading. Rabbi Yoshiyah says: until here is the mitzvah of reading, from here onward is the mitzvah of intent.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ מִצְוַת קְרִיאָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״לְדַבֵּר בָּם״? הָכָא נָמֵי הָא כְתִיב ״וְדִבַּרְתָּ בָּם״!
