hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא הָא וְלָא לִבְעֵי הָא! קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע עֲדִיפָא, דְּאִית בַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: And let him say this, and he will not need that, Shema is preferable as it contains two
llm_translation: And it was said: But is this necessary? The recitation of the Shema is preferable, for it contains two verses.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: סָפֵק קָרָא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע סָפֵק לֹא קָרָא — חוֹזֵר וְקוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. סָפֵק הִתְפַּלֵּל סָפֵק לֹא הִתְפַּלֵּל — אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר וּמִתְפַּלֵּל. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: וּלְוַאי שֶׁיִּתְפַּלֵּל אָדָם כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said uncertain whether he recited Shema whether he did not recite must recite Shema again. uncertain whether he prayed or whether he did not pray, he does not pray again, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: if only a person would pray throughout the entire day.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: If one is in doubt whether he recited the Shema or not, he should go back and recite the Shema. If one is in doubt whether he prayed or not, he does not go back and pray. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Would that a person pray the entire day.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָיָה עוֹמֵד בִּתְפִלָּה וְנִזְכַּר שֶׁהִתְפַּלֵּל פּוֹסֵק — וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶמְצַע בְּרָכָה. אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כִּי הֲוֵינַן בֵּי רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ, בְּעַן מִינֵּיהּ: הָנֵי בְּנֵי בֵי רַב דְּטָעוּ וּמַדְכְּרִי דְּחוֹל בְּשַׁבָּת, מַהוּ שֶׁיִּגְמְרוּ? וַאֲמַר לַן: גּוֹמְרִין כׇּל אוֹתָהּ בְּרָכָה?!
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: who was standing in prayer and remembered that he prayed must interrupt even in the middle of a blessing. Is that so? Didn’t Rav Naḥman say: When we were in the school of Rabba bar Avuh we raised a dilemma before him: Those students in the school of Rav mistakenly recited a weekday on Shabbat, what is completing And said to us: one must complete that entire blessing.
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: If one was standing in prayer and remembered that he had already concluded his prayer - even in the middle of a blessing. Is it not so?! But didn't Rav Nachman say: When we were in the house of Rabba bar Avuh, some of his students were measuring and cutting grass on Shabbat, what should they do? And he said to us: Should they complete the entire blessing?!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא! הָתָם גַּבְרָא בַּר חִיּוּבָא הוּא, וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דְּלָא אַטְרְחוּהוּ מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד שַׁבָּת, אֲבָל הָכָא — הָא צַלִּי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: How can you compare There, the individual is one who is obligated and it is the Sages who did not impose upon him in deference to Shabbat But here, didn’t he pray?
llm_translation: So it is! There, it is a man of obligation, and the sages did not exempt him because of the honor of Shabbat. But here - let him roast it.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הִתְפַּלֵּל וְנִכְנַס לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת וּמָצָא צִבּוּר שֶׁמִּתְפַּלְּלִין, אִם יָכוֹל לְחַדֵּשׁ בָּהּ דָּבָר — יַחְזוֹר וְיִתְפַּלֵּל, וְאִם לָאו — אַל יַחְזוֹר וְיִתְפַּלֵּל.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: prayed, and enters a synagogue to find a congregation praying, if he is able to introduce a new element, he may pray again, and if not, he may not pray again.
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: If one prayed and entered the synagogue and found the congregation praying, if he can insert something new into his prayer - let him go back and pray, but if not - he should not go back and pray.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן קַמַּיְיתָא, הָנֵי מִילֵּי יָחִיד וְיָחִיד
human_translation: necessary. If he had taught us the first applies only an individual and an individual
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear the first part, those are matters of individual and individual.

hebrew_text: אוֹ צִבּוּר וְצִבּוּר, אֲבָל יָחִיד לְגַבֵּי צִבּוּר כְּמַאן דְּלָא צַלִּי דָּמֵי, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָכָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אַתְחֵיל בַּהּ, אֲבָל הָתָם דְּאַתְחֵיל בַּהּ — אֵימָא לָא. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: or a congregation and a congregation; however, an individual vis-à-vis the congregation is as one who has not prayed. he taught us And, if he had taught us here because he did not begin but there, in the case where he began say not necessary.
llm_translation: Or congregation and congregation, but individual in relation to congregation as one who does not remove blood, it teaches us. And if we were to hear this here, because you do not begin with it, but there where you begin with it — say no. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הַנִּכְנָס לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת וּמָצָא צִבּוּר שֶׁמִּתְפַּלְּלִין, אִם יָכוֹל לְהַתְחִיל וְלִגְמוֹר עַד שֶׁלֹּא יַגִּיעַ שְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר לְ״מוֹדִים״ — יִתְפַּלֵּל. וְאִם לָאו — אַל יִתְפַּלֵּל. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר: אִם יָכוֹל לְהַתְחִיל וְלִגְמוֹר עַד שֶׁלֹּא יַגִּיעַ שְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר לִ״קְדוּשָּׁה״ — יִתְפַּלֵּל, וְאִם לָאו — אַל יִתְפַּלֵּל.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: One who enters a synagogue and found that the congregation is reciting prayer, if he is able to begin and complete before the prayer leader reaches thanksgiving [ modim ], he should pray, and, if not, he should not pray. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: If he is able to begin and complete before the prayer leader reaches sanctification [ kedusha ], then he should pray. If not, then he should not pray.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: If one enters the synagogue and finds the congregation praying, if he can begin and finish before the Shaliach Tzibbur reaches "Modim," he should pray. And if not, he should not pray. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: If he can begin and finish before the Shaliach Tzibbur reaches "Kedusha," he should pray, and if not, he should not pray.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִפַּלְגִי — מָר סָבַר יָחִיד אוֹמֵר ״קְדוּשָּׁה״, וּמַר סָבַר אֵין יָחִיד אוֹמֵר ״קְדוּשָּׁה״.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Sage, holds: An individual recite kedusha and Sage, holds an individual may not recite kedusha
llm_translation: With what do they differentiate? - Master A thinks an individual says "Kedusha," and Master B thinks an individual does not say "Kedusha."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין הַיָּחִיד אוֹמֵר ״קְדוּשָּׁה״ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנִקְדַּשְׁתִּי בְּתוֹךְ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁבִּקְדוּשָּׁה לֹא יְהֵא פָּחוֹת מֵעֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: Similarly, Rav Adda bar Ahava stated, From where is it derived that an individual may not recite kedusha As it is stated: “And I shall be hallowed among the children of Israel” any expression of sanctity may not be fewer than ten
llm_translation: And so said Rav Adda bar Ahava: From where do we derive that an individual does not say "Kedusha"? — As it is stated: "And I will be sanctified among the children of Israel," anything that involves sanctity should not be less than ten.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? דְּתָנֵי רַבְנַאי אֲחוּהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: אָתְיָא ״תּוֹךְ״ ״תּוֹךְ״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְנִקְדַּשְׁתִּי בְּתוֹךְ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״הִבָּדְלוּ מִתּוֹךְ הָעֵדָה הַזֹּאת״, מָה לְהַלָּן עֲשָׂרָה. אַף כָּאן עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: How is this inferred which was taught by Rabbenai, the brother Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba: It is inferred among, among. Here it is written: “And I shall be hallowed among the children of Israel,” and there, it is written “Separate yourselves from among this congregation” Just as there ten, so too here, ten.
llm_translation: What is implied? For it was taught by the scholars, the brother of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba: It comes "within" "within." It is written here: "And I will be sanctified among the children of Israel," and it is written there: "Separate yourselves from within this congregation." Just as there, the requirement is ten, so too here it is ten.

hebrew_text: וּדְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהַת מִפְסָק לָא פָּסֵיק.
human_translation: And, in any case, everyone one may not interrupt
llm_translation: And the entirety of the world from that point did not cease.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ לְהַפְסִיק לִ״יהֵא שְׁמוֹ הַגָּדוֹל מְבוֹרָךְ״? כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן תַּלְמִידֵי דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמְרִי: לַכֹּל אֵין מַפְסִיקִין חוּץ מִן ״יְהֵא שְׁמוֹ הַגָּדוֹל מְבוֹרָךְ״. שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ עוֹסֵק בְּמַעֲשֵׂה מֶרְכָּבָה — פּוֹסֵק. וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּוָתֵיהּ.
human_translation: a dilemma was raised What is to interrupt to “May His great name be blessed” When Rav Dimi came he said: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon, disciples of Rabbi Yoḥanan, said: One may not interrupt for anything, except for: “May His great name be blessed,” as even engaged in Act of the Chariot Ma’aseh Merkava ] he stops The halakha is not in accordance with his
llm_translation: He asked them: What is the ruling regarding interrupting to say "His great Name be blessed"? When Rav Dimi came, he said: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon, disciples of Rabbi Yochanan, said: For all matters, one does not interrupt except for "His great Name be blessed." Even if one is engaged in studying the laws of the chariot, he should interrupt. And there is no halacha like his opinion.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מְבָרֵךְ לִפְנֵיהֶם וּלְאַחֲרֵיהֶם. לְמֵימְרָא דְקָסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּעַל קֶרִי מוּתָּר בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, מִנַּיִן לְבַעַל קֶרִי שֶׁאָסוּר בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהוֹדַעְתָּם לְבָנֶיךָ וְלִבְנֵי בָנֶיךָ״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״יוֹם אֲשֶׁר עָמַדְתָּ וְגוֹ׳״. מָה לְהַלָּן בַּעֲלֵי קְרָיִין אֲסוּרִין, אַף כָּאן בַּעֲלֵי קְרָיִין אֲסוּרִין!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says he recites a blessing beforehand and afterward Is that to say that Rabbi Yehuda holds that one who experienced a seminal emission is permitted in matters of Torah? Didn’t Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say: From where that one who experiences a seminal emission is prohibited from in matters of Torah? As it is stated: and you shall impart them to your children and your children’s children” And, juxtaposed to it, “The day that you stood just as below, those who experienced a seminal emission were prohibited so too here, those who experience a seminal emission are prohibited
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says, one blesses before them and after them. The Gemara asks: Does Rabbi Yehuda hold that one who has a seminal emission is permitted in matters of Torah? But didn't Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say: From where do we know that one who has a seminal emission is forbidden in matters of Torah? As it is stated: "And you shall make it known to your children and your children's children," and it is juxtaposed with: "The day that you stood, etc." Just as there, those with seminal emissions are forbidden, so too here, those with seminal emissions are forbidden!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא דָּרֵישׁ ״סְמוּכִים״, וְהָאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אֲפִילּוּ מַאן דְּלָא דָּרֵישׁ סְמוּכִים בְּכָל הַתּוֹרָה, בְּמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה — דָּרֵישׁ. דְּהָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא דָּרֵישׁ ״סְמוּכִין״ בְּכָל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ וּבְמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה — דָּרֵישׁ.
human_translation: And if you say that Rabbi Yehuda does not derive homiletic interpretations from juxtaposed didn’t Rav Yosef Even one who does not derive homiletic interpretations from juxtaposed the entire Torah, derives in Deuteronomy [ Mishne Torah ], as Rabbi Yehuda does not derive homiletic interpretations from juxtaposed throughout the entire Torah and he does derive them in Mishne Torah .
llm_translation: And if you will say, Rabbi Yehuda does not expound "semuchim," but Rav Yosef said: Even one who does not expound "semuchim" in the entire Torah, in the Mishnah Torah - he expounds. For Rabbi Yehuda does not expound "semuchin" in the entire Torah, but in the Mishnah Torah - he expounds.

hebrew_text: וּבְכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ מְנָא לַן דְּלָא דָּרֵישׁ — דְּתַנְיָא, בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר ״מְכַשֵּׁפָה לֹא תְחַיֶּה״, וְנֶאֱמַר ״כׇּל שׁוֹכֵב עִם בְּהֵמָה מוֹת יוּמָת״ — סְמָכוֹ עִנְיָן לוֹ, לוֹמַר: מָה שׁוֹכֵב עִם בְּהֵמָה בִּסְקִילָה, אַף מְכַשֵּׁפָה נָמֵי בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: And from where do we derive does not derive homiletic interpretations throughout the entire Torah? As it was taught ben Azzai says: It is stated: “You shall not allow a sorceress to live” and it is stated: “Whoever lies with a beast shall surely be put to death” juxtaposed this matter to that to say: Just as one who lies with a beast by stoning so too a sorceress by stoning.
llm_translation: In all the Torah entirely count us that not expound — as it was taught, Ben Azzai says: It is stated "You shall not allow a sorceress to live," and it is stated "Whoever lies with an animal shall surely be put to death" — he juxtaposes the matter for him, to say: Just as one who lies with an animal is punished by stoning, so too a sorceress is also punished by stoning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: וְכִי מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסְּמָכוֹ עִנְיָן לוֹ, נוֹצִיא לָזֶה לִסְקִילָה? אֶלָּא: אוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי בִּכְלַל כׇּל הַמְכַשְּׁפִים הָיוּ, וְלָמָּה יָצְאוּ — לְהַקִּישׁ לָהֶן וְלוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה אוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי בִּסְקִילָה — אַף מְכַשֵּׁפָה בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to him: And does that juxtaposed this matter to that warrant taking out to be stoned? Rather, Mediums and wizards were included among all sorcerers. And why were they singled out draw an analogy to them and say to you: Just as a medium and a wizard by stoning, so too is a sorceress by stoning.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehuda: And because he relied on this matter, shall we bring him out to stoning? Rather, Ov and Yidoni were included among all the sorcerers, and why did they go out? To compare them and say to you: Just as Ov and Yidoni in stoning, so too a sorceress in stoning.

hebrew_text: וּבְמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה מְנָא לַן דְּדָרֵישׁ — דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר נוֹשֵׂא אָדָם אֲנוּסַת אָבִיו וּמְפוּתַּת אָבִיו אֲנוּסַת בְּנוֹ וּמְפוּתַּת בְּנוֹ.
human_translation: And from where do we derive derives homiletic interpretations in Mishne Torah ? As it was taught Rabbi Eliezer said that a man wed raped by his father and seduced by his father; raped by his son and seduced by his son.
llm_translation: In the Mishnah Torah, we have learned that one interprets — as it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says, "A man bears the guilt of his father's coercion and the guilt of his father's seduction is upon his son."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹסֵר בַּאֲנוּסַת אָבִיו וּבִמְפוּתַּת אָבִיו. וְאָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? — דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יִקַּח אִישׁ אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו וְלֹא יְגַלֶּה אֶת כְּנַף אָבִיו״. כָּנָף שֶׁרָאָה אָבִיו — לֹא יְגַלֶּה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda prohibits a woman raped by his father and a woman seduced by his father. And Rav Giddel said Rav said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda’s As it is written: “A man shall not take his father’s wife, and shall not uncover his father’s skirt” A skirt that has been seen by his father, may not be uncovered
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah prohibits the "anusat aviv" and the "mefutat aviv." And Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehudah's opinion? — As it is written: "A man shall not take his father's wife and shall not uncover his father's wing." The wing that his father saw — he shall not uncover.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּבַאֲנוּסַת אָבִיו כְּתִיב — דִּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״וְנָתַן הָאִישׁ הַשּׁוֹכֵב עִמָּהּ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And from where that is written with regard to a woman raped by his father? As juxtaposed to it, “And the man who lay with her must give
llm_translation: And from what is it derived that in the case of rape, the father is written — for it is juxtaposed with: "And the man who lies with her and so forth."

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: אִין בְּמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה דָּרֵישׁ, וְהָנֵי סְמוּכִין מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְאִידָךְ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל הַמְלַמֵּד לִבְנוֹ תּוֹרָה מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִלּוּ קִבְּלָהּ מֵהַר חוֹרֵב. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהוֹדַעְתָּם לְבָנֶיךָ וְלִבְנֵי בָנֶיךָ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ ״יוֹם אֲשֶׁר עָמַדְתָּ לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ בְּחוֹרֵב״.
human_translation: They replied: Indeed, in Mishne Torah does derive homiletic interpretations but these juxtaposed verses to another Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who teaches his son Torah, the verse ascribes to him as if he received from Mount Horeb. As it is stated: “And you shall impart them to your children and your children’s children” after which it is written: “The day that you stood before the Lord your God at Horeb.”
llm_translation: They said: In the Mishnah Torah, it does not expound, and these are the ones who seek to know the other opinion of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. For Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Anyone who teaches his son Torah, it is accounted to him as if he received it from Mount Horeb. As it is stated: "And you shall make known to your sons and to your sons' sons," and it is written thereafter: "The day that you stood before the Lord your God at Horeb."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן זָב שֶׁרָאָה קֶרִי, וְנִדָּה שֶׁפָּלְטָה שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע, הַמְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת וְרָאֲתָה דָּם, צְרִיכִין טְבִילָה. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: We learned a zav who experienced a seminal emission, and a menstruating woman who discharged semen, and a woman who engaged in intercourse and she saw blood, require ritual immersion And Rabbi Yehuda exempts
llm_translation: We learned: A man who emitted semen due to a discharge, and a woman who had a seminal emission, who engaged in sexual intercourse and saw blood, require immersion. And Rabbi Yehuda exempts.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן לֹא פָּטַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֶלָּא בְּזָב שֶׁרָאָה קֶרִי, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לָאו בַּר טְבִילָה הוּא, אֲבָל בַּעַל קֶרִי גְּרֵידָא מְחַיַּיב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda only exempted of a zav who experienced a seminal emission, who was unfit to immerse himself from the outset, But, one who experienced a seminal emission alone, requires
llm_translation: Until this point, Rabbi Yehuda only exempted in the case of a Zav who saw a seminal emission, for initially it is not a matter of immersion, but in the case of a Baal Keri, a different stringency is required.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ בַּעַל קֶרִי גְּרֵידָא נָמֵי פָּטַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְהַאי דְּקָא מִפַּלְּגִי בְּזָב שֶׁרָאָה קֶרִי — לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן דְּרַבָּנַן. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: הַמְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת וְרָאֲתָה דָּם — צְרִיכָה טְבִילָה.
human_translation: And if you say: The same is true even one who experienced a seminal emission alone, Rabbi Yehuda also exempts and the fact that they disagree a zav who experienced a seminal emission is in order to convey the far-reaching of the Rabbis, say the last case A woman who was engaged in intercourse and she saw blood requires immersion.
llm_translation: And if you will say: Is it the same that even a Ba'al Keri, a Greida, Rabbi Yehuda exempts, and this one who is distinguishing in the case of a Zav who saw Keri — to inform you of the power of the Rabbis. Say the latter part: One who menstruates and sees blood — requires immersion.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן קָתָנֵי לַהּ? אִילֵּימָא לְרַבָּנַן — פְּשִׁיטָא! הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה זָב שֶׁרָאָה קֶרִי — דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לָאו בַּר טְבִילָה הוּא, מְחַיְּיבִי רַבָּנַן; הַמְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת וְרָאֲתָה דָּם — דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא בַּת טְבִילָה הִיא, לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?! אֶלָּא לָאו רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וְדַוְקָא קָתָנֵי לַהּ,
human_translation: In accordance with whose was this taught? If you say the Rabbis, that is obvious; if a zav who experienced a seminal emission who was unfit to immerse himself from the outset, the Rabbis require immersion, all the more so a woman who engaged in intercourse and saw blood, was fit to immerse herself from the outset, Rather, isn’t this Rabbi Yehuda’s and was taught specifically
llm_translation: To whom does he teach this? If you say to the Rabbis - it is obvious! Now, if a man who had a seminal emission saw a discharge - from the outset he is not in a state of ritual purity, the Rabbis would obligate him; if a woman who had relations and saw blood - from the outset she is in a state of ritual purity, all the more so! Rather, it is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, and specifically he teaches it to her.

hebrew_text: מְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת וְרָאֲתָה נִדָּה — אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה טְבִילָה, אֲבָל בַּעַל קֶרִי גְּרֵידָא — מְחַיַּיב. לָא תֵּימָא ״מְבָרֵךְ״, אֶלָּא מְהַרְהֵר.
human_translation: a woman who engaged in intercourse and saw menstrual is not required to immerse herself, but one who experienced a seminal emission alone, is required to do so? Do not say recites a blessing one contemplates
llm_translation: Engaging in marital relations with a menstruating woman and seeing a woman who is a niddah - she does not require immersion, but one who experiences a seminal emission involuntarily - is obligated. Do not say "blesses," rather "contemplates."

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִרְהוּר? וְהָתַנְיָא: בַּעַל קֶרִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מַיִם לִטְבּוֹל — קוֹרֵא קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע, וְאֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ, לֹא לְפָנֶיהָ וְלֹא לְאַחֲרֶיהָ. וְאוֹכֵל פִּתּוֹ וּמְבָרֵךְ לְאַחֲרֶיהָ, וְאֵינוֹ מְבָרֵךְ לְפָנֶיהָ. אֲבָל מְהַרְהֵר בְּלִבּוֹ וְאֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא בִּשְׂפָתָיו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ מוֹצִיא בִּשְׂפָתָיו.
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yehuda maintain that contemplating Wasn’t it taught One who experienced a seminal emission and who has no water to immerse recites Shema and neither recites the blessings beforehand nor thereafter? And he eats his bread, he recites the blessing thereafter, but does not recite the blessing: beforehand. However, he contemplates in his heart rather than utter with his lips, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: In either case, he utters with his lips.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And does Rabbi Yehuda hold of a mental intention? And it was taught: One who has a seminal emission and has no water to immerse - he recites the Shema but does not recite a blessing, neither before it nor after it. And he eats his bread and recites a blessing after it, but does not recite a blessing before it. However, if he mentally intends in his heart and does not articulate with his lips, these are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: In either case, he articulates with his lips." English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: עֲשָׂאָן רַבִּי יְהוּדָה כְּהִלְכוֹת דֶּרֶךְ אֶרֶץ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Rabbi Yehuda rendered like Hilkhot Derekh Eretz ,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said: Rabbi Yehuda made them according to the ways of proper conduct.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְהוֹדַעְתָּם לְבָנֶיךָ וְלִבְנֵי בָנֶיךָ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ ״יוֹם אֲשֶׁר עָמַדְתָּ לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ בְּחוֹרֵב״, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּאֵימָה וּבְיִרְאָה וּבִרְתֵת וּבְזִיעַ, אַף כָּאן בְּאֵימָה וּבְיִרְאָה וּבִרְתֵת וּבְזִיעַ.
human_translation: As it was taught “And you shall impart them to your children and your children’s children” and it is written thereafter: “The day that you stood before the Lord your God at Horeb” Just as below, in reverence, fear, quaking, and trembling, so too here, reverence, fear, quaking, and trembling.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught: "And you shall make them known to your children and your children's children," and it is written afterwards: "The day that you stood before the Lord your God at Horeb." Just as there, with trembling, fear, dread, and perspiration, so too here, with trembling, fear, dread, and perspiration.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: הַזָּבִים וְהַמְצֹרָעִים וּבָאִין עַל נִדּוֹת — מוּתָּרִים לִקְרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה וּבַנְּבִיאִים וּבַכְּתוּבִים, לִשְׁנוֹת בַּמִּשְׁנָה וּגְמָרָא וּבָהֲלָכוֹת וּבָאַגָּדוֹת. אֲבָל בַּעֲלֵי קְרָיִין אֲסוּרִים.
human_translation: From here stated: Zavim , lepers, and those who engaged in intercourse with menstruating women, are permitted to read the Torah, Prophets, and Writings, and to study Mishna and Gemara and halakhot and aggada . However, those who experienced a seminal emission are prohibited
llm_translation: From here they said: Those with a discharge, lepers, and those who have had seminal emissions are permitted to read the Torah, the Prophets, and the Writings, to study Mishnah, Gemara, Halakhot, and Aggadot. But those who have nocturnal emissions are forbidden.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: שׁוֹנֶה הוּא בָּרְגִילִיּוֹת, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַצִּיעַ אֶת הַמִּשְׁנָה. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן יוֹסֵף אוֹמֵר: מַצִּיעַ הוּא אֶת הַמִּשְׁנָה, וְאֵינוֹ מַצִּיעַ אֶת הַגְּמָרָא. רַבִּי נָתָן בֶּן אֲבִישָׁלוֹם אוֹמֵר: אַף מַצִּיעַ אֶת הַגְּמָרָא, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר אַזְכָּרוֹת שֶׁבּוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הַסַּנְדְּלָר תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא יִכָּנֵס לַמִּדְרָשׁ כׇּל עִיקָּר. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: לֹא יִכָּנֵס לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ כׇּל עִיקָּר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שׁוֹנֶה הוּא בְּהִלְכוֹת דֶּרֶךְ אֶרֶץ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: studies accustomed as long as he does not expound upon a mishna Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef says: He expounds upon the mishna but he does not expound upon the Gemara, Rabbi Natan ben Avishalom says: He may even expound upon the Gemara, as long as he does not utter mentions therein. Rabbi Yoḥanan the Cobbler, Rabbi Akiva’s student, says in the name of Rabbi Akiva: may not enter into homiletic interpretation [ midrash ] at all. Some say He may not enter the study hall [ beit hamidrash ] at all. Rabbi Yehuda says: He may study Hilkhot Derekh Eretz .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: He should review in the mornings, but only without reciting the Mishnah. Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef says: He should recite the Mishnah, but not the Gemara. Rabbi Natan ben Avishalom says: He should even recite the Gemara, but without mentioning the mnemonic devices within it. Rabbi Yochanan the Sandal-maker, a disciple of Rabbi Akiva, in the name of Rabbi Akiva says: One should not enter the study hall at all. And some say: One should not enter the house of study at all. Rabbi Yehuda says: He should review the laws of proper conduct.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁרָאָה קֶרִי, וְהָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ עַל גַּב הַנָּהָר. אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו: רַבֵּינוּ, שְׁנֵה לָנוּ פֶּרֶק אֶחָד בְּהִלְכוֹת דֶּרֶךְ אֶרֶץ. יָרַד וְטָבַל וְשָׁנָה לָהֶם. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא כָּךְ לִמַּדְתָּנוּ רַבֵּינוּ, שׁוֹנֶה הוּא בְּהִלְכוֹת דֶּרֶךְ אֶרֶץ?! אָמַר לָהֶם: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמֵּיקֵל אֲנִי עַל אֲחֵרִים, מַחְמִיר אֲנִי עַל עַצְמִי.
human_translation: an incident involving Rabbi Yehuda experienced a seminal emission and was walking along the riverbank His disciples said to him: Rabbi, teach us a chapter from Hilkhot Derekh Eretz , He descended and immersed himself and taught them They said to him: Did you not teach us, our teacher, that he may study Hilkhot Derekh Eretz ? He said to them: Although I am lenient with others, I am stringent with myself.
llm_translation: The story of Rabbi Yehuda who saw a seminal emission, and was walking along the riverbank. His disciples said to him: Our teacher, teach us one chapter in the laws of proper conduct. He descended, immersed, and taught them. They said to him: Is this how you taught us, our teacher, to be lenient in the laws of proper conduct?! He said to them: Even though I am lenient with others, I am strict with myself.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא הָיָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מְקַבְּלִין טוּמְאָה. מַעֲשֶׂה בְּתַלְמִיד אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה מְגַמְגֵּם לְמַעְלָה מֵרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא. אָמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנִי, פְּתַח פִּיךָ וְיָאִירוּ דְבָרֶיךָ, שֶׁאֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מְקַבְּלִין טוּמְאָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲלֹא כֹה דְבָרִי כָּאֵשׁ נְאֻם ה׳״, מָה אֵשׁ אֵינוֹ מְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה אַף דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה אֵינָן מְקַבְּלִין טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: it was taught Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira would say: Matters of Torah do not become ritually impure an incident involving a student who was hesitantly before Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira. said to him: My son, open your mouth and let your words illuminate, as matters of Torah do not become ritually impure, as it is stated: “Is not my word like fire, says the Lord” Just as fire does not become ritually impure, so too matters of Torah do not become ritually impure.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira would say: The words of Torah do not accept impurity. There was an incident involving a certain disciple who was murmuring above Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira. He said to him: My son, open your mouth and let your words shine forth, for the words of Torah do not accept impurity, as it is stated: "Is not My word like fire, says the Lord" (Jeremiah 23:29). Just as fire does not accept impurity, so too the words of Torah do not accept impurity.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר. מַצִּיעַ אֶת הַמִּשְׁנָה וְאֵינוֹ מַצִּיעַ אֶת הַגְּמָרָא. מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אִלְעַאי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אִלְעַאי אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב מִשּׁוּם רַבֵּינוּ: הֲלָכָה, מַצִּיעַ אֶת הַמִּשְׁנָה וְאֵינוֹ מַצִּיעַ אֶת הַגְּמָרָא. כְּתַנָּאֵי: מַצִּיעַ אֶת הַמִּשְׁנָה וְאֵינוֹ מַצִּיעַ אֶת הַגְּמָרָא, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: זֶה וָזֶה אָסוּר. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: זֶה וָזֶה מוּתָּר.
human_translation: the Master said expounds upon the mishna but does not expound upon the Gemara. supports Rabbi El’ai, Rabbi El’ai said Rabbi Aḥa bar Ya’akov said in the name of Rabbeinu, : The may expound upon the mishna but may not expound upon the Gemara. is parallel a tannaitic expounds upon the mishna but does not expound upon the Gemara; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel: this and that are prohibited. And some say this and that are permitted.
llm_translation: The Master said: One may propose the Mishnah but may not propose the Gemara. He supports this with the teaching of Rabbi Ilai, for Rabbi Ilai said in the name of Rabbi Acha bar Yaakov in the name of our teacher: Halacha, one may propose the Mishnah but may not propose the Gemara. It was taught in a Baraita: One may propose the Mishnah but may not propose the Gemara, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel: Both this and that are forbidden. And some say: Both this and that are permitted.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר זֶה וָזֶה אָסוּר — כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הַסַּנְדְּלָר, מַאן דְּאָמַר זֶה וָזֶה מוּתָּר — כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא.
human_translation: The one who said this and that are prohibited in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan the Cobbler; the one who said this and that are permitted in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira.
llm_translation: The one who says this and that is forbidden - like Rabbi Yochanan the Sandal-maker. The one who says this and that is permitted - like Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: נְהוּג עָלְמָא כְּהָנֵי תְּלָת סָבֵי — כְּרַבִּי אִלְעַאי בְּרֵאשִׁית הַגֵּז, כְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה בְּכִלְאַיִם, כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: The universally practice is in accordance with these three elders: In accordance with Rabbi El’ai with regard to the first shearing, in accordance with Rabbi Yoshiya with regard to diverse kinds, in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira with regard to matters of Torah.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: The world is accustomed like the priests of three elders - like Rabbi Ilai in the beginning of shearing, like Rabbi Yoshiyah in the kidneys, like Rabbi Yehudah ben Beteira in matters of Torah.

hebrew_text: כְּרַבִּי אִלְעַאי בְּרֵאשִׁית הַגֵּז — דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אִלְעַאי אוֹמֵר: רֵאשִׁית הַגֵּז אֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג אֶלָּא בָּאָרֶץ.
human_translation: In accordance with Rabbi El’ai with regard to the first shearing, as it was taught Rabbi El’ai says: the first shearing is only practiced in Eretz
llm_translation: As Rabbi Elai said regarding the beginning of shearing - as it was taught, Rabbi Elai says: The beginning of shearing is only practiced in the land.

hebrew_text: כְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה בְּכִלְאַיִם, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״לֹא תִזְרַע כַּרְמְךָ כִּלְאָיִם״, רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּזְרַע חִטָּה וּשְׂעוֹרָה וְחַרְצָן בְּמַפּוֹלֶת יָד.
human_translation: In accordance with Rabbi Yoshiya with regard to diverse kinds, as it is written: “You shall not sow your vineyard with diverse kinds” Rabbi Yoshiya says: one is not liable until he sows wheat and barley and a pit with a single hand motion,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yoshiyah in Kil'ayim, as it is written: "You shall not sow your vineyard with diverse seeds." Rabbi Yoshiyah says: One is never liable until he sows wheat, barley, and spelt in a handbreadth's depth.

hebrew_text: כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה מְקַבְּלִין טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: In accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira with regard to matters of Torah, as it was taught Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: Matters of Torah do not become ritually impure.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yehudah ben Betera said regarding matters of Torah, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehudah ben Betera says, "The words of Torah do not accept impurity."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא זְעֵירִי, אֲמַר: בַּטְּלוּהָ לִטְבִילוּתָא. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: בַּטְּלוּהָ לִנְטִילוּתָא. מַאן דְּאָמַר בַּטְּלוּהָ לִטְבִילוּתָא — כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא. מַאן דְּאָמַר בַּטְּלוּהָ לִנְטִילוּתָא — כִּי הָא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא לָיֵיט אַמַּאן דִּמְהַדַּר אַמַּיָּא בְּעִידָּן צְלוֹתָא.
human_translation: When Ze’iri came he said: They abolished ritual immersion, and some say that They abolished ritual washing of the hands. The one who says they abolished immersion Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira And the one who says they abolished washing of the hands in accordance with that which Rav Ḥisda cursed one who to seek water at the time of prayer.
llm_translation: When Zeiri came, he said: "It is nullified for immersion." And some say: "It is nullified for washing." The one who said it is nullified for immersion is like Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira. The one who said it is nullified for washing is because of what Rav Hisda said, to bring water to one who is in a time of need.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בַּעַל קֶרִי שֶׁנָּתְנוּ עָלָיו תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין מַיִם — טָהוֹר. נַחוּם אִישׁ גַּם זוֹ לְחָשָׁהּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְחָשָׁהּ לְבֶן עַזַּאי, וּבֶן עַזַּאי יָצָא וּשְׁנָאָהּ לְתַלְמִידָיו בְּשׁוּק. פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ תְּרֵי אָמוֹרָאֵי בְּמַעְרְבָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר זְבִידָא. חַד תָּנֵי: שְׁנָאָהּ, וְחַד תָּנֵי: לְחָשָׁהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who experienced a seminal emission who had nine kav of water poured over him, ritually pure Naḥum of Gam Zo whispered Rabbi Akiva, and Rabbi Akiva whispered it to ben Azzai, and ben Azzai went out and taught it to his students in the marketplace. Two amora’im in Eretz Yisrael, Rabbi Yosei bar Avin and Rabbi Yosei bar Zevida, disagreed One taught: taught it And the other taught: Ben Azzai whispered it
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If a person with a seminal emission had nine kav of water poured upon him - he is pure. Nahum Ish Gam Zo whispered it to Rabbi Akiva, and Rabbi Akiva whispered it to Ben Azzai, and Ben Azzai went out and taught it to his students in the marketplace. Two Amoraim in the West disagreed about it, Rabbi Yosei bar Avin and Rabbi Yosei bar Zevida. One taught: he taught it, and one taught: he whispered it.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּתָנֵי שְׁנָאָהּ, מִשּׁוּם בִּטּוּל תּוֹרָה וּמִשּׁוּם בִּטּוּל פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה. וּמַאן דְּתָנֵי לְחָשָׁהּ — שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מְצוּיִים אֵצֶל נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶם כְּתַרְנְגוֹלִים.
human_translation: The who taught taught due to dereliction of Torah. also due to the suspension of procreation, And the who taught whispered in order that Torah scholars would not be with their wives like roosters.
llm_translation: One who teaches his daughter, it is due to neglect of Torah and due to neglect of procreation. And one who teaches her in secret - the students of the sages should not be found near their wives like roosters.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁמְּקִילִּין בָּהּ וְשָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁמַּחֲמִירִין בָּהּ, וְכׇל הַמַּחֲמִיר בָּהּ עַל עַצְמוֹ מַאֲרִיכִין לוֹ יָמָיו וּשְׁנוֹתָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: I heard that there are those who are lenient with regard to it and I have heard that there are those who are stringent with regard to it. and anyone who upon himself to be stringent with regard to it, they prolong for him his days and years.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: I heard that they are lenient with it, and I heard that they are stringent with it, and anyone who is stringent with it upon himself, they prolong his days and years.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מַה טִּיבָן שֶׁל טוֹבְלֵי שְׁחָרִין? מַה טִּיבָן?! הָא אִיהוּ דְּאָמַר בַּעַל קֶרִי אָסוּר בְּדִבְרֵי תּוֹרָה. הָכִי קָאָמַר: מַה טִּיבָן בְּאַרְבָּעִים סְאָה, אֶפְשָׁר בְּתִשְׁעָה קַבִּין. מַה טִּיבָן בִּטְבִילָה, אֶפְשָׁר בִּנְתִינָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is the essence of those who immerse themselves in the morning? what is their essence? Isn’t he who said one who experiences a seminal emission is prohibited from matters of Torah this is he say: What is the essence of forty se’a it is possible with nine kav ? what is the essence of immersion it is possible pouring
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is the goodness of those who immerse at dawn? What is their goodness?! This is because the one who has emitted semen is forbidden by the words of the Torah. This is what he is saying: What is their goodness in forty se'ah, it is possible with nine kav. What is their goodness in immersion, it is possible with giving.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: גָּדֵר גָּדוֹל גָּדְרוּ בָּהּ. דְּתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁתָּבַע אִשָּׁה לִדְבַר עֲבֵירָה. אָמְרָה לוֹ: רֵיקָא! יֵשׁ לְךָ אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה שֶׁאַתָּה טוֹבֵל בָּהֶן? מִיָּד פֵּירַשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: They established a massive fence As it was taught an incident involving one who solicited a woman to a sinful act. She said to him: Good-for-nothing. Do you have forty se’a in which to immerse yourself immediately desisted.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: They fenced a great fence around it. As it was taught: There was an incident with a man who desired to engage in a sinful act. She said to him: Empty one! Do you have forty se'ah that you immerse in? Immediately he refrained.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב הוּנָא לְרַבָּנָן: רַבּוֹתַי, מִפְּנֵי מָה אַתֶּם מְזַלְזְלִין בִּטְבִילָה זוֹ: אִי מִשּׁוּם צִינָּה, אֶפְשָׁר בְּמֶרְחֲצָאוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Huna said to the Sages: Gentlemen, why do you disdain this immersion? If it is because cold it is possible bathhouses,
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Huna said to the Rabbis: My masters, why do you belittle this immersion? If it is because of coldness, it is possible in hot baths.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: וְכִי יֵשׁ טְבִילָה בְּחַמִּין? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה קָאֵי כְּווֹתָךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥisda said to him: Is there ritual immersion in hot water? said to him: Rav Adda bar Ahava holds in accordance with your
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ḥisda: Is there immersion in hot water? He said to him: Rav Adda bar Ahava stands by your side.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא הֲוָה יָתֵיב בְּאַגָּנָא דְמַיָּא בֵּי מַסּוּתָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: זִיל וְאַיְיתִי לִי תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין וּשְׁדִי עִלָּוַאי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: לְמָה לֵיהּ לְמָר כּוּלֵּי הַאי? וְהָא יָתֵיב בְּגַוַּויְיהוּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּאַרְבָּעִים סְאָה, מָה אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה, בִּטְבִילָה וְלֹא בִּנְתִינָה — אַף תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין בִּנְתִינָה וְלֹא בִּטְבִילָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira was sitting in a tub of water in the bathhouse. He said to his attendant: Go and get nine kav and pour over me Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said to him: Why does my master all of this? Aren’t you seated in He said to him: parallels forty se’a , Just as forty se’a immersion and not through pouring, so too nine kav through pouring and not through immersion.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira was sitting in the bathhouse of Maia in the town of Masuta, he said to his attendant: "Go and bring me nine kav of wheat and place them on my shoulders." Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said to him: "Why does the master need all this?" But he was sitting in their midst! He said to him: "Just as forty se'ah require immersion and not donation, so too nine kav require donation and not immersion."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן תַּקֵּן חַצְבָּא בַּת תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין. כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אֲמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה גְּלוֹסְטְרָא אָמְרוּ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְחוֹלֶה לְאוֹנְסוֹ. אֲבָל לְחוֹלֶה הַמַּרְגִּיל, אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman prepared a jug of nine kav When Rav Dimi came he said: Rabbi Akiva and Rabbi Yehuda Gelostera said: was only taught for a sick person involuntarily. However, a sick person normal forty se’a .
llm_translation: Rav Nachman established a measure of a half a bat for a nine-kav vessel. When Rav Dimi came, he said that Rabbi Akiva and Rabbi Yehuda the Glassmaker said: They only taught this regarding a sick person or one under duress. But for a habitual sick person, forty se'ah.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אִתְּבַר חַצְבֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן. כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אֲמַר בְּאוּשָׁא הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Rav Naḥman’s jug is broken, when Ravin came he said: In Usha there was an incident
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: The son of Rav Nachman's daughter was born. When Ravin came, he said, "There was a matter in Usha."

hebrew_text: בְּקִילְעָא דְּרַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא, אֲתוֹ וּשְׁאִלוּ לְרַב אַסִּי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְחוֹלֶה הַמַּרְגִּיל, אֲבָל לְחוֹלֶה לְאוֹנְסוֹ פָּטוּר מִכְּלוּם. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אִצְטְמִיד חַצְבֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן.
human_translation: that in Rav Oshaya’s chamber, they came and asked Rav Asi. He said to them: They only stated with regard to a sick person who experienced a normal but a sick person who experienced an involuntary exempt from anything Rav Yosef said: Rav Naḥman’s jug is rejoined,
llm_translation: In the attic of Rav Oshaya, they came and asked Rav Assi. He said to them: They only taught this regarding a habitual sick person, but for one who is sick due to circumstances beyond his control, he is exempt from everything. Rav Yosef said: The axe of Rav Nachman is sharp.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי כּוּלְּהוּ אָמוֹרָאֵי וְתַנָּאֵי בִּדְעֶזְרָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, וְנֶחְזֵי עֶזְרָא הֵיכִי תַּקֵּן.
human_translation: Since all amora’im and tanna’im disagree with regard to Ezra, let us examine how Ezra instituted
llm_translation: From all the Amoraim and Tannaim in the study hall of Ezra, there was a dispute, and they saw: How did Ezra rectify it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: עֶזְרָא תַּקֵּן לְבָרִיא הַמַּרְגִּיל אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה, וּבָרִיא לְאוֹנְסוֹ תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין. וַאֲתוֹ אָמוֹרָאֵי וּפְלִיגִי בְּחוֹלֶה. מָר סָבַר חוֹלֶה הַמַּרְגִּיל כְּבָרִיא הַמַּרְגִּיל וְחוֹלֶה לְאוֹנְסוֹ כְּבָרִיא לְאוֹנְסוֹ. וּמַר סָבַר חוֹלֶה הַמַּרְגִּיל כְּבָרִיא לְאוֹנְסוֹ, וְחוֹלֶה לְאוֹנְסוֹ פָּטוּר מִכְּלוּם.
human_translation: Abaye said: Ezra instituted a healthy person who experienced a normal forty se’a , while for a healthy person involuntary nine kav And the amora’im came and disagreed with regard to a sick person. One Sage held a sick person who experienced a normal like a healthy person who experienced a normal while a sick person involuntary like a healthy person involuntary However, another Sage maintained a sick person who experienced a normal like a healthy person involuntary while a sick person involuntary is exempt from any
llm_translation: Abaye said: Ezra established for a healthy person who is accustomed to eating, forty se'ah, and for a sick person, nine kav. And the Amoraim came and disputed in the case of an ill person. Mar holds that a sick person who is accustomed to eating is like a healthy person who is accustomed to eating, and a sick person in his distress is like a healthy person in his distress. And Mar holds that a sick person who is accustomed to eating is like a healthy person in his distress, and a sick person in his distress is exempt from everything.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: נְהִי דְּתַקֵּן עֶזְרָא טְבִילָה, נְתִינָה מִי תַּקֵּן?! וְהָאָמַר מָר עֶזְרָא תִּקֵּן טְבִילָה לְבַעֲלֵי קְרָיִין. אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: עֶזְרָא תַּקֵּן טְבִילָה לְבָרִיא הַמַּרְגִּיל אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה. וַאֲתוֹ רַבָּנַן וְהַתְקִינוּ לְבָרִיא לְאוֹנְסוֹ תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין. וַאֲתוֹ אָמוֹרָאֵי וְקָא מִיפַּלְגִי בְּחוֹלֶה, מָר סָבַר חוֹלֶה הַמַּרְגִּיל כְּבָרִיא הַמַּרְגִּיל, וְחוֹלֶה לְאוֹנְסוֹ — כְּבָרִיא לְאוֹנְסוֹ, וּמַר סָבַר לְבָרִיא הַמַּרְגִּיל אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה, וְחוֹלֶה הַמַּרְגִּיל כְּבָרִיא לְאוֹנְסוֹ — תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין. אֲבָל לְחוֹלֶה לְאוֹנְסוֹ פָּטוּר מִכְּלוּם.
human_translation: Rava said: Although Ezra instituted immersion did he institute the pouring kav ? Didn’t the Master say Ezra instituted immersion for those who experienced a seminal emission? Rather, Rava said: Ezra instituted immersion in forty se’a for a healthy person who experienced a normal And the Sages came and instituted that a healthy person who experienced an involuntary nine kav And the amora’im came and disagreed a sick person; one Sage held a sick person who experienced a normal like a healthy person who experienced a normal while a sick person involuntary like a healthy person involuntary another Sage maintained a healthy person who experienced a normal forty se’a while a sick person who experienced a normal like a healthy person involuntary nine kav . But a sick person involuntary is exempt from any
llm_translation: Rava said: When Ezra instituted immersion, who instituted the giving of the water for immersion? But didn't Mar say: Ezra instituted immersion for those who have seminal emissions? Rather, Rava said: Ezra instituted immersion for a healthy person who regularly consumes forty se'ah. The Rabbis came and instituted for a healthy person who is forced to have intercourse nine kav. The Amoraim came and disputed regarding a sick person: one Master holds that a sick person who regularly consumes forty se'ah is like a healthy person who regularly consumes forty se'ah, and a sick person who is forced to have intercourse is like a healthy person who is forced to have intercourse. And the other Master holds that a healthy person who regularly consumes forty se'ah, and a sick person who regularly consumes forty se'ah is like a healthy person who is forced to have intercourse, which is nine kav. However, a sick person who is forced to have intercourse is exempt from everything.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא הִלְכְתָא: בָּרִיא הַמַּרְגִּיל וְחוֹלֶה הַמַּרְגִּיל — אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה. וּבָרִיא לְאוֹנְסוֹ — תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין. אֲבָל לְחוֹלֶה לְאוֹנְסוֹ — פָּטוּר מִכְּלוּם.
human_translation: Rava stated the A healthy person a normal and a sick person a normal forty se’a , while a healthy person an involuntary nine kav . But a sick person an involuntary is exempt from any
llm_translation: Rava said: The halakha is as follows: A healthy person who is accustomed to drinking wine and a sick person who is accustomed to drinking wine — forty se'ah. And a healthy person against his will — nine kav. But a sick person against his will — exempt from everything.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בַּעַל קֶרִי שֶׁנָּתְנוּ עָלָיו תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין מַיִם — טָהוֹר. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — לְעַצְמוֹ, אֲבָל לַאֲחֵרִים אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who experienced a seminal emission and had nine kav of water poured over him is ritually pure. In what is this statement said? for himself, but to others, forty se’a . Rabbi Yehuda says: Forty se’a in any case.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Regarding a man who had a seminal emission and nine kav of water were poured on him - he is pure. In what case are these words said? - for himself, but for others, forty se'ah. Rabbi Yehuda says: Forty se'ah in any case.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. חַד מֵהַאי זוּגָא וְחַד מֵהַאי זוּגָא אַרֵישָׁא, חַד אָמַר: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים לְעַצְמוֹ, אֲבָל לַאֲחֵרִים אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה, לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְחוֹלֶה הַמַּרְגִּיל, אֲבָל לְחוֹלֶה לְאוֹנְסוֹ תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין. וְחַד אָמַר: כׇּל לַאֲחֵרִים, אֲפִילּוּ חוֹלֶה לְאוֹנְסוֹ עַד דְּאִיכָּא אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, and Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina. One of this pair and one of that pair with regard to the first clause One said: That which you said: In what is this statement said? for himself, but to others, forty se’a , only taught regarding a sick person who experienced a normal but for a sick person involuntary nine kav And one said anyone others, even sick involuntary until there are forty se’a .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi and Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina. One of this pair and one of that pair at first. One said: That which you said, in what case are these words spoken for themselves, but for others forty se'ah, they only taught this regarding a habitual patient, but for a patient in danger, nine kav. And one said: All for others, even for a patient in danger until there are forty se'ah.

hebrew_text: וְחַד מֵהַאי זוּגָא וְחַד מֵהַאי זוּגָא אַסֵּיפָא. חַד אָמַר: הָא דְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה מִכׇּל מָקוֹם — לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּקַרְקַע, אֲבָל בְּכֵלִים — לֹא. וְחַד אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בְּכֵלִים נָמֵי.
human_translation: And one of this pair and one of that pair with regard to the latter clause One said: That which Rabbi Yehuda said: Forty se’a in any case, was only taught when the ground, but not in vessels. And one said: Even in vessels
llm_translation: One of these pairs and one of these pairs in the end. One said: This that Rabbi Yehuda said forty se'ah from any place - he only said regarding the ground, but in vessels - no. And one said: Even in vessels also.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֲפִילּוּ בְּכֵלִים — הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה מִכׇּל מָקוֹם״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּקַרְקַע — אִין, בְּכֵלִים — לָא, ״מִכׇּל מָקוֹם״ לְאֵתוּיֵי מַאי?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said even in vessels. That is taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: Forty se’a in any case. However, the one who said in the ground, yes, in vessels, no, what in any case to include?
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says even with vessels — that is what Rabbi Yehuda teaches: "Forty se'ah from any place." But according to the one who says with the ground — no, with vessels — no, "from any place" — what does it come to include?

hebrew_text: לְאֵתוּיֵי מַיִם שְׁאוּבִין.
human_translation: to include drawn water,
llm_translation: For the purposes of drawing water.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרָבָא בְּרַבִּי בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל כְּרִיכוּ רִיפְתָּא בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב פָּפָּא: הַבוּ לִי לְדִידִי לִבְרוֹךְ, דִּנְפוּל עִילָּוַאי תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין. אֲמַר לְהוּ רָבָא בְּרַבִּי בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: תְּנֵינָא, בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — לְעַצְמוֹ, אֲבָל לַאֲחֵרִים — אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה. אֶלָּא, הַבוּ לִי לְדִידִי לִבְרוֹךְ, דִּנְפוּל עִילָּוַאי אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב הוּנָא: הַבוּ לִי לְדִידִי לִבְרוֹךְ, דְּלֵיכָּא עִילָּוַאי לָא הַאי וְלָא הַאי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, and Rava bar Shmuel ate bread together. Rav Pappa said to them: Allow me to recite nine kav fell upon me; Rava bar Shmuel said to them: We learned, in what is this statement said? for himself. But, to others, forty se’a . Rather, allow me to recite as forty se’a fell upon me; Rav Huna said to them: Allow me to recite as I have neither this nor that upon me
llm_translation: Rav Papa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, and Rava, son of Rabbi Bar Shmuel, were reclining together. Rav Papa said to them: "Give me for myself a blessing, for my upper garment fell nine kav." Rava, son of Rabbi Bar Shmuel, said to them: "We have learned: when it comes to oneself, it is forty se'ah, but for others, it is only forty se'ah. Rather, give me for myself a blessing, for my upper garment fell forty se'ah." Rav Huna said: "Give me for myself a blessing, for there is no upper garment for this one or that one."

hebrew_text: רַב חָמָא טָבֵיל בְּמַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְפִסְחָא לְהוֹצִיא רַבִּים יְדֵי חוֹבָתָן. וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥama would immerse himself on Passover eve in order to fulfill the obligations of the masses. The halakha is not in accordance with his
llm_translation: Rav Hama immersed on the eve of Passover to exempt many from their obligation. And the halakha is not in accordance with his opinion.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיָה עוֹמֵד בִּתְפִלָּה וְנִזְכַּר שֶׁהוּא בַּעַל קֶרִי, לֹא יַפְסִיק, אֶלָּא יְקַצֵּר.
human_translation: One who was standing in prayer and he recalled that he experienced a seminal emission, not interrupt rather he should abridge
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one was standing in prayer and remembered that he is experiencing a seminal emission, he should not interrupt but should shorten his prayer.

hebrew_text: יָרַד לִטְבּוֹל, אִם יָכוֹל לַעֲלוֹת וּלְהִתְכַּסּוֹת וְלִקְרוֹת עַד שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה — יַעֲלֶה וְיִתְכַּסֶּה וְיִקְרָא, וְאִם לָאו — יִתְכַּסֶּה בְּמַיִם וְיִקְרָא. וְלֹא יִתְכַּסֶּה לֹא בַּמַּיִם הָרָעִים וְלֹא בְּמֵי הַמִּשְׁרָה, עַד שֶׁיָּטִיל לְתוֹכָן מַיִם. וְכַמָּה יַרְחִיק מֵהֶן וּמִן הַצּוֹאָה — אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: One who descended to immerse himself, if he is able to ascend, cover himself and recite before sunrise, he should ascend, cover himself, and recite and if not, cover himself in the water and recite He may not, however, cover himself in either foul water, or water soaked, until he pours water into it. And how far must one distance from and feces four cubits.
llm_translation: He descended to immerse, if he is able to ascend and cover himself and read before the sunrise — he should ascend, cover himself, and read. And if not — he should cover himself with water and read. And he should not cover himself neither with dirty water nor with water of the bathhouse, until he pours water into them. And how far should he distance himself from them and from excrement — four cubits.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיָה עוֹמֵד בִּתְפִלָּה וְנִזְכַּר שֶׁהוּא בַּעַל קֶרִי — לֹא יַפְסִיק, אֶלָּא יְקַצֵּר. הָיָה קוֹרֵא בַּתּוֹרָה וְנִזְכַּר שֶׁהוּא בַּעַל קֶרִי — אֵינוֹ מַפְסִיק וְעוֹלֶה, אֶלָּא מְגַמְגֵּם וְקוֹרֵא. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אֵין בַּעַל קֶרִי רַשַּׁאי לִקְרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה יוֹתֵר מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה פְּסוּקִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who was standing in prayer and he recalled that he experienced a seminal emission, not interrupt Rather, he should abridge. One who was reading the Torah and recalled that he experienced a seminal emission, does not interrupt but rather reads quickly Rabbi Meir says: One who experienced a seminal emission is not permitted to read more than three verses in the Torah,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If one was standing in prayer and remembered that he is experiencing a seminal emission, he should not interrupt, but should shorten his prayer. If one was reading from the Torah and remembered that he is experiencing a seminal emission, he should not interrupt and ascend from the reading, but should stammer and read. Rabbi Meir says: One who is experiencing a seminal emission is not permitted to read from the Torah more than three verses.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: הָיָה עוֹמֵד בִּתְפִלָּה וְרָאָה צוֹאָה כְּנֶגְדּוֹ — מְהַלֵּךְ לְפָנָיו עַד שֶׁיִּזְרְקֶנָּה לַאֲחוֹרָיו אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. וְהָתַנְיָא לִצְדָדִין. לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא, דְּאֶפְשָׁר, הָא, דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: It was taught in another One who was standing in prayer and he saw feces before him must walk forward until he has placed it four cubits behind him. Wasn’t it taught to the side? This is not difficult, that where it is possible while that where it is not possible
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: If one was standing in prayer and saw excrement in front of him, he should walk before it until he throws it behind him a distance of four cubits. And it was taught on the sides. It is not difficult: this case, where it is possible, and that case, where it is not possible.

hebrew_text: הָיָה מִתְפַּלֵּל וּמָצָא צוֹאָה בִּמְקוֹמוֹ, אָמַר רַבָּה: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁחָטָא — תְּפִלָּתוֹ תְּפִלָּה. מַתְקִיף לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְהָא: ״זֶבַח רְשָׁעִים תּוֹעֵבָה״! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: הוֹאִיל וְחָטָא, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהִתְפַּלֵּל — תְּפִלָּתוֹ תּוֹעֵבָה.
human_translation: One who was praying and found feces in the place Rabba said: Although he committed a transgression his prayer is a prayer Rava strongly objects to his Isn’t “The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination, Rather, Rava said: Because committed a transgression, although he prayed, his prayer is an abomination
llm_translation: He was praying and found excrement in his place, Rabba said: Even though he has sinned — his prayer is a prayer. Rava objected to him: But isn't it written: "The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination"! Rather, Rava said: Since he has sinned, even though he prayed — his prayer is an abomination.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיָה עוֹמֵד בִּתְפִלָּה וּמַיִם שׁוֹתְתִין עַל בִּרְכָּיו — פּוֹסֵק עַד שֶׁיִּכְלוּ הַמַּיִם וְחוֹזֵר וּמִתְפַּלֵּל. לְהֵיכָן חוֹזֵר? רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַב הַמְנוּנָא, חַד אָמַר חוֹזֵר לָרֹאשׁ, וְחַד אָמַר: לְמָקוֹם שֶׁפָּסַק.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who was standing in prayer when, urine is flowing on his knees, he must interrupt until the urine ceases, and then resume praying. To where does he return Rav Ḥisda and Rav Hamnuna one said: He must return to the beginning and the other said: to where he stopped.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one was standing in prayer and water was poured on his knees - he pauses until the water finishes, and then resumes praying. Where does he resume? Rav Hisda and Rav Hamnuna, one said he resumes from the beginning, and one said: to the place where he paused.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי:
human_translation: Let us say they disagree about this:
llm_translation: Let us say in this case he disagrees.

hebrew_text: מָר סָבַר: אִם שָׁהָה כְּדֵי לִגְמוֹר אֶת כּוּלָּהּ — חוֹזֵר לָרֹאשׁ. וּמַר סָבַר: לְמָקוֹם שֶׁפָּסַק.
human_translation: Sage held if delayed sufficient to complete the entire he returns to the beginning And Sage held: to the place where he stopped.
llm_translation: Master says: If one paused long enough to complete the entire task - he returns to the beginning. And Master says: He returns to the place where he stopped.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הַאי ״אִם שָׁהָה״, אִם לֹא שָׁהָה מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִם שָׁהָה כְּדֵי לִגְמוֹר אֶת כּוּלָּהּ — חוֹזֵר לָרֹאשׁ, וְהָתָם בִּדְלֹא שָׁהָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר גַּבְרָא דְחוּיָא הוּא, וְאֵין רָאוּי, וְאֵין תְּפִלָּתוֹ תְּפִלָּה. וּמַר סָבַר גַּבְרָא חַזְיָא הוּא, וּתְפִלָּתוֹ תְּפִלָּה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: that should have If he delayed If he did not delay Rather, everyone agrees that if one delayed sufficient to complete the entire he returns to the beginning And there they disagree with regard to one who did not delay As Sage holds he is a man who was disqualified, and unfit and his prayer is not prayer And Sage holds he is a man who was fit and his prayer is prayer
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: This "if he tarried" - if he did not tarry, what does it require of him? Rather, the entire world, if he tarried long enough to complete it all - he returns to the beginning. And there, where he did not tarry, they argue, for one Master holds that he is a common man and not worthy, and his prayer is not a prayer. And the other Master holds that he is a pious man, and his prayer is a prayer.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַנִּצְרָךְ לִנְקָבָיו — אַל יִתְפַּלֵּל, וְאִם הִתְפַּלֵּל — תְּפִלָּתוֹ תּוֹעֵבָה. אָמַר רַב זְבִיד וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יְהוּדָה: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִשְׁהוֹת בְּעַצְמוֹ, אֲבָל אִם יָכוֹל לִשְׁהוֹת בְּעַצְמוֹ — תְּפִלָּתוֹ תְּפִלָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who needs to relieve himself may not pray, and if he prayed, his prayer is an abomination. Rav Zevid and some say Rav Yehuda said They only taught one cannot restrain himself. But, if he can restrain himself, his prayer is a prayer
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who needs to relieve himself should not pray, and if he prayed, his prayer is an abomination. Rav Zevid said, and some say it was Rav Yehudah: They only taught this when he cannot hold himself, but if he can hold himself, his prayer is a prayer.

hebrew_text: וְעַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: עַד פַּרְסָה. אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַמַּתְנִיתָא: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — כְּשֶׁאֵין יָכוֹל לַעֲמוֹד עַל עַצְמוֹ. אֲבָל אִם יָכוֹל לַעֲמוֹד עַל עַצְמוֹ — תְּפִלָּתוֹ תְּפִלָּה. וְעַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַב זְבִיד: עַד פַּרְסָה.
human_translation: And how long Rav Sheshet said: as long as one parasang. Some teach this on the baraita : In what is this statement said? Where he is unable to restrain himself, but if he is able to restrain himself, his prayer is a prayer. And for how long? Rav Zevid said: as long as one parasang.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And until when? Rav Sheshet said: Until the heel. There is one who teaches it in a Baraita: In what case are these matters said? - When one cannot stand on his own. But if he can stand on his own - his prayer is a prayer. And until when? Rav Zevid said: Until the heel."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: הַנִּצְרָךְ לִנְקָבָיו — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִתְפַּלֵּל, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִכּוֹן לִקְרַאת אֱלֹהֶיךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: One who needs to relieve himself may not pray, because it is stated: “Prepare to greet your God, O Israel”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan: One who needs to relieve himself - behold, this one should not pray, because it is stated: "Prepare to meet your God, O Israel."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״שְׁמוֹר רַגְלְךָ כַּאֲשֶׁר תֵּלֵךְ אֶל בֵּית הָאֱלֹהִים״? שְׁמוֹר עַצְמְךָ שֶׁלֹּא תֶּחְטָא, וְאִם תֶּחְטָא — הָבֵא קׇרְבָּן לְפָנַי. ״וְקָרוֹב לִשְׁמֹעַ דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים״, אָמַר רָבָא: הֱוֵי קָרוֹב לִשְׁמוֹעַ דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁאִם חוֹטְאִים מְבִיאִים קׇרְבָּן וְעוֹשִׂים תְּשׁוּבָה. ״מִתֵּת הַכְּסִילִים זָבַח״ — אַל תְּהִי כַּכְּסִילִים שֶׁחוֹטְאִים וּמְבִיאִים קׇרְבָּן, וְאֵין עוֹשִׂים תְּשׁוּבָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: What is that which is written: “Guard your foot when you go to the house of God, guard yourself from transgression, and if you commit a transgression, bring a sacrifice before Me “And draw near and listen to the words of the wise.” Rava said: Be prepared to hearken to the words of the wise, who, if they commit a transgression, they bring a sacrifice and repent. “It is better than when fools give sacrifices,” one should not act like the fools who commit a transgression and bring a sacrifice but do not repent.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: What is the meaning of what is written: "Guard your steps when you go to the house of God"? Guard yourself so that you do not sin, and if you do sin — bring an offering before Me. "And draw near to hear the words of the wise," Rava said: Be close to hear the words of the wise, for if sinners sin, they bring an offering and do repentance. "To offer sacrifices of fools" — do not be like fools who sin and bring an offering, but do not repent.

hebrew_text: ״כִּי אֵינָם יוֹדְעִים לַעֲשׂוֹת רָע״ אִי הָכִי צַדִּיקִים נִינְהוּ! אֶלָּא, אַל תְּהִי כַּכְּסִילִים שֶׁחוֹטְאִים וּמְבִיאִים קׇרְבָּן, וְאֵינָם יוֹדְעִים אִם עַל הַטּוֹבָה הֵם מְבִיאִים, אִם עַל הָרָעָה הֵם מְבִיאִים. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: בֵּין טוֹב לְרַע אֵינָן מַבְחִינִים, וְהֵם מְבִיאִים קׇרְבָּן לְפָנַי?!
human_translation: “As they know not to do evil,” If so, they are righteous. Rather Do not be like the fools who commit a transgression and bring a sacrifice, but are unaware whether they are bringing it for the good, for the evil. the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: They cannot distinguish between good and evil and they bring a sacrifice before me?
llm_translation: "When they do not know to do evil," are they then righteous? Rather, do not be like fools who sin and bring an offering, not knowing whether they bring it for good or for evil. The Holy One, blessed be He, said: "They do not distinguish between good and evil, yet they bring an offering before Me?!"

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר: שְׁמוֹר נְקָבֶיךָ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאַתָּה עוֹמֵד בִּתְפִלָּה לְפָנַי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi and some say Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa said: Mind your orifices when you stand before me in prayer.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi and some say Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: "Guard your private parts when you stand in prayer before Me."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַנִּכְנָס לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, חוֹלֵץ תְּפִילָּיו בְּרִחוּק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וְנִכְנָס. אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא קָבוּעַ, אֲבָל בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא עֲרַאי — חוֹלֵץ, וְנִפְנֶה לְאַלְתַּר. וּכְשֶׁהוּא יוֹצֵא — מַרְחִיק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וּמַנִּיחָן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעֲשָׂאוֹ בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא קָבוּעַ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who enters a bathroom must remove his phylacteries at a distance of four cubits and enter. Rav Aḥa bar Rav Huna said Rav Sheshet said: This was only taught a regular bathroom, but a makeshift bathroom may remove defecate immediately. But when one exits he must distance himself four cubits donning he has rendered a regular bathroom.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who enters the bathroom, he removes his phylacteries at a distance of four cubits, and then enters. Rav Ahah bar Rav Huna said in the name of Rav Sheshet: They only taught this regarding a fixed bathroom, but in a temporary bathroom - he removes them and immediately turns away. And when he exits, he distances himself four cubits and then puts them on, because he made the bathroom fixed.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ שֶׁיִּכָּנֵס אָדָם בִּתְפִילִּין לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא קָבוּעַ לְהַשְׁתִּין מַיִם? רָבִינָא שָׁרֵי, רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָא אָסַר. אֲתוֹ שַׁיְילוּהּ לְרָבָא, אָמַר לְהוּ: אָסוּר — חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא יִפָּנֶה בָּהֶן. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, שֶׁמָּא יָפִיחַ בָּהֶן.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised What is one enter a regular bathroom wearing his phylacteries in order to urinate? Ravina permitted Rav Adda bar Mattana prohibited They came asked this of Rava. He said to them: It is forbidden we are concerned lest he will defecate with them Others say might will break wind with them
llm_translation: He asked them: Is it permissible for a person to enter with Tefillin into the bathroom when there is a fixed place to urinate? Ravina permits it, Rav Adda bar Matna prohibits it. They brought the question to Rava, he said to them: It is prohibited - we are concerned that he may turn his attention to them. And some say, we are concerned that he may pass wind on them.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: הַנִּכְנָס לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא קָבוּעַ חוֹלֵץ תְּפִילָּיו בְּרִחוּק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וּמַנִּיחָן בַּחַלּוֹן הַסָּמוּךְ לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וְנִכְנָס. וּכְשֶׁהוּא יוֹצֵא — מַרְחִיק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וּמַנִּיחָן, דִּבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אוֹחֲזָן בְּיָדוֹ, וְנִכְנָס. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אוֹחֲזָן בְּבִגְדוֹ, וְנִכְנָס.
human_translation: It was taught in another One who enters a regular bathroom must remove his phylacteries at a distance of four cubits, place them in the window adjacent to the public domain, and then enter. And when he exits, he must distance four cubits before donning them. the statement of Beit Shammai. Beit Hillel say: he holds them in his hand and enters. Rabbi Akiva says: He holds them in his garment and enters.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The one who enters the bathroom removes his tefillin at a distance of four cubits, and places them by the window adjacent to the public domain, and then enters. And when he exits, he moves them further away by four cubits, and places them, according to the words of Beit Shammai. Beit Hillel say: He holds them in his hand and enters. Rabbi Akiva says: He holds them in his garment and enters.

hebrew_text: בְּבִגְדוֹ סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ?! זִימְנִין מִישְׁתְּלֵי לְהוּ וְנָפְלִי! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: אוֹחֲזָן בְּבִגְדוֹ וּבְיָדוֹ, וְנִכְנָס.
human_translation: Does it enter your mind in his garment? sometimes he forgets them and fall. Rather, say: He holds them with his garment and in his hand and enters
llm_translation: In his garment, the basket of your mind?! Sometimes he hangs them up and they fall! Rather say: He holds them in his garment and in his hand, and enters.

hebrew_text: וּמַנִּיחָם בַּחוֹרִין הַסְּמוּכִים לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, וְלֹא יַנִּיחֵם בַּחוֹרִין הַסְּמוּכִים לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, שֶׁמָּא יִטְּלוּ אוֹתָם עוֹבְרֵי דְרָכִים, וְיָבֹא לִידֵי חֲשָׁד.
human_translation: And he places them in the holes adjacent to the bathroom, but he does not place them in the holes adjacent to the public domain, lest will be taken by passersby and he will come to be suspect.
llm_translation: And he places them in the free courtyard adjacent to the bathroom, and he should not place them in the free courtyard adjacent to the public domain, lest passersby take them, leading to suspicion.

hebrew_text: וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּתַלְמִיד אֶחָד שֶׁהִנִּיחַ תְּפִילָּיו בַּחוֹרִין הַסְּמוּכִים לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וּבָאת זוֹנָה אַחַת, וּנְטָלָתַן, וּבָאת לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ וְאָמְרָה: רָאוּ מַה נָּתַן לִי פְּלוֹנִי בִּשְׂכָרִי! כֵּיוָן שֶׁשָּׁמַע אוֹתוֹ תַּלְמִיד כָּךְ, עָלָה לְרֹאשׁ הַגָּג וְנָפַל וָמֵת. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהֵא אוֹחֲזָן בְּבִגְדוֹ וּבְיָדוֹ, וְנִכְנָס.
human_translation: And an incident involving a student who placed his phylacteries in the holes adjacent to the public domain, and a prostitute passed by and took She came to the study hall and said: See what so-and-so gave me as my payment. When that student heard this, he ascended to the rooftop and fell and died. At that moment they instituted that one should hold them with his garment and in his hand and enter
llm_translation: And a story about a certain disciple who left his phylacteries in the chambers adjacent to the public domain, and a certain harlot came and took them, and she went to the study hall and said: "See what so-and-so has given me for my hire!" When that disciple heard this, he went up to the roof, fell, and died. At that moment, they decreed that one should hold onto his garment and his hand, and enter.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מַנִּיחִין תְּפִילִּין בַּחוֹרִין הַסְּמוּכִים לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, וּבָאִין עַכְבָּרִים וְנוֹטְלִין אוֹתָן. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ מַנִּיחִין אוֹתָן בַּחַלּוֹנוֹת הַסְּמוּכוֹת לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים; וּבָאִין עוֹבְרֵי דְרָכִים וְנוֹטְלִין אוֹתָן. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהֵא אוֹחֲזָן בְּיָדוֹ וְנִכְנָס.
human_translation: The Sages taught At first, they would place the phylacteries in the holes adjacent to the bathroom, and mice would come and take them they instituted that they should place them in the holes adjacent to the public domain, passersby would come and take the they instituted that one should hold in his hand and enter.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Initially, they would place the phylacteries in the crevices near the toilet, and mice would come and take them. They instituted that they should be placed in the windows adjacent to the public domain, and passersby would take them. They instituted that one should hold them in his hand and then enter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי מְיָאשָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הֲלָכָה, גּוֹלְלָן כְּמִין סֵפֶר, וְאוֹחֲזָן בִּימִינוֹ כְּנֶגֶד לִבּוֹ. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא רְצוּעָה יוֹצֵאת מִתַּחַת יָדוֹ טֶפַח.
human_translation: Rabbi Meyasha, son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, said: The halakha is that one rolls up like a scroll, and holds them in his hand opposite his heart. Rav Yosef bar Manyumi said Rav Naḥman said: provided that the strap does not emerge a handbreadth below his hand.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meyasha, son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, said: The halakha is that we roll them like a scroll and hold them in our right hand opposite our heart. Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said in the name of Rav Nachman: And as long as a span of the strap does not extend beyond his hand.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַחָא אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁיֵּשׁ שְׁהוּת בְּיוֹם לְלׇבְשָׁן, אֲבָל אֵין שְׁהוּת בְּיוֹם לְלׇבְשָׁן — עוֹשֶׂה לָהֶן כְּמִין כִּיס טֶפַח, וּמַנִּיחָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Aḥa said Rabbi Zeira said: It was only taught time in the day to don them. If there is not time in the day to don them he makes a one-handbreadth pouch of sorts for them and he places them
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yaakov bar Acha said Rabbi Zeira: They did not teach except that there is a pause during the day for clothing, but there is no pause during the day for clothing - one makes for them a pouch of a handbreadth, and places them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּיּוֹם גּוֹלְלָן כְּמִין סֵפֶר וּמַנִּיחָן בְּיָדוֹ כְּנֶגֶד לִבּוֹ, וּבַלַּיְלָה עוֹשֶׂה לָהֶן כְּמִין כִּיס טֶפַח, וּמַנִּיחָן.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: During the day one rolls up like a scroll and places them in his hand opposite his heart, and at night he makes a one-handbreadth pouch of sorts for them and he places them
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: During the day, one rolls them like a scroll and places them in his hand opposite his heart, and at night, he makes them like a fist-sized pouch and places them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּכְלִי שֶׁהוּא כִּלְיָין, אֲבָל בִּכְלִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ כִּלְיָין, אֲפִילּוּ פָּחוֹת מִטֶּפַח.
human_translation: Abaye said: They only taught with regard to a vessel that is vessel, but in a vessel that is not their vessel, even less than a handbreadth.
llm_translation: Abaye said: They only stated this regarding a vessel that is like a receptacle, but with a vessel that is not like a receptacle, even less than a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב אָשֵׁי: תֵּדַע שֶׁהֲרֵי פַּכִּין קְטַנִּים מַצִּילִין בְּאֹהֶל הַמֵּת.
human_translation: Mar Zutra and, some say, Rav Ashi, said small vessels protect a tent over a corpse.
llm_translation: Master Zutra said, and some say it was Rav Ashi: Know that small cracks save in the tent of the deceased.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: כִּי הֲוָה אָזְלִינַן בָּתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, כִּי הֲוָה בָּעֵי לְמֵיעַל לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא כִּי הֲוָה נָקֵיט סִפְרָא דְאַגָּדְתָּא — הֲוָה יָהֵיב לַן, כִּי הֲוָה נָקֵיט תְּפִילִּין — לָא הֲוָה יָהֵיב לַן, אָמַר: הוֹאִיל וּשְׁרוֹנְהוּ רַבָּנַן —
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: When we would walk after Rabbi Yoḥanan, that when he sought to enter the bathroom while holding a book of aggada , he would give to us. When he was holding phylacteries, he would not give to us, he said: Since the Sages permitted them,
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: When we would go after Rabbi Yoḥanan, when he wanted to enter the restroom, when he would take a book of Aggadah — he would give it to us, but when he would take his tefillin — he would not give them to us. He said: Since the Sages have permitted them —

hebrew_text: נִינְטְרַן. אָמַר רָבָא: כִּי הֲוָה אָזְלִינַן בָּתְרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, כִּי הֲוָה נָקֵיט סִפְרָא דְאַגַּדְתָּא — יָהֵיב לַן, כִּי הֲוָה נָקֵיט תְּפִילִּין — לָא יָהֵיב לַן, אָמַר: הוֹאִיל וּשְׁרוֹנְהוּ רַבָּנַן, נִינְטְרַן.
human_translation: they will protect me. Rava said: When we would walk after Rabbi Naḥman, when he was holding a book of aggada , he would give to us. When he was holding phylacteries, he would not give to us, he said: Since the Sages permitted them, they will protect me.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Nintran. Amar Rava: Ki hava azlinan batrei deRav Nachman, ki hava naket sifra deaggadata — yahev lan, ki hava naket tefillin — la yahev lan, amar: Hoil u'shronhu rabanan, nintran." English translation: "He was interrupted. Rava said: When we would go after Rav Nachman, if he took a book of Aggadah — he would give it to us, but if he took Tefillin — he would not give it to us, he said: Since the Rabbis have examined it, it was interrupted."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לֹא יֹאחַז אָדָם תְּפִילִּין בְּיָדוֹ וְסֵפֶר תּוֹרָה בִּזְרוֹעוֹ וְיִתְפַּלֵּל. וְלֹא יַשְׁתִּין בָּהֶן מַיִם, וְלֹא יִישַׁן בָּהֶן לֹא שֵׁינַת קֶבַע וְלֹא שֵׁינַת עֲרַאי. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: סַכִּין וּמָעוֹת וּקְעָרָה וְכִכָּר, הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One may not hold phylacteries in his hand a Torah scroll in his arm and pray, And one may not urinate with them and may not sleep with them neither a deep sleep nor a brief nap. Shmuel said: a knife, money, a bowl, loaf have a similar
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A person should not hold Tefillin in his hand and a Torah scroll in his arm and pray. And he should not urinate while wearing them, and he should not sleep in them, neither a permanent sleep nor a temporary sleep. Shmuel said: A knife, coins, a bowl, and a loaf of bread, these are equivalent to them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לֵית הִלְכְתָא כִּי הָא מַתְנִיתָא, דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי הִיא. דְּאִי בֵּית הִלֵּל — הַשְׁתָּא בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא קָבוּעַ שְׁרֵי, בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא עֲרַאי מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: Rava said Rav Sheshet said: The halakha is not in accordance with this baraita , because it Beit Shammai. As if Beit Hillel, now permitted is it necessary a makeshift bathroom?
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Sheshet said: The halakha is not in accordance with this Mishnah, as it is the opinion of Beit Shammai. For if it were Beit Hillel, is the fixed seat of the chair permitted now, but the temporary seat of the chair required?!

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: דְּבָרִים שֶׁהִתַּרְתִּי לְךָ כָּאן, אָסַרְתִּי לְךָ כָּאן. מַאי לָאו תְּפִילִּין? אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא בֵּית הִלֵּל: הִתַּרְתִּי לְךָ כָּאן קָבוּעַ, אָסַרְתִּי לְךָ כָּאן בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא עֲרַאי. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הָא לָא שָׁרוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי?
human_translation: raised an objection Matters which I permitted you here, I prohibited you there. What, is it not phylacteries? Granted, if you say Beit Hillel, I permitted you here, I have prohibited you there, makeshift bathroom. But if you hold Beit Shammai, they did not permit anything
llm_translation: Challenger: Words that I permitted to you here, I prohibited to you here. What is the reason? Is it not regarding Tefillin?
